spell.name: Accelerando

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to six willing creatures

You play a complex and quick up-tempo piece that gradually gets faster and more complex, instilling the targets with its speed. You cannot cast another spell with material components while concentrating on this spell.
Until the spell ends, targets gain cumulative benefits the longer you maintain concentration on this spell (including the turn you cast it).

items.name: 1 Round
entries: Double Speed.

items.name: 2 Rounds
entries: +2 bonus to armour.

items.name: 3 Rounds
entries: Incoming reflex attacks have disadvantage.

items.name: 4 Rounds
entries: An additional action each turn. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
When the spell ends, a target can't move until after its next turn as the impact of their frenetic speed catches up to it.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Agile Accelerando. A target's additional action can be used to escape a grapple, and targets have advantage on saves made to avoid or escape a grapple.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You may maintain concentration on this spell for an additional 2 rounds for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Acid Arrow

entries.name: Target
entries: Creature or object
A jet of acid streaks towards the target like a hissing, green arrow. Make an armour attack that deals {@dice 2d10} acid damage and on a hit, inflicts {@dice 2d4} ongoing acid damage for 1 round.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Blinding Acid Arrow. The arrow flies to the target's sensory organs seeking to damage its sight. If the spell's attack scores a major success, the target is {@condition blinded|sns} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Insidious Acid Arrow. The acid stinks and disorients as it burns. If the spell's attack scores a major success, the target is {@condition poisoned|sns} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Increase this spell's initial damage by {@dice 1d10} and ongoing damage by {@dice 1d4} per slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Acid Splash

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to two creatures within 5 feet of each other
A stinking bubble of acid is conjured out of thin air to fly at the targets. Make a reflex attack against all creatures within the area, dealing {@dice 1d6} acid damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Aid

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to three creatures
You draw upon divine power, imbuing the targets with constitution. Until the spell ends, each target increases its hit point maximum and current hit points by 6.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Stekart's Fortifying Aid. Once per round each target gains an expertise die on its first save made to resist or end a condition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The granted hit points increase by an additional 6 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Air Wave

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

Your deft weapon swing sends a wave of cutting air to assault a creature within range. Make a melee weapon attack against the target. If you are wielding one weapon in each hand, your attack deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage. Regardless of the weapon you are wielding, your attack deals slashing damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Aurana's Rapid Air Wave. If you have the Empowered Attack feature, this spell benefits from one instance of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's range increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Alarm

entries.name: Area
entries: Object or area up to 20-foot cube

You set an alarm against unwanted intrusion that alerts you whenever a creature of size Tiny or larger touches or enters the warded area. When you cast the spell, choose any number of creatures. These creatures don't set off the alarm.

Choose whether the alarm is silent or audible. The silent alarm is heard in your mind if you are within 1 mile of the warded area and it awakens you if you are sleeping. An audible alarm produces a loud noise of your choosing for 10 seconds within 60 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You may create an additional alarm for each slot level above 1st. The spell's range increases to 600 feet, but you must be familiar with the locations you ward, and all alarms must be set within the same physical structure. Setting off one alarm does not activate the other alarms.
You may choose one of the following effects in place of creating an additional alarm. The effects apply to all alarms created during the spell's casting.
Increased Duration. The spell's duration increases to 24 hours.
Improved Audible Alarm. The audible alarm produces any sound you choose and can be heard up to 300 feet away.
Improved Mental Alarm. The mental alarm alerts you regardless of your location, even if you and the alarm are on different planes of existence.

spell.name: Altered Strike
entries: You briefly transform your weapon or fist into another material and strike with it, making a melee weapon attack against a target within your reach.

The attack becomes goverened by your spellcasting ability, and your melee weapon attack counts as if it were made with a different material for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to attacks and damage: either bone, bronze, cold iron, steel, stone, or wood.
When you reach 5th level, you can choose silver or mithral as the material.
When you reach 11th level, if you have the Empowered Attack feature, its effects apply to this cantrip. In addition, you can choose adamantine as the material.
When you reach 17th level, your attacks with this spell deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage.

spell.name: Alter Self
entries: You use magic to mold yourself into a new form.
Choose one of the options below. Until the spell ends, you can use an action to choose a different option.

items.name: Amphibian
entries: Your body takes on aquatic adaptations. You can breathe underwater normally and gain a swimming speed equal to your base Speed.

items.name: Altered State
entries: You decide what you look like.

None of your gameplay statistics change but you can alter anything about your body's appearance, including but not limited to: your heritage, 1 foot of height, weight, clothing, tattoos, piercings, facial features, sound of your voice, hair style and length, skin and eye coloration, sex, and any other distinguishing features. You cannot become a creature of a different size category, and your limb structure remains the same; for example if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become a quadruped. Until the spell ends, you can use an action to change your appearance.

items.name: Red in Tooth and Claw
entries: You grow magical natural weapons of your choice with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage which ignore resistances and immunities. These unarmed strikes deal {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage of a type determined by the natural weapon you chose; for example a tentacle deals bludgeoning, a horn deals piercing, and claws deal slashing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a spell slot of 5th-level, add the following to the list of forms you can adopt.

items.name: Greater Natural Weapons
entries: The damage dealt by your natural weapon increases to {@dice 2d6}, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with these natural weapons.

items.name: Mask of the Grave
entries: You adopt the appearance of a skeleton or zombie (your choice). Your type changes to undead, and mindless undead creatures ignore your presence, treating you as one of their own. You don't need to breathe and you become immune to poison.

items.name: Wings
entries: A pair of wings sprouts from your back. The wings can appear bird-like, leathery like a bat or dragon's wings, or like the wings of an insect. You gain a fly speed equal to your base Speed.

spell.name: Angel Paradox

entries.name: Target
entries: One non-celestial creature

The target is bombarded with a fraction of energy stolen from some slumbering, deific source, immediately taking 40 radiant DoT damage. This spell ignores resistances but does not ignore immunities. A creature killed by this spell does not decay and cannot become undead for the spell's duration. Days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit of spells such as raise dead. This effect ends early if the corpse takes necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage and duration increase to 45 radiant damage and 1 year when using an 8th-level spell slot, or 50 damage and until dispelled when using a 9th-level spell slot.

spell.name: Animal Friendship

entries.name: Target
entries: Beast that you can see that is able to hear you and has Intelligence 3 or less
You allow your inner beauty to shine through in song and dance whether to call a bird from its tree or a badger from its sett. Make a will attack against the target, with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: You gain an expertise die on the first Animal Handling check related to the target that you make before the end of your next turn.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends or one of your companions harms it (whichever is sooner), the target is {@condition charmed|sns}.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition dominated|sns}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Lasting Animal Friendship. So long as the target has a CR equal to or less than half your proficiency bonus, the spell's duration becomes permanent until it is dispelled or you cast this spell again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Choose one additional target for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Animal Messenger

entries.name: Target
entries: Tiny beast

You call a Tiny beast to you, whisper a message to it, and then give it directions to the message's recipient. It is now your messenger. Specify a location you have previously visited and a recipient who matches a general description, such as “a person wearing a pointed red hat in Barter Town” or “a half-orc in a wheelchair at the Striped Lion Inn.” Speak a message of up to 25 words. For the duration of the spell, the messenger travels towards the location at a rate of 50 miles per day for a messenger with a flying speed, or else 25 miles without.

When the messenger arrives, it delivers your message to the first creature matching your description, replicating the sound of your voice exactly. If the messenger can't find the recipient or reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the beast makes its way back to where you cast this spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Indiscriminate Animal Messenger.
The spell can target any Tiny creature of Intelligence 3 or less.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The duration of the spell increases by 48 hours for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Animate Dead

entries.name: Target
entries: Corpse or pile of bones of a Medium or Small creature
You animate a mortal's remains to become your undead servant.
If the spell is cast upon bones you create a {@creature skeleton}, and if cast upon a corpse you choose to create a {@creature skeleton} or a {@creature zombie}. The DM has the undead's statistics.

While it is within 60 feet you can use a bonus action to mentally command the undead. When you command multiple undead using this spell, you must give them all the same command. You may decide the action the undead takes and where it moves during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as guarding an area. If not given a command, the undead only defends itself. The undead continues to follow a command until its task is complete.
The undead is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any commands. You must cast this spell on the undead before the spell ends to maintain control of it for another 24 hours.
Casting the spell in this way reasserts control over up to 4 of your previously-animated undead instead of animating a new one.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Komanov's Chilling Animate Dead. Unarmed attacks by undead created using this spell deal cold damage instead of bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You create or reassert control over 2 additional undead for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Animate Objects

entries.name: Target
entries: One unattended, nonmagical object up to Huge size
The target comes to life at your command just like you dreamt of when you were an apprentice!
Until the spell ends or the target is reduced to 0 hit points, you animate the target and turn it into a construct under your control.

The construct has Intelligence 3, Wisdom 3, and Charisma 1, as well as a flying speed of 30 feet and the ability to hover (if securely fastened to something larger, it has a Speed of 0), and blindsight to a range of 30 feet (blind beyond that distance). Otherwise the construct's statistics are determined by its size.

You can use a bonus action to mentally command the construct made with this spell while it is within 500 feet.  You decide the action the construct takes and where it moves during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as guarding an area. Without commands the construct only defends itself. The construct continues to follow a command until its task is complete.

When you command the construct to attack, it makes a single slam melee weapon attack against a creature adjacent to it. The attack deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage appropriate to its shape.
When the construct drops to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal object form.
The construct has the following major effect: The target's armour is reduced by 1 for 1 round.

spell.name: Antilife Shell

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius sphere

A barrier that glimmers with an oily rainbow hue pops into existence around you. The barrier moves with you and prevents creatures other than undead and constructs from passing or reaching through its surface.
The barrier does not prevent spells or attacks with ranged or reach weapons from passing through the barrier.
The spell ends if you move so that a Tiny or larger living creature is forced to pass through the barrier.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Nevard's Repelling Antilife Shell. When the spell would force a living creature to pass through the barrier, that creature is harmlessly pushed back into a space of its choosing outside of the sphere and adjacent to its original position.

spell.name: Antimagic Field

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius sphere

An {@condition invisible} sphere of antimagic forms around you, moving with you and suppressing all magical effects within it. At the DM's discretion, sufficiently powerful artifacts and deities may be able to ignore the sphere's effects.

entries.name: Area Suppression
entries: When a magical effect protrudes into the sphere, that part of the effect's area is suppressed. For example, the ice created by a {@spell wall of ice|sns} is suppressed within the sphere, creating a gap in the wall if the overlap is large enough.

entries.name: Creatures and Objects
entries: While within the sphere, any creatures or objects created or conjured by magic temporarily wink out of existence, reappearing immediately once the space they occupied is no longer within the sphere.

entries.name: Dispel Magic
entries: The sphere is immune to {@spell dispel magic|sns} and similar magical effects, including other antimagic field spells.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: While within the sphere, magic items function as if they were mundane objects.
Magic weapons and ammunition cease to be suppressed when they fully leave the sphere.

entries.name: Magical Travel
entries: Whether the sphere includes a destination or departure point, any planar travel or teleportation within it automatically fails. Until the spell ends or the sphere moves, magical portals and extradimensional spaces (such as that created by a bag of holding) within the sphere are closed.

entries.name: Spells
entries: Any spell cast within the sphere or at a target within the sphere is suppressed and the spell slot is consumed. Active spells and magical effects are also suppressed within the sphere. If a spell or magical effect has a duration, time spent suppressed counts against it.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Leska's Denying Antimagic Field. This spell's range increases to 30 feet, but your concentration on the spell ends when you move.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Stekart's Steadfast Antimagic Field. Creatures that are within the area when the spell is cast gain temporary hit points equal to your level plus your proficiency bonus.
These temporary hit points last while they are within the spell's area.

spell.name: Antipathy/Sympathy

entries.name: Target
entries: Huge or smaller object, creature, or 200-foot cube

You mystically impart great love or hatred for a place, thing, or creature. Designate a kind of intelligent creature, such as dragons, goblins, or vampires. The target now causes either antipathy or sympathy for the specified creatures for the duration of the spell. When a designated creature successfully saves against the effects of this spell, it immediately understands it was under a magical effect and is immune to this spell's effects for 1 minute.

items.name: Antipathy
entries: When a designated creature can see the target or comes within 60 feet of it, the creature makes a save, becoming {@condition frightened|sns} of the target on a fail. While {@condition frightened|sns} the creature must use half its movement to move away from the target to the nearest safe spot from which it can no longer see the target. If the creature moves more than 60 feet from the target and can no longer see it, the creature is no longer {@condition frightened|sns}, but the creature becomes {@condition frightened|sns} again if it regains sight of the target or moves within 60 feet of it.

items.name: Sympathy
entries: When a designated creature can see the target or comes within 60 feet of it, the creature must succeed on a save. On a fail, the creature uses half its movement on each of its turns to enter the area or move within reach of the target, and is unwilling to move away from the target.
If the target damages or otherwise harms an affected creature, the affected creature can make a save to end the effect.

An affected creature can also make a save to end the effect once every 24 hours while within the area of the spell, and whenever it ends its turn more than 60 feet from the target and is unable to see the target.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Roav's Fiendish Antipathy/Sympathy. A fiend has disadvantage on its first save against an effect caused by this spell.

spell.name: Arcane Eye
entries: Until the spell ends, you create an {@condition invisible}, floating magical eye that hovers in the air and sends you visual information. The eye has normal vision, darkvision to a range of 30 feet, and it can look in every direction.

You can use an action to move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction as long as it remains on the same plane of existence. The eye can pass through openings as small as 1 inch across but otherwise its movement is blocked by solid barriers.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Soliogn's Sharpshooting Arcane Eye. Until the spell ends, you have advantage on spell armour attacks you make against targets you can see with the eye.

m.text: a mushroom-shaped piece of wood inside a universal joint

spell.name: Arcane Hand

entries.name: Target
entries: Unoccupied space that you can see
You create a Large hand of shimmering, translucent force that mimics the appearance and movements of your own hand.
The hand doesn't fill its space and has 5 Armour, 8 Fortitude, 0 Reflex, 0 Will, Strength 26 (+8), Dexterity 10 (+0), a standard DC of 18, and hit points equal to your hit point maximum.
The spell ends early if it is dropped to 0 hit points.
When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can move the hand up to 60 feet and then choose one of the following.

items.name: Shove
entries: The hand makes a save to try and shove a creature adjacent to it, with advantage if the creature is Medium or smaller. On a success, the hand pushes the creature in a direction of your choosing for up to 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to 5 times your spellcasting ability modifier, and remains within 5 feet of it.

items.name: Smash
entries: Make a melee spell armour attack against a creature or object adjacent to the hand that deals {@dice 4d8} force damage.

items.name: Snatch
entries: The hand makes a save to try and grab a creature adjacent to it, with advantage if the creature is Medium or smaller. On a success, the creature is {@condition grappled|sns} by the hand. You can use a bonus action to crush a creature {@condition grappled|sns} by the hand, dealing bludgeoning DoT damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

items.name: Stop
entries: Until the hand is given another command it moves to stay between you and a creature of your choice, providing you with three-quarters cover against the chosen creature. A creature with a Strength score of 26 or less cannot move through the hand's space, and stronger creatures treat the hand as difficult terrain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage from Smash increases by {@dice 2d8} and the damage from Snatch increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Arcane Lock

entries.name: Target
entries: Closed entryway or container

The target is sealed to all creatures except those you designate (who can open the object normally). Alternatively, you may choose a password that suppresses this spell for 1 minute when it is spoken within 5 feet of the target. The spell can also be suppressed for 10 minutes by casting knock on the target. Otherwise, the target cannot be opened normally and it is more difficult to break or force open, increasing the DC to break it or pick any locks on it by 10 (minimum DC 20).

m.text: gold dust worth at least 25 gold, consumed by the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Increase the DC to force open the object or pick any locks on the object by an additional 2 for each slot level above 2nd. Only a knock spell cast at a slot level equal to or greater than your arcane lock suppresses it.

spell.name: Arcane Muscles
entries: Your muscles swell with arcane power. They're too clumsy to effectively wield weapons but certainly strong enough for a powerful punch. Until the spell ends, you can choose to use your spellcasting ability score for Athletics checks, and for the governing ability of unarmed strikes. In addition, your unarmed strikes deal {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage and ignore resistance and immunity to bludgeoning damage.
The damage this spell grants your unarmed attacks increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Arcane Riposte

time.condition: which you take when a creature makes a melee armour attack against you

entries: You respond to an incoming attack with a magically-infused attack of your own. Make an armour attack against the creature that attacked you that deals {@dice 3d6} acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kasvarina's Unsettling Arcane Riposte. When you deal 10 or more damage, the target is {@condition rattled|sns} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage for each slot level above 1st. When using a 4th-level spell slot, you may choose to deal psychic, radiant, or necrotic damage. When using a 6th-level spell slot, you may choose to deal force damage.

spell.name: Arcane Sword
entries: You summon an insubstantial yet deadly sword to do your bidding.
A target of your choice adjacent to the sword takes {@dice 3d4} force DoT damage.
Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on subsequent turns to move the sword up to 20 feet to a space you can see and deal the damage again to a similar target.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Bloody Arcane Sword. The spell's damage is reduced to {@dice 2d4} and when a creature is damaged by the spell it makes a save or it suffers a level of {@condition fatigue|sns}.

spell.name: Arcanist's Magic Aura

entries.name: Target
entries: Willing creature or an unattended object
You craft an illusion to deceive others about the target's true magical properties.
Choose one or both of the following effects. When cast upon the same target with the same effect for 30 successive days, it lasts until it is dispelled.

items.name: False Aura
entries: A magical target appears nonmagical, a nonmagical target appears magical, or you change a target's magical aura so that it appears to belong to a school of magic of your choosing. Additionally, you can choose to make the false magic apparent to any creature that handles the item.

items.name: Masking Effect
entries: Choose a creature type.

Spells and magical effects that detect creature types (such as a herald's Divine Sense or the trigger of a symbol spell) treat the target as if it were a creature of that type. Additionally, you can choose to mask the target's alignment trait (if it has one).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a 6th-level spell slot or higher the effects last until dispelled with a bonus action.

spell.name: Aspect of the Moon
entries: You throw your head back and howl like a beast, embracing your most basic impulses. Until the spell ends your hair grows, your features become more feral, and sharp claws grow on your fingers. You gain a +1 bonus to armour, your Speed increases by 10 feet, you have advantage on Perception checks, and the damage die of your unarmed attacks is {@dice 1d8} and they deal slashing damage. You may choose either Strength or Dexterity to govern your unarmed attacks. Additionally, you gain an instance of the Empowered Attack feature for your unarmed attacks. If you are hit by a silvered weapon, you must make a save, losing concentration on a fail.

spell.name: Astral Projection

entries.name: Target
entries: Self and up to 8 willing creatures within reach while not on the Astral Plane

Until the spell ends, the targets leave their material bodies ({@condition unconscious|sns} and in a state of suspended animation, not aging or requiring food or air) and project astral forms that resemble their mortal forms in nearly all ways, keeping their game statistics and possessions.

While in this astral form you trail a tether, a silvery-white cord that sprouts from between your shoulder blades and fades into immateriality a foot behind you. As long as the tether remains intact you can find your way back to your material body.
When it is cut — which requires an effect specifically stating that it cuts your tether — your soul and body are separated and you immediately die.

Damage against and other effects on your astral form have no effect on your material body either during this spell or after its duration ends. Your astral form travels freely through the Astral Plane and can pass through interplanar portals on the Astral Plane leading to any other plane. When you enter a new plane or return to the plane you were on when casting this spell, your material body and possessions are transported along the tether, allowing you to return fully intact with all your gear as you enter the new plane.

The spell ends for all targets when you use an action to dismiss it, for an individual target when a successful {@spell dispel magic|sns} is cast upon its astral form or material body, or when either its material body or its astral form drops to 0 hit points. When the spell ends for a target and the tether is intact, the tether pulls the target's astral form back to its material body, ending the suspended animation.
If the spell ends for you prematurely, other targets remain in their astral forms and must find their own way back to their bodies (usually by dropping to 0 hit points).

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Swift Astral Projection. While in astral form your Speed is tripled and you can use a bonus action to Dash.

m.text: one jacinth worth 1,000 gold per creature affected and one ornately carved silver bar worth at least 100 gold per creature affected, all consumed by the spell

spell.name: Augury
entries: With the aid of a divining tool, you receive an omen from beyond the Material Plane about the results of a specific course of action that you intend to take within the next 30 minutes. The Narrator chooses from the following:

items: Fortunate omen (good results)
Calamity omen (bad results)
Ambivalence omen (both good and bad results)
No omen (results that aren't especially good or bad)

entries: This omen does not account for possible circumstances that could change the outcome, such as making additional preparations.

When you cast this spell again before finishing a long rest, the chance of getting a random reading from the above options increases. The Narrator makes the following roll in secret: second casting— 25%, third casting—50%, fourth casting—75%, fifth casting—100%.

m.text: divinatory items worth at least 25 gold

spell.name: Awaken

entries.name: Target
entries: Huge or smaller beast or plant with Intelligence 3 or less.

You impart sentience in the target, granting it an Intelligence of 10 and proficiency in a language you know. A plant targeted by this spell gains the ability to move, as well as senses identical to those of a human. The DM assigns awakened plant statistics (such as an {@creature awakened shrub} or {@creature awakened tree}). The target is {@condition charmed|sns} for 30 days or until you or your companions harm it. Depending on how you treated the target while it was {@condition charmed|sns}, when the condition ends the awakened creature may choose to remain friendly to you.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Aurana's Augmented Awaken. When cast at higher levels, add 30 days to the charm effect of this spell for every 2 slot levels above 5th.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Slippery Awaken. Oozes can be targeted by this spell.

m.text: an intricately carved agate worth at least 1,000 gold, consumed by the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target an additional creature for each slot level above 5th. Each target requires its own material component.

spell.name: Bane

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to three creatures

The senses of the targets are filled with phantom energies that make them more vulnerable and less capable. Make a will attack against the targets with the following outcomes:Until the spell ends, a {@dice d4} is subtracted from attack rolls and saving throws made by a target.

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target's armour attack rolls are reduced by 1 for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, the target subtracts a {@dice d4} from their armour attack rolls, and a {@dice d4} is added to non-armour attack rolls against them.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the dice change to {@dice d6}s.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Beshala's Unnerving Bane. Targets affected by this spell are {@condition rattled|sns}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Tormenting Bane. The next attack that can cause the {@condition frightened|sns} condition against a target affected by this spell has advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You target an additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Banishment

duration.amount: 1d4+2 rounds; the Narrator rolls in secret

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You employ sheer force of will to make reality question the existence of a nearby creature, causing them to warp visibly in front of you. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition debilitated|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, a target native to your current plane is banished to a harmless demiplane and {@condition dazed|sns}. At the end of the duration the target reappears in the space it left (or the nearest unoccupied space). A target native to a different plane is instead banished to its native plane.

The target can make passive saves to return early, but it has a -1 penalty to these saves for each round it has spent banished. If the spell ends before its maximum duration, the target reappears in the space it left (or the nearest unoccupied space) but otherwise a target native to a different plane doesn't return.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but if the target returns early, it is {@condition debilitated|sns} for the remainder of the spell's duration.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Komanov's Icy Displeasure. Until the spell ends, the target is vulnerable to cold damage and it has disadvantage on ability checks and armour attack rolls.

m.text: an item worth at least 2 gold the target finds distasteful, consumed by the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The duration of banishment increases by 1 round for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Barkskin

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
The target's skin takes on the texture and appearance of bark, increasing its armour to 3 (unless its armour is already higher).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The target's armour increases by +1 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Battlecry Ballad

entries.name: Target
entries: Any number of creatures

You fill your allies with a thirst for glory and battle using your triumphant rallying cry. Expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die to determine the number of rounds you can maintain concentration on this spell (minimum 1 round). Each target gains a bonus to armour attack and damage rolls equal to the number of rounds you have maintained concentration on this spell (maximum +4).
You cannot cast another spell through your spellcasting focus while concentrating on this spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Courageous Battlecry Ballad. Targets gain an expertise die on saves against fear.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You can maintain concentration on this spell for an additional round for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Beacon of Hope

entries.name: Target
entries: Any number of creatures
The targets are filled with hope and vitality.

Until the spell ends, each target gains advantage on death saves and all will attacks against them have disadvantage, and when a target receives healing it regains the maximum number of hit points possible.

spell.name: Bestow Curse

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is cursed to take 1 additional necrotic damage from your attacks for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Choose one of the below curse effects. The curse lasts on the target until the spell ends. At the DM's discretion you may create a different curse with this spell so long as it is weaker than the predefined options.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you can choose two curse effects instead.
Curse effect options:

items: Select one ability score; the target has disadvantage on ability checks using that ability score.
The target makes armour attack rolls against you with disadvantage.
At the start of each of its turns, the target makes a save. On a fail, it is {@condition debilitated|sns} for that turn.
Your damaging attacks deal an additional 1d8 necrotic damage against the target.

entries: A {@spell remove curse|sns} spell ends the spell if the spell slot used to cast it is equal to or greater than the spell slot used to cast bestow curse.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Beshela's Enduring Bestow Curse. The spell's duration is permanent, it no longer requires your concentration, and the curse cannot be dispelled.
The curse is only removed when a specific condition is met such as absorbing the scale of a red dragon, ingesting ambrosia, swimming in a mythical waterway, or performing an act of supreme heroism.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 4th-level spell slot the duration increases to 10 minutes. When using a 5th-level spell slot the duration increases to 8 hours and it no longer requires your concentration. When using a 7th-level spell slot the duration is 24 hours.

spell.name: Black Tentacles

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot square

Writhing black tentacles fill the ground within the area turning it into difficult terrain. The area also becomes a persistent zone that deals {@dice 2d4} bludgeoning DoT damage and forces targets to make a save, becoming {@condition restrained|sns} by the tentacles on a fail. A creature that starts its turn {@condition restrained|sns} by the tentacles takes {@dice 3d6} bludgeoning DoT damage.
A {@condition restrained|sns} creature can use its action to make an Acrobatics or Athletics check against your standard DC, freeing itself on a success.

m.text: piece of giant octopus or giant squid tentacle

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The persistent zone damage increases by {@dice 1d4} and the restrain damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every 2 slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Blade Barrier

entries.name: Area
entries: Wall, varies

You create a wall of slashing blades. The wall can be up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick, and can either be a straight wall up to 100 feet long or a ringed wall of up to 60 feet in diameter. The wall provides three-quarters cover and its area is difficult terrain.
The wall is a persistent zone that deals {@dice 4d10} slashing DoT damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Bless

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to three creatures

The blessing you bestow upon the targets makes them more durable and competent. Until the spell ends, a {@dice d4} is added to armour attack rolls made by a target, and a {@dice d4} is subtracted from non-armour attack rolls against it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Blight

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or plant
Necrotic energies drain moisture and vitality from the target. Make a fortitude attack against the target that deals {@dice 9d8} necrotic damage. Undead and constructs are immune to this spell.

The attack has advantage against a plant creature or magical plant and deals the maximum damage possible from this spell. A nonmagical plant targeted does not require an attack rolls and instead automatically withers until dead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Blindness/Deafness

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Make a fortitude attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until either the spell ends or the target passes a passive save, the target is {@condition blinded|sns} or {@condition deafened|sns} (your choice).

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target also loses all forms of sense, including true sight.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blink
entries: Until the spell ends, roll {@dice 1d20} at the end of each of your turns. When you roll an 11 or higher you disappear and reappear in the Ethereal Plane (if you are already on the Ethereal Plane, the spell fails and the spell slot is wasted). At the start of your next turn you return to an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of where you disappeared from. If no unoccupied space is available within range, you reappear in the nearest unoccupied space (determined randomly when there are multiple nearest choices). As an action, you can dismiss this spell.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear into the plane you were originally on out to a range of 60 feet, but everything is obscured by mist and in shades of gray. You can only target and be targeted by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane.
Creatures on your original plane cannot perceive or interact with you, unless they are able to interact with the Ethereal Plane.

spell.name: Blood-Writ Bargain

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

This spell creates a pact which is enforced by celestial or fiendish forces. You and another willing creature commit to a mutual agreement, clearly declaring your parts of the agreement during the casting.

Until the spell ends, if for any reason either participant breaks the agreement or fails to uphold their part of the bargain, beings of celestial or fiendish origin appear within unoccupied spaces as close as possible to the participant who broke the bargain. The beings are hostile to the deal-breaking participant and attempt to kill them, as well as any creatures that defend them. When the dealbreaking participant is killed, or the spell's duration ends, the beings disappear in a flash of smoke. The spellcaster chooses whether the beings are celestial or fiendish while casting the spell, and the DM chooses the exact creatures summoned (such as a {@creature couatl} or 5 {@creature imp||imps}). There may be any number of beings, but their combined Challenge Rating can't exceed 5.

m.text: drop of blood from both participants

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The combined Challenge Rating of summoned beings increases by 2 and the duration increases by 13 days for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blur
entries: Until the spell ends, you are shrouded in distortion and your image is blurred. Creatures make armour attack rolls against you with disadvantage unless they have senses that allow them to perceive without sight or to see through illusions (like blindsight or truesight).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You may target an additional willing creature you can see within range for each slot level above 2nd. Whenever an affected creature other than you is hit by an armour attack, the spell ends for that creature. When using a higher level spell slot, increase the spell's range to 30 feet.

spell.name: Burning Hands

entries.name: Area
entries: 15-foot cone

A thin sheet of flames shoots forth from your outstretched hands. Make a reflex attack against each creature in the area dealing {@dice 3d6} fire damage. The fire ignites any flammable unattended objects in the area.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Inverted Burning Hands. The spell deals cold damage instead of fire damage, the attack is a fortitude attack instead of a reflex attack, and the area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute as it is covered in hoarfrost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Calculate
entries: You instantly know the answer to any mathematical equation that you speak aloud. The equation must be a problem that a creature with Intelligence 20 could solve using nonmagical tools with 1 hour of calculation. Additionally, you gain an expertise die on Engineering checks made during the duration of the spell.
Note: Using the calculate cantrip allows a player to make use of a calculator at the table in order to rapidly answer mathematical equations.

spell.name: Calculated Retribution
entries: You surround yourself with a dampening magical field and collect the energy of a foe's attack to use against them. When you are hit by a weapon armour attack, you can end the spell to halve the attack's damage against you, gaining a retribution charge that lasts until the end of your next turn. By expending the retribution charge when you hit with a melee weapon attack, you deal an additional {@dice 2d10} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You may use your reaction to halve the damage of a weapon armour attack against you up to a number of times equal to the level of the spell slot used, gaining a retribution charge each time that lasts until 1 round after the spell ends.

spell.name: Call Lightning

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

A 60-foot radius storm cloud that is 10 feet high appears in a space 100 feet above you. If there is not a point in the air above you that the storm cloud could appear, the spell fails (such as if you are in a small cavern or indoors).

On the round you cast it, and as an action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can call down a bolt of lightning to a point directly beneath the cloud. Make a ranged spell reflex attack against each creature adjacent to the point that deals {@dice 4d8} lightning damage.
If you are outdoors in a storm when you cast this spell, you take control of the storm instead of creating a new cloud and the spell's damage is increased by {@dice 2d8}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Chill Call Lightning. This spell's silent and purple lightning strikes deal cold damage and don't damage objects or leave marks on bodies.
The spell has no vocalized component.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Calm Emotions

entries.name: Target
entries: Humanoids in the area

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere
Strong and harmful emotions are suppressed within the area. Make a will attack against each unwilling target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 round, or until it is attacked or sees its allies being attacked.

items.name: Standard success
entries: You can choose one of the below effects to apply to the target.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you do not need to maintain concentration on the spell.

items: Suppress the {@condition charmed|sns} and {@condition frightened|sns} conditions, though they resume when the spell ends (time spent suppressed counts against a condition's duration).

Suppress hostile feelings towards creatures of your choice until the spell ends. This suppression ends if a target is attacked or sees its allies being attacked. Targets act normally when the spell ends. If the target missed atleast one turn of combat while suppressed, they immediately take a turn when the spell ends. This does not affect initiative order.

entries: If a target is willing, automatically use the standard success outcome against them without making an attack roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell area increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ceremony

entries.name: Target
entries: One or more corpses, one or more creatures, or one creature

You perform a religious ceremony during the casting time of this spell. When you cast the spell, you choose one of the following effects, any targets of which must be within range during the entire casting.

Funeral: You bless one or more corpses, acknowledging their transition away from this world. For the next week, they cannot become undead by any means short of a {@spell wish|sns} spell. This benefit lasts indefinitely regarding undead of CR 1/4 or less. A corpse can only benefit from this effect once.

Guide the Passing: You bless one or more creatures within range for their passage into the next life. For the next 7 days, their souls cannot be trapped or captured by any means short of a {@spell wish|sns} spell. Once a creature benefits from this effect, it can't do so again until it has been restored to life.

Offering: The gifts of the faithful are offered to the benefit of the gods and the community. Choose one skill or tool proficiency and target a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus that are within range. When a target makes an ability check using the skill or tool within the next week, it can choose to use this benefit to gain an expertise die on the check. A creature can be targeted by this effect no more than once per week.
Purification: A creature you touch is washed with your spiritual energy. Choose one disease or possession effect on the target. The target makes a save, ending the effect on a success.

Rite of Passage: You shepherd one or more creatures into the next phase of life, such as in a child dedication, coming of age, marriage, or conversion ceremony. These creatures gain inspiration. A creature can benefit from this effect no more than once per year.

m.text: 25 gold worth of incense, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Chain Lightning

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or object (primary) and up to three additional

You fire a bolt of electricity at the primary target. Make a reflex attack against it that deals {@dice 9d10} lightning damage. Electricity arcs to up to 3 additional targets you choose that are within 30 feet of the primary target, and you also make the same attack against each of them. These additional targets must have line of sight from the primary target.

m.text: three pins, piece of glass, piece of fur

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: An extra arc leaps from the primary target to an additional target for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Charm Monster

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You do not require line of sight to the target and this spell's attack against it has disadvantage if you or your companions are fighting it. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: Your next Charisma check made towards the target before the end of your next turn gains an expertise die.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, the target is {@condition charmed|sns} and friendly towards you.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition dominated|sns}.
The spell ends if you or your companions do anything harmful towards the target. The target knows it was affected by the spell when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 4th, you affect one additional target that is within 30 feet of other targets.

spell.name: Charm Person

entries.name: Target
entries: One humanoid

You do not need line of sight to the target so long as they can sense you. Make a will attack against the target, which has disadvantage if you or your companions are fighting the target. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: Your next Charisma check made towards the target before the end of your next turn gains an expertise die.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, the target is {@condition charmed|sns} and friendly towards you.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition dominated|sns}.
The spell ends if you or your companions do anything harmful towards the target. The target knows it was {@condition charmed|sns} by you when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 1st, you affect one additional target that is within 30 feet of other targets.

spell.name: Chill Touch

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You reach out with a spectral hand that carries the chill of death. Make an armour attack that deals {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage. On a hit, the target cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn. The hand remains visibly clutching onto the target for the duration. If the target you hit is undead, it makes attack rolls against you with disadvantage until the end of your next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Circle of Death

entries.name: Area
entries: 60-foot radius sphere
A sphere of negative energy sucks life from the area.
Make a fortitude attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 10d6} necrotic damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Roav's Reanimating Circle of Death. Creatures killed by this spell rise as {@creature zombie||zombies} at the start of your next turn. These zombies have 1 hit point, they are not under your control, and they attack the nearest living creature.

m.text: shards of a black pearl worth at least 500 gold

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Circular Breathing
entries: You begin carefully regulating your breath so that you can continue playing longer or keep breathing longer in adverse conditions.

Until the spell ends, you can breathe underwater, and you can utilize bardic performances that would normally require breathable air. In addition, you have advantage on saves against gases and environments with adverse breathing conditions, and attacks from similar sources have disadvantage against you.
The duration of this spell increases when you reach 5th level (10 minutes), 11th level (30 minutes), and 17th level (1 hour).

spell.name: Clairvoyance

entries.name: Target
entries: Location familiar to you (a place visited or seen before) or an obvious and unfamiliar location (behind a door, around a corner, and so on)
An {@condition invisible} sensor is created within the spell's range. The sensor remains there for the duration, and it cannot be targeted or attacked.
Choose seeing or hearing when you cast the spell.
You may use that sense through the sensor as if you were there. As an action, you may switch which sense you are using through the sensor.
A creature able to see {@condition invisible} things (from the {@spell see invisibility|sns} spell or truesight, for instance) sees a 4-inch diameter glowing, ethereal orb.

m.text: focus worth at least 100 gold such as a crystal ball or a golden horn

spell.name: Clone

entries.name: Target
entries: One living creature
This spell grows a duplicate of the target that remains inert indefinitely as long as its vessel is sealed.
The clone grows inside the sealed vessel and matures over the course of 120 days. You can choose to have the clone be a younger version of the target.

Once the clone has matured, when the target dies its soul is transferred to the clone so long as it is free and willing. The clone is identical to the target (except perhaps in age) and has the same personality, memories, and abilities, but it is without the target's equipment. The target's original body cannot be brought back to life by magic since its soul now resides within the cloned body.

m.text: diamond worth at least 1,000 gold and at least 1 cubic inch of flesh from the target, consumed by the spell; vessel worth at least 2,000 gold which can be sealed and is large enough to hold the target

spell.name: Cloudkill

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere
You create a sphere of poisonous, sickly green fog, which can spread around corners but not change shape. The area is heavily obscured. A strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell early.
Until the spell ends, the area becomes a persistent zone that deals {@dice 4d6} poison DoT damage.

The fog moves away from you 10 feet at the start of each of your turns, flowing along the ground. The fog is thicker than air, sinks to the lowest level in the land, and can even flow down openings and pits.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Cobra's Spit
entries: Until the spell ends, you can use an action to spit venom, making a ranged spell armour attack at a creature or object within 30 feet. The venom deals {@dice 4d8} poison damage and if the target is a creature, it is {@condition poisoned|sns} until the end of its next turn on a hit.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Vomitous Cobra's Spit. You can use an action to end the spell early, taking {@dice 4d8} poison DoT damage and spewing a 15-foot cone of poison. Make an area spell reflex attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 9d8} poison damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Colour Spray

entries.name: Target
entries: The creature in the area with the fewest hit points

entries.name: Area
entries: 15-foot cone
A blast of dazzling multicolored light flashes from your hand to cause the target to become {@condition blinded|sns} until the start of your next turn.

m.text: pinch of red, yellow, and blue colored sand or powder

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Add an additional target with the next-fewest hit points in the area for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Command

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
This spell does not require line of sight so long as the target can sense you. Make a will attack against the target, with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: You gain an expertise die on the first Persuasion check you make against the target before the end of your next turn.

items.name: Standard success
entries: On its next turn the target follows a one-word command of your choosing. The spell fails if the target is undead, if it does not understand your command, or if the command is immediately harmful to it.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the command can be comprised of two words.
Below are example one-word commands, but at the Narrator's discretion you may give any one-word command.
Approach | Come | Here: At the start of its turn, the target uses its movement to move towards you by the shortest route until it is adjacent to you.
Bow | Grovel | Kneel: At the start of its turn, the target falls {@condition prone|sns}.
Drop: At the start of its turn, the target drops anything it is holding.
Flee | Run: At the start of its turn, the target uses its movement to move away from you as far as it can.
Halt: The target is {@condition sluggish|sns}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 1st, you affect one additional target that is within 30 feet of other targets.

spell.name: Commune
entries: You contact your deity, a divine proxy, or a personified source of divine power and ask up to 3 questions that could be answered with a yes or a no. You must complete your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question, unless the being does not know. When the being does not know, you receive “unclear” as an answer. The being does not try to deceive, and the DM may offer a short phrase as an answer if necessary.
When you cast this spell again before finishing a long rest, the chance of getting a no answer increases.
The DM makes the following roll in secret:
second casting — 25%, third casting — 50%, fourth casting — 75%, fifth casting — 100%.

m.text: incense and vial of holy or unholy water

spell.name: Commune with Nature

entries.name: Area
entries: Special
Until the spell ends, your spirit bonds with that of nature and you learn about the surrounding land.

When cast outdoors the spell reaches 3 miles around you, and in natural underground settings it reaches only 300 feet. The spell fails if you are in a heavily constructed area, such as a dungeon or town.
You learn up to 3 facts of your choice about the surrounding area:

items: Terrain and bodies of water
Common flora, fauna, minerals, and peoples
Any unnatural creatures in the area
Weaknesses in planar boundaries
Built structures

spell.name: Comprehend Languages
entries: You gain a +10 bonus on Insight checks made to understand the meaning of any spoken language that you hear, or any written language that you can touch. Typically interpreting an unknown language is a DC 20 check, but the Narrator may use DC 15 for a language closely related to one you know, DC 25 for a language that is particularly unfamiliar or ancient, or DC 30 for a lost or dead language. This spell doesn't uncover secret messages or decode cyphers, and it does not assist in uncovering lies.

m.text: ribbon with symbols of different languages written upon it

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The bonus increases by +5 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cone of Cold

entries.name: Area
entries: 60-foot cone
Frigid cold blasts from your hands. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 9d8} cold damage. Creatures killed by this spell become frozen statues until they thaw.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Soliogn's Cubed Cone of Cold. The spell's area becomes a 30-foot cube. Any buildings or structures entirely in the area take double damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Confusion

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius sphere
You assault the minds of your targets, filling them with delusions. Make a will attack against each target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition frightened|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition confused|sns} until either the spell ends or they pass a passive save.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target reduces their confusion {@dice d8} rolls by one outcome tier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's area increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Conjure Animals
entries: You call forth a bestial spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Bestial Spirit|sns} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an environment: Air, Land, or Water. The creature resembles an animal of your choice that is native to the chosen environment, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.
The creature is an ally to you and your companions. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Use the higher spell slot level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Conjure Celestial
entries: You summon a creature from the realms celestial.

This creature uses the statistics of a {@creature celestial creature|sns} (detailed below) with certain traits determined by your choice of its type: an angel of battle, angel of protection, or angel of vengeance.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions.
It obeys your verbal commands. Without such commands, the creature only defends itself.

The creature disappears when reduced to 0 hit points. If your concentration is broken before the spell ends, you lose control of the celestial creature, which becomes hostile and might attack you and your companions. An uncontrolled creature disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 7th the celestial creature's armour increases by 0.5 (rounded down), its hit points increase by 11, and its damaging attacks deal {@dice 1d4} extra damage.

spell.name: Conjure Elemental
entries: You summon a creature from the Elemental Planes. This creature uses the statistics of a {@creature conjured elemental|sns} creature with certain traits determined by your choice of its type: air, earth, fire, or water.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions.
It obeys your verbal commands. Without such commands, the creature only defends itself.

The creature disappears when reduced to 0 hit points. If your concentration is broken before the spell ends, you lose control of the elemental creature, which becomes hostile and might attack you and your companions. An uncontrolled creature disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

m.text: a 10-foot cube of air, earth, fire, or water as appropriate

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 5th the elemental creature's armour increases by 0.5 (rounded down), its hit points increase by 11, and its attacks deal {@dice 1d4} extra damage.

spell.name: Conjure Fey
entries: You summon a creature from The Dreaming.
This creature uses the statistics of a {@creature fey creature|sns} with certain traits determined by your choice of its type: hag, hound, or redcap.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions.
It obeys your verbal commands. Without such commands, the creature only defends itself.

The summoned creature disappears when reduced to 0 hit points. If your concentration is broken before the spell ends, you lose control of the summoned creature, which becomes hostile and might attack you and your companions. An uncontrolled creature disappears at the end of the spell's maximum duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 6th the fey creature's armour increases by 0.5 (rounded down), its hit points increase by 11, and when its damaging attacks deal {@dice 1d4} extra damage.

spell.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
entries: You summon a creature from the Elemental Planes. This creature uses the statistics of a {@creature minor elemental|sns} with certain traits determined by your choice of its type: air, earth, fire, or water.
The summoned creature is friendly to you and your companions. It obeys your verbal commands.
Without such commands, a {@creature minor elemental|sns} only defends itself.

The summoned creature disappears when reduced to 0 hit points. If your concentration is broken before the spell ends, you lose control of the summoned creature, which becomes hostile and might attack you and your companions. An uncontrolled creature disappears at the end of the spell's maximum duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Use the higher spell slot level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Conjure Woodland Beings
entries: You summon a creature from The Dreaming. This creature uses the statistics of a {@creature woodland being|sns} with certain traits determined by your choice of its type: blink dog, satyr, or sprite.
The summoned creature is friendly to you and your companions. It obeys your verbal commands.
Without such commands, a summoned creature only defends itself.

The summoned creature disappears when reduced to 0 hit points. If your concentration is broken before the spell ends, you lose control of the summoned creature, which becomes hostile and might attack you and your companions. An uncontrolled creature disappears at the end of the spell's maximum duration.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Nevard's Naturalized Conjure Woodland Beings. This spell does not require your concentration and therefore no longer counts as a minion.

m.text: one holly berry per creature summoned

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Use the higher spell slot level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Contact Other Plane
entries: You consult an otherworldly entity, risking your very mind in the process. Make a save. On a fail, you take {@dice 6d6} psychic DoT damage and suffer four levels of {@condition strife|sns} until you finish a long rest. A {@spell greater restoration|sns} spell ends this effect. On a successful save, you can ask the entity up to 5 questions before the spell ends. When possible the entity responds with one-word answers: yes, no, maybe, never, irrelevant, or unclear. At the DM's discretion, it may instead provide a brief but truthful answer when necessary.

spell.name: Contagion

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Your touch inflicts a hideous disease. Make an armour attack with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target has disadvantage on ability checks for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: You afflict the target with a disese chosen from the list below.

The target must make a save at the end of each of its turns. After three failed saves, the disease lasts for the duration and the creature stops making saves, or after three successful saves, the creature recovers and the spell ends. A {@spell greater restoration|sns} spell or similar effect also ends the disease.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you can choose two diseases to inflict. They are tracked with separate saves.
Disease options:

items.name: Blinding Sickness
entries: The target's eyes turn milky white. It is {@condition blinded|sns} and has disadvantage on Wisdom checks, and will attacks against it have advantage.

items.name: Filth Fever
entries: The target is wracked by fever. It has disadvantage on Strength checks and attacks governed by Strength, and fortitude attacks against it have advantage.

items.name: Flesh Rot
entries: The target's flesh rots. It has disadvantage on Charisma checks and becomes vulnerable to all damage.

items.name: Mindfire
entries: The target hallucinates. During combat it is {@condition confused|sns}, it has disadvantage on Intelligence checks, and will attacks against it have advantage.

items.name: Rattling Cough
entries: The target becomes discombobulated as it hacks with body-wracking coughs. It is {@condition rattled|sns} and has disadvantage on Dexterity checks and attacks governed by Dexterity, and reflex attacks against it have advantage.

items.name: Slimy Doom
entries: The target bleeds uncontrollably. Fortitude attacks against it have advantage. Whenever it takes damage, the target is {@condition debilitated|sns} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Contingency
entries: As part of this spell, cast a spell of 5th-level or lower that has a casting time of 1 action, expending spell slots for both. The second spell must target you, and doesn't target others even if it normally would.

Describe the circumstances under which the second spell should be cast. It is automatically triggered the first time these circumstances are met. This spell ends when the second spell is triggered, when you cast contingency again, or if the material component for it is not on your person. For example, when you cast contingency with {@spell blur|sns} as a second spell you might make the trigger be when a creature targets you with an armour attack, or you might make it be when you make an attack against a creature, or you could choose for it to be when you see an ally make an attack against a creature.

m.text: gem-encrusted statuette of yourself worth 1,500 gold

spell.name: Continual Flame

entries.name: Target
entries: One object
A magical torch-like flame springs forth from the target. The flame creates no heat, doesn't consume oxygen, and can't be extinguished, but it can be covered.

m.text: ruby dust worth 50 gold, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Control Water

entries.name: Area
entries: 100-foot cube

Water inside the area is yours to command. On the round you cast it, and as an action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can choose one of the following effects. When you choose a different effect, the current one ends.

items.name: Flood
entries: The standing water level rises by up to 20 feet. The flood water spills onto land if the area includes a shore, but when the area is in a large body of water you instead create a 20-foot-tall wave. The wave travels across the area and crashes down, carrying Huge or smaller vehicles to the other side, each of which has a 25% chance of capsizing. The wave repeats on the start of your next turn while this effect continues.

items.name: Part Water
entries: You create a 20-foot wide trench spanning the area with walls of water to either side. When this effect ends, the trench slowly refills over the course of the next round.

items.name: Redirect Flow
entries: Flowing water in the area moves in a direction you choose, including up.
Once the water moves beyond the spell's area, it resumes its regular flow based on the terrain.

items.name: Whirlpool
entries: If the affected body of water is at least 50 feet square and 25 feet deep, a whirlpool forms within the area in a 50-foot wide cone that is 25 feet long. Creatures and objects that are in the area and within 25 feet of the whirlpool make an Athletics check against your standard DC or are pulled 10 feet toward it. Once within the whirlpool, checks made to swim out of it have disadvantage. The whirlpool is a persistent zone that deals {@dice 1d10} bludgeoning DoT damage and forces creatures to make a save, being pulled into the centre of the whirlpool on a fail.

spell.name: Control Weather

entries.name: Area
entries: 5-mile radius
You must be on a journey affected by weather to cast this spell.

Until the spell ends, you change the weather conditions in the area from what is normal for the current climate and season. The area's weather is rolled twice, and you can choose between either result. After each activity on a journey, you can reroll the weather again. The weather gradually returns to normal when the spell ends.

m.text: burning incense, bits of earth, and wood mixed with water

spell.name: Corpse Explosion

entries.name: Target
entries: One corpse within range

A corpse explodes in a poisonous cloud. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in a 10-foot radius of the corpse that deals {@dice 2d10} thunder damage. On a hit, a creature is {@condition poisoned|sns} for 1 minute, or until it passes a passive save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You target an additional corpse for every 2 slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Counterspell
entries: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 2nd-level or lower, its spell is countered.
The creature cannot cast the countered spell again for the next minute.
If it is casting a spell of 3rd-level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 + the spell's level). On a success, the spell is countered.

A countered spell fails and has no effect, consuming its resources as usual. When the spell is countered, the caster may then use the same action it used to cast another spell with the same casting time as the countered spell, consuming resources as required. It cannot cast the countered spell again for the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The interrupted spell is automatically countered if its level is less than the level of the spell slot used to cast this spell.

spell.name: Create Food and Water

time.condition: which you take in response to a member of your party scoring a substantial or higher success on the Harvest journey activity

entries: Your magic creates 3 rations that can each be consumed to remove one level of {@condition fatigue|sns} from the creature that eats it. The food is nourishing but bland. At the end of your next long rest, uneaten rations spoil.

m.text: serving of fresh food or water

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You create an additional 2 rations for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Create or Destroy Water

entries.name: Target
entries: Open container or 30-foot cube area
Choose one of the following.
Create Water: You fill the target with up to 10 gallons of nonpotable water or 1 Supply of clean water. Alternatively, the water falls as rain that extinguishes exposed flames in the area.
Destroy Water: You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in the target. Alternatively, you destroy fog in the area.

m.text: drop of water to create water or grains of sand to destroy it

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 1st, you either create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the cube increases by 5 feet.

spell.name: Create Undead

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to three corpses of Medium or Small humanoids
This spell cannot be cast in sunlight. You reanimate the targets as undead and transform them into {@creature ghouls} under your control.

While it is within 120 feet you can use a bonus action to mentally command the undead. When you command multiple undead using this spell, you must give them all the same command. You may decide the action the undead takes and where it moves during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as guarding an area. If not given a command, the undead only defends itself. The undead continues to follow a command until its task is complete.
The undead is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any commands. You must cast this spell on the undead before the spell ends to maintain control of it for another 24 hours.
Casting the spell in this way reasserts control over up to 3 undead you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one.

m.text: each corpse requires a clay pot filled with grave dirt, a clay pot filled with brackish water, and a black onyx stone worth 150 gold

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You create or reassert control over one additional ghoul for each slot level above 6th. Alternatively, when using an 8th-level spell slot you create or reassert control over 2 {@creature ghast||ghasts} or {@creature wight||wights}, or when using a 9th-level spell slot you create or reassert control over 3 ghasts or wights, or 2 {@creature mummy||mummies}.

spell.name: Creation
entries: You weave raw magic into a mundane physical object no larger than a 5-foot cube. The object must be of a form and material you have seen before. Using the object as a material component for another spell causes that spell to fail.
The spell's duration is determined by the object's material. An object composed of multiple materials uses the shortest duration.

m.text: tiny piece of matter of the same type of the item you plan to create

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The size of the cube increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Crushing Haymaker
entries: Your fist reverberates with destructive energy, and woe betide whatever it strikes. As part of casting the spell, make an armour attack against an adjacent creature or object that deals {@dice 7d6} thunder damage. On a major success, the target is knocked {@condition prone|sns} and {@condition debilitated|sns} until the end of its next turn. This spell's damage is doubled against objects and structures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell deals an extra {@dice 1d6} of thunder damage for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cure Wounds

entries.name: Target
