entries: One creature that is neither a construct nor undead
The target regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The hit points regained increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dancing Lights
entries: You create up to four hovering lights which appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that can be combined into a glowing Medium-sized humanoid form. Each sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. You can use a bonus action to move the lights up to 60 feet so long as each remains within 20 feet of another light created by this spell. A dancing light winks out when it exceeds the spell's range.

m.text: bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

spell.name: Darklight
entries: You create an enchanted flame that surrounds your hand and produces no heat, but sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius around you and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Only you and up to 6 creatures of your choice can see this light.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Ravjahani's Darklight. During the spell's duration, you can use an action to kindle this light on a willing creature's hand, sharing the effect with them. When the spell's duration ends, or when any of the flames are dispelled, the spell ends.

spell.name: Darkness

entries.name: Area
entries: 15-foot radius sphere

Magical darkness heavily obscures darkvision and blocks nonmagical light in the area. The darkness spreads around corners. If any of the area overlaps with magical light created by a spell of 2nd-level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

When cast on an object that is in your possession or unattended, the darkness emanates from it and moves with it. Completely covering the object with something that is not transparent blocks the darkness.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Cyneburg's Blinding Darkness. A creature that moves out of the darkness must make a save or be {@condition blinded|sns} for 1 minute, or until it passes a passive save.

m.text: bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

spell.name: Darkvision

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
The target gains darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

m.text: pinch of dried carrot or an agate

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The range of the target's darkvision increases to 120 feet. In addition, for each slot level above 3rd you may choose an additional target.

spell.name: Daylight

entries.name: Area
entries: 60-foot radius sphere
Magical light fills the area. The area is brightly lit and sheds dim light for an additional 60 feet.
If any of the area overlaps with magical darkness created by a spell of 3rd-level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled.
When cast on an object that is in your possession or unattended, the light shines from it and moves with it. Completely covering the object with something that is not transparent blocks the light.

spell.name: Deadweight

entries.name: Target
entries: Medium or smaller object
The target object's weight is greatly increased.
If a creature is holding the object, make a fortitude attack against it with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target has disadvantage on armour attack rolls for 1 round as it figures out the object's new balance.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target drops the object in a random space within 5 feet of them.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the object is dropped 10 feet away from the target.
Creatures that attempt to push, drag, or lift the object must succeed on a Brawn check against your standard DC to do so.

spell.name: Death Ward

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

The first time damage would reduce the target to 0 hit points, it instead drops to 1 hit point. If the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is negated. The spell ends immediately after either of these conditions occur.

spell.name: Delayed Blast Fireball

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere

A glowing bead of yellow light flies from your finger and lingers at a point at the center of the area until you end the spell — either because your concentration is broken or because you choose to end it — and the bead detonates. Make a reflex attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 7d12} fire damage. If at the end of your turn the bead has not yet detonated, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12}.

If touched before the spell ends, the creature touching the bead makes a save or the bead detonates. On a successful save, the creature can use an action to throw the bead up to 40 feet, moving the area with it. If the bead strikes a creature or solid object, the bead detonates.
The fire spreads around corners, and it damages and ignites any flammable unattended objects in the area.

m.text: tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Demiplane

entries.name: Target
entries: Solid flat surface

You create a shadowy door on the target. The door is large enough for Medium creatures to pass through. The door leads to a demiplane that appears as an empty, 30-foot-cube chamber made of wood or stone. When the spell ends, the door disappears from both sides, trapping any creatures or objects inside the demiplane.

Each time you cast this spell, you can either create a new demiplane, conjure the door to a demiplane you have previously created, or make a door leading to a demiplane whose nature or contents you are familiar with.

spell.name: Detect Evil and Good

entries.name: Target
entries: Self

You attempt to sense the presence of otherworldly forces. You automatically know if there is a place or object within range that has been magically consecrated or desecrated. In addition, on the round you cast it and as an action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you may make a Wisdom (Religion) check against the passive Deception score of any aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead creature within range. On a success, you sense the creature's presence, as well as where the creature is located.
The spell penetrates most barriers but is blocked by 3 feet of wood or dirt, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or a thin sheet of lead.

spell.name: Detect Magic

entries.name: Target
entries: Self
Until the spell ends, you automatically sense the presence of magic within range, and you can use an action to study the aura of a magic effect to learn its schools of magic (if any).
The spell penetrates most barriers but is blocked by 3 feet of wood or dirt, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or a thin sheet of lead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 2nd-level spell slot or higher, the spell no longer requires your concentration. When using a 3rd-level spell slot or higher, the duration increases to 1 hour. When using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, the duration increases to 8 hours.

spell.name: Detect Poison and Disease

entries.name: Target
entries: Self

On the round you cast it, and as an action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can attempt to sense the presence of poisons, poisonous creatures, and disease by making a Perception check. On a success you identify the type of each poison or disease within range. Typically noticing and identifying a poison or disease is a DC 10 check, but the DM may use {@dc 15} for uncommon afflictions, {@dc 20} for rare afflictions, or {@dc 25} for afflictions that are truly unique. On a failed check, this casting of the spell cannot sense that specific poison or disease.
The spell penetrates most barriers but is blocked by 3 feet of wood or dirt, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or a thin sheet of lead.

spell.name: Detect Thoughts

entries.name: Target
entries: Self

On the round you cast it, and as an action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can probe the mind of a creature within range that speaks at least one language with an Intelligence score of at least 4 to read its thoughts. Make a will attack against the creature with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: You may ask one question about the creature's statistics, and then may not probe that creature's mind again until the spell ends.

items.name: Standard success
entries: You learn the creature's surface thoughts - what is most on its mind in that moment. Conversation naturally shapes the course of a creature's thoughts and what it is thinking about may change based on questions verbally directed at it. Then, the spell ends.

items.name: Major success
entries: As standard success, but you probe deeper into the creature's mind. You gain insight into the creature's motivations, emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind. The creature then becomes aware you are proving its mind and can use an action to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check, ending the spell if it succeeds.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As major success, but the creature does not become aware of your probing. If the creature passes a passive save, the spell ends.
Additionally, you can use an action to scan for thinking creatures within range that you can't see.
Once you detect the presence of a thinking creature, so long as it remains within range you can attempt to read its thoughts as described above (even if you don't have line of sight to it).
The spell penetrates most barriers but is blocked by 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of common metal, or a thin sheet of lead.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Diogenes' Specific Detect Thoughts. You can scan the thoughts of all creatures within range and locate one creature currently thinking about a single subject you choose when you cast the spell. You can read its thoughts as described in the spell's description. This spell does not reveal the creature having these thoughts, and until you determine which creature it is you cannot shape the course of its thoughts so the information you receive may be limited.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 5th-level spell slot, increase the spell's range to 1 mile. When using a 7th-level spell slot, increase the range to 10 miles.
When using a 9th-level spell slot, increase the range to 1,000 miles.

spell.name: Dimension Door
entries: You teleport to any place you can see, visualize, or describe by stating distance and direction such as 200 feet straight downward or 400 feet upward at a 30-degree angle to the southeast.

You can bring along objects if their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller, provided it isn't carrying gear beyond its carrying capacity and is within 5 feet.
If you would arrive in an occupied space the spell fails, and you and any creature with you each take {@dice 4d6} force DoT damage.

spell.name: Disguise Self
entries: Until the spell ends or you use an action to dismiss it, you and your gear are cloaked by an illusory disguise that makes you appear like another creature of your general size and body type, including but not limited to: your race, 1 foot of height, weight, clothing, tattoos, piercings, facial features, hair style and length, skin and eye coloration, sex, and any other distinguishing features. You cannot disguise yourself as a creature of a different size category, and your limb structure remains the same; for example if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to appear as a quadruped.

The disguise does not hold up to physical inspection. A creature that tries to grab an illusory hat, for example, finds its hand passes straight through the figment. To see through your disguise without such an inspection, a creature must use its action to make an Investigation check against your standard DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 3rd-level spell slot or higher, this spell functions identically to the {@spell seeming|sns} spell, except the spell's duration is 10 minutes.

spell.name: Disintegrate

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature, object, or creation of magical force
A pale ray emanates from your pointed finger to the target as you attempt to undo it.

Make a reflex attack against the target that deals {@dice 10d6} + 40 force damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points is obliterated, leaving behind nothing but fine dust, along with anything it was wearing or carrying (except magic items).
This spell automatically disintegrates nonmagical objects and creations of magical force that are Large-sized or smaller.
Larger objects and creations of magical force have a 10-foot-cube portion disintegrated instead.
Magic items are unaffected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 3d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Dispel Evil and Good
entries: A nimbus of power surrounds you, making you more able to resist and destroy beings from beyond the realms material.
Until the spell ends, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead have disadvantage on armour attack rolls against you.
You can end the spell early by using an action to do either of the following.

items.name: Mental Resistance
entries: Choose up to 3 friendly creatures within 60 feet. Each of those creatures that is {@condition charmed|sns}, {@condition frightened|sns}, or possessed by a celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead may make an immediate save with advantage against the condition or possession, ending it on a success.

items.name: Retribution
entries: Make a melee spell armour attack against a celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead within reach that deals {@dice 7d8} radiant or necrotic damage (your choice). On a hit, the target is {@condition debilitated|sns} until the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Leska's Dismissal. The spell also affects aberrations and dragons.

m.text: holy water or powdered silver and iron worth 25 gold

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Mental Resistance targets one additional creature for each slot level above 5th, and Retribution's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Dispel Magic

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature, object, or magical effect

You scour the magic from your target. Any spell cast on the target ends if it was cast with a spell slot of 3rd-level or lower. For spells using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, make a spellcasting ability check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level for each one, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Leska's Confiscating Dispel Magic. When you dispel a spell that was cast using a spell slot at least 2 levels lower than the one used for this spell, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot of equal level to the dispelled spell and immediately cast it at a new target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the level of the spell slot used to cast it is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot used to cast dispel magic.

spell.name: Divination
entries: Your offering and magic put you in contact with the higher power you serve or its representatives.

You ask a single question about something that will (or could) happen in the next 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply, which may be cryptic or even nonverbal as appropriate to the being in question.
The reply does not account for possible circumstances that could change the outcome, such as making additional precautions.

When you cast this spell again before finishing a long rest, the chance of getting a random reading increases. The DM makes the following roll in secret: second casting— 25%, third casting—50%, fourth casting—75%, fifth casting—100%.

m.text: incense and sacrificial offering worth at least 25 gold appropriate to the higher power, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Divine Favour
entries: You imbue divine power into your strikes. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra {@dice 1d4} radiant damage with your weapon attack hits.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sigismund's Spiteful Divine Favour. You deal extra necrotic damage instead of extra radiant damage, and when rolling extra damage from this spell you reroll any results of 1 (you must use the new result).

spell.name: Divine Word

entries.name: Target
entries: Any number of creatures within range
You utter a primordial imprecation that brings woe upon your enemies. A target suffers an effect based on its current hit points.

items: Fewer than 50 hit points: {@condition deafened|sns} for 1 minute.
Fewer than 40 hit points: {@condition blinded|sns} and {@condition deafened|sns} for 10 minutes.
Fewer than 30 hit points: {@condition debilitated|sns}, {@condition blinded|sns}, and {@condition deafened|sns} for 1 hour.
Fewer than 20 hit points: instantly killed outright.

entries: Additionally, when a celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend is affected by this spell it is immediately forced back to its home plane and for 24 hours it is unable to return to your current plane by any means less powerful than a {@spell wish|sns} spell. Such a creature does not suffer this effect if it is already on its plane of origin.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Leska's Imprecating Divine Word. The spell's additional effect also targets aberrations and dragons, sending them to a harmless demiplane.

spell.name: Dominate Beast

entries.name: Target
entries: One beast

You assert control over the target's mind. Make a will attack against the target, which has disadvantage if the target is engaged in combat with you or creatures friendly to you. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition charmed|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition dominated|sns} for the duration.
Each time the target takes damage, it makes a save, ending the spell on a success.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target has advantage on attack rolls against creatures of your choice.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's duration is extended: 5th-level — Concentration (10 minutes), 6th-level — Concentration (1 hour), 7th-level — Concentration (8 hours).

spell.name: Dominate Monster

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
As {@spell dominate beast|sns} but you may target any creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The duration is Concentration (8 hours)

spell.name: Dominate Person

entries.name: Target
entries: One humanoid
As {@spell dominate beast|sns} but you may target any humanoid.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's duration is extended: 6th-level — Concentration (10 minutes), 7th-level — Concentration (1 hour), 8th-level — Concentration (8 hours).

spell.name: Dramatic Sting

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You frighten the target by echoing its movements with ominous music and terrifying sound effects. Make a will attack against the target that deals {@dice 1d4} psychic damage. On a hit, the target becomes {@condition frightened|sns} until either the spell ends or it passes a passive save.
Whenever the target fails its passive save to end the fear, it takes {@dice 1d4} psychic DoT damage.
You cannot cast another spell requiring a material component while concentrating on this spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Subtle Dramatic Sting. When you cast this spell, make a Performance check opposed by the target's Perception check. On a success, the target is affected by the spell but does not realize it is being targeted by a spell. Each round at the start of its turn, the target gains an expertise die on a Perception check made against the result of your Performance check to realize it has been targeted by a spell.

m.text: broken violin string and a wasp's stinger

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dream

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature that is known to you and on the same plane

Until the spell ends, you manipulate the dreams of another creature. You designate a messenger, which may be you or a willing creature you touch, to enter a trance. The messenger remains aware of its surroundings while in the trance but cannot take actions or move.

If the target is sleeping the messenger appears in its dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep and the spell remains active. The messenger can also manipulate the dream, creating objects, landscapes, and various other sensory sensations. The messenger can choose to end the trance at any time, ending the spell. The target remembers the dream in perfect detail when it wakes. The messenger knows if the target is awake when you cast the spell and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to fall asleep, at which point the spell works as described.

You can choose to let the messenger terrorize the target. The messenger can deliver a message of 10 words or fewer and you make a will attack against the target. This attack has advantage if you have a portion of the target's body (some hair or a drop of blood). The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target recovers no hit points from the rest when it wakes up.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Echoes of the messenger's fearful aspect create a nightmare that lasts the duration of the target's sleep and prevents it from gaining any benefits from the rest. In addition, upon waking the target suffers a level of {@condition fatigue|sns} or {@condition strife|sns} (your choice), up to a maximum of 3 in either condition.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target gains a level of both {@condition fatigue|sns} and {@condition strife|sns}.
Creatures that don't sleep or don't dream (such as elves) cannot be contacted by this spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Aurana's Terrible Dream. When you choose to terrorize a target, the attack's success tier is increased by 1. You may also convey a message of up to 25 words as part of terrorizing it (rather than 10 words).

m.text: sand, ink, and a writing quill plucked from a sleeping bird

spell.name: Druidcraft
entries: You call upon your mastery of nature to produce one of the following effects within range:

items: You create a minor, harmless sensory effect that lasts for 1 round and predicts the next 24 hours of weather in your current location. For example, the effect might create a miniature thunderhead if storms are predicted.
You instantly make a plant feature develop, but never to produce food. For example, you can cause a flower to bloom or a seed pod to open.
You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect such as the sound of running water, birdsong, or the smell of mulch. The effect must fit in a 5-foot cube.
You instantly ignite or extinguish a candle, torch, smoking pipe, or small campfire.

spell.name: Earth Barrier

time.condition: which you take when you are targeted with a ranged armour attack

entries: Choose an unoccupied space between you and the source of the attack which triggers the spell. You call forth a pillar of earth or stone (3 feet diameter, 20 feet tall, 0 in all defences, 22 hit points) in that space that provides you with three-quarters cover.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Crystal Pillar. The pillar summoned by this spell is made of translucent crystal. If this spell causes an attack to no longer target you, the attack hits the pillar instead. If this pillar is destroyed, every creature within 5 feet of it takes {@dice 2d6} piercing DoT damage.

spell.name: Earthquake

entries.name: Target
entries: A point on the ground within range

entries.name: Area
entries: 100-foot radius circle centered on the target
You create a seismic disturbance in the spell's area.
Until the spell ends, an intense tremor rips through the ground and shakes anything in contact with it.
The ground in the spell's area becomes difficult terrain as it warps and cracks.
When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend concentrating on it, each creature in contact with the ground in the spell's area must make a save or be knocked {@condition prone|sns}.
Additionally, any creature that is concentrating on a spell while in contact with the ground in the spell's area must make a save or lose concentration.
At the DM's discretion, this spell may have additional effects depending on the terrain in the area.

items.name: Fissures
entries: Fissures open within the spell's area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of {@dice 1d6} such fissures open in locations you choose. Each is {@dice 1d10} x 10 feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the spell's area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens makes a save, falling in on a fail. On a successful save, a creature moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.
A structure automatically collapses if a fissure opens beneath it (see below).

items.name: Structures
entries: A structure in contact with the ground in the spell's area takes 50 bludgeoning DoT damage when you cast the spell and again at the start of each of your turns while the spell is active. A structure reduced to 0 hit points this way collapses.

Creatures within half the distance of a collapsing structure's height must pass a save or take {@dice 5d6} bludgeoning DoT damage, be knocked {@condition prone|sns}, and be buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Acrobatics or Athletics check as an action to escape. A creature inside (instead of near) a collapsing structure has disadvantage on its save. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower depending on the composition of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone|sns} or become buried.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Soliogn's Tempestuous Earthquake. The spell fills the area with violent winds. A flying creature halves its speed while in the area and makes a save at the start of each of its turns, falling {@condition prone|sns} on a fail.

spell.name: Eldritch Cube
entries: A black, nonreflective, incorporeal 10-foot cube appears in an unoccupied space that you can see. Its space can be in midair if you so desire. The area is a persistent zone that deals {@dice 2d10} psychic DoT damage.
As a bonus action, you can move the cube up to 10 feet in any direction to a space you can see. The cube cannot be made to pass through other creatures in this way.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Stunning Eldritch Cube. A creature that takes 15 or more damage from this spell is {@condition debilitated|sns} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Enhance Ability

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You bestow a magical enhancement on the target. Choose one of the following effects for the target to receive until the spell ends.

items: Bull's Strength: The target has advantage on Strength checks and adds its Strength modifier an additional time to its Brawn checks.
Cat's Grace: The target has advantage on Dexterity checks and it reduces any falling damage it takes by 10 unless it is {@condition unconscious|sns}.
Eagle's Splendor: The target has advantage on Charisma checks and is instantly cleaned (as if it had just bathed and put on fresh clothing).
Fox's Cunning: The target has advantage on Intelligence checks and on checks using gaming sets.
Owl's Wisdom: The target has advantage on Wisdom checks and it gains darkvision to a range of 30 feet (or extends its existing darkvision by 30 feet).

m.text: fur or feather from a beast

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Enlarge/Reduce

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or object that is not being worn or carried within range
You cause the target to grow or shrink. If the target is unwilling, you must make a fortitude attack against them with the following outcomes.

items.name: Minor success
entries: Armour attacks against the target have advantage for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: You can choose one of the below effects to apply to the target.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you do not need to maintain concentration on the spell.
If the target is willing, you automatically effect them with the standard success outcome without making an attack.
If the target is a creature, all items worn or carried by it also change size with it, but an item dropped by the target immediately returns to normal size.

items.name: Enlarge
entries: Until the spell ends, the target's size increases by one size category. Its size doubles in all dimensions and its weight increases eightfold. The target also has advantage on Strength checks and fortitude attacks made against it have disadvantage. Its weapons also enlarge, dealing an extra {@dice 1d4} damage.

items.name: Reduce
entries: Until the spell ends, the target's size decreases one size category. Its size is halved in all dimensions and its weight decreases to one-eighth of its normal value. The target has disadvantage on Strength checks and fortitude attacks against it have advantage. Its weapons also shrink, dealing {@dice 1d4} less damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a spell slot of 4th-level, you can cause the target and its gear to increase by two size categories—from Medium to Huge, for example. Until the spell ends, the target's size is quadrupled in all dimensions, multiplying its weight twentyfold. The target has advantage on Strength checks and fortitude attacks against it have disadvantage. Its weapons also enlarge, dealing an extra {@dice 2d4} damage.

spell.name: Enrage Architecture

entries.name: Target
entries: One artificial nonmagical structure with a foundation area of no more than 3,000 square feet.

You animate and enrage a target building that lashes out at its inhabitants and surroundings. As a bonus action you may command the target to open, close, lock, or unlock any nonmagical doors or windows, or to thrash about and attempt to crush its inhabitants. While the target is thrashing, any creature inside or within 30 feet of it takes {@damage 1d10 + 5} bludgeoning DoT damage. When the spell ends, the target returns to its previous state, magically repairing any damage it sustained during the spell's duration.

m.text: stone or timber removed from a structure at least 100 years old

spell.name: Entangle

entries.name: Target
entries: A point on the ground within range

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot square centered on the target

Constraining plants erupt from the ground in the spell's area, wrapping vines and tendrils around creatures. Until the spell ends, the area is difficult terrain. When you cast the spell, make a fortitude attack against all creatures in the area, with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target becomes {@condition restrained|sns} for 1 round as the plants wrap around it.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target becomes {@condition restrained|sns} as the plants wrap around it. A creature {@condition restrained|sns} in this way can use its action to make a Brawn check against your standard DC, freeing itself on a success.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition debilitated|sns}.
When the spell ends, the plants wither away.

spell.name: Enthrall

entries.name: Target
entries: Any number of creatures you choose within range

You weave a compelling stream of words that captivates your targets. Make a will attack against each target, automatically scoring a critical failure against any target that can't be {@condition charmed|sns}. You have disadvantage on the attack against targets fighting you or creatures friendly to you. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: Until the spell ends, the target has a -1 penalty to Perception checks made to perceive any creature other than you.

items.name: Standard success
entries: As minor success, but the target has disadvantage on those Perception checks instead of -1.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target automatically fails those Perception checks instead.
The spell ends if you are {@condition incapacitated|sns} or can no longer speak, and its effects end on a target if that target can no longer hear you.

spell.name: Etherealness
entries: Until the spell ends or you use an action to end it, you step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane where it overlaps with your current plane.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can move in any direction, but vertical movement is considered difficult terrain. You can see and hear the plane you originated from, but everything looks desaturated and you can see no further than 60 feet.
While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane.
Creatures not on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive you unless some special ability or magic explicitly allows them to.

When the spell ends, you immediately return to the plane you originated from in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and you take force DoT damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.
The spell has no effect if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as an Outer Plane.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You can target up to 3 willing creatures within 10 feet (including you) for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Expeditious Retreat
entries: Until the spell ends, you're able to move with incredible speed. When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can take the Dash action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Your Speed increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Eyebite
entries: Your eyes become an inky void imbued with fell power. Make a will attack against one creature of your choice within 60 feet of you with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: THe target has disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is afflicted by one the effects described below for the duration.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you can choose two of the effects.
Until the spell ends, on each of your turns you can use an action to target a creature that this casting of eyebite has not already scored a minor success or lower against.
Effect options:

items.name: Asleep
entries: The target falls {@condition unconscious|sns}, waking if it takes any damage or another creature uses an action to rouse it.

items.name: Panicked
entries: The target is {@condition frightened|sns}. On each of its turns, the {@condition frightened|sns} creature uses half its movement to move away from you by the safest and shortest available route unless there is nowhere for it to move.
If the target moves to a place at least 60 feet away from you where it can no longer see you, this effect ends.

items.name: Sickened
entries: The target has disadvantage on armour attack rolls and ability checks. It can end this effect by passing a passive save.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Beshela's Devious Eyebite. Your eyes glow with a soft purple light. You gain an additional option: The target is {@condition charmed|sns}. On each of its turns while it is {@condition charmed|sns}, you may beckon it (no action required) to force the target to move closer to you by the shortest, safest route.

spell.name: Fabricate
entries: You convert raw materials into finished items of the same material. For example, you can fabricate a pitcher from a lump of clay, a bridge from a pile of lumber or group of trees, or rope from a patch of hemp.

When you cast the spell, select raw materials you can see within range. From them, the spell fabricates a Large or smaller object (contained within a single 10-foot cube or up to eight connected 5-foot cubes) given a sufficient quantity of raw material. When fabricating with metal, stone, or another mineral substance, the fabricated object can be no larger than Medium (contained within a single 5-foot cube). The quality of any objects made with the spell is equivalent to the quality of the raw materials.

Creatures or magic items can't be created or used as materials with this spell. It also may not be used to create items that require highly-specialized craftsmanship such as equipment, clockworks, glass, or jewelry unless you have proficiency with the type of artisan's tools needed to craft such objects.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Diogenes' Skilled Fabricate. Spectral artisan's tools of your choosing appear in your hands as you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you gain proficiency with these tools. Each time you cast it, you may choose a different set of tools.

spell.name: Faerie Fire

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot cube within range
Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in light (your choice of color). Additionally, make a reflex attack against all creatures in the area with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target cannot benefit from invisibility for 1 round, but is not outlined in light.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, the target is outlined in light.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition staggered|sns}.
Until the spell ends, outlined objects and creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.
Any armour attack roll against an outlined object or creature has advantage. The outline also negates the benefits of invisibility on affected creatures and objects.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Beshela's Rattling Faerie Fire. When an affected creature is damaged by a weapon armour attack it takes {@dice 1d4} additional psychic damage and is {@condition rattled|sns} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Faithful Hound

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius
You conjure a phantasmal watchdog. Until the spell ends, the hound remains in the area unless you spend an action to dismiss it or you move more than 100 feet away from it.

The hound is {@condition invisible} except to you and can't be harmed. When a Small or larger creature enters the area without speaking a password you specify when casting the spell, the hound starts barking loudly.
The hound sees {@condition invisible} creatures, can see into the Ethereal Plane, and is immune to illusions.
At the start of each of your turns, the hound bites a hostile creature of your choice that is within the area, dealing {@dice 2d8} piercing DoT damage, treated as if it were your own damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Stekart's Obedient Faithful Hound. You can use a bonus action to move the area up to 30 feet.
You may do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, after which you cannot move the area any more for this casting of the spell.

m.text: silver whistle, piece of bone, and a thread

spell.name: False Life
entries: You are bolstered with fell energies resembling life, gaining {@dice 1d4+5} temporary hit points that last until the spell ends.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kasvarina's Resolute False Life. While you have temporary hit points from this spell, you subtract a {@dice d4} from attacks made against you that can {@condition frightened|sns|frighten}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Gain an additional 6 temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Fear

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot cone
You project a phantasmal image into the minds of each creature in the area showing them what they fear most. Make a will attack against each of them with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target immediately drops whatever it is holding.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target becomes {@condition frightened|sns} until either the spell ends or the it passes a passive save, and it must drop whatever it is holding.

On each of its turns, a creature {@condition frightened|sns} by this spell uses half its movement to move away from you by the safest available route. If there is nowhere it can move, it remains stationary. When the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature can make a save, ending the spell's effects on it on a success.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition debilitated|sns}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Aurana's Feast of Fear. The spell affects every creature within 30 feet of you. When you first cast the spell and again at the start of each of your turns, you gain temporary hit points equal to double the number of {@condition frightened|sns} creatures within 30 feet of you.

spell.name: Feather Fall

time.condition: which you take when you or a creature within range falls

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to five falling creatures within range

Magic slows the descent of each target. Until the spell ends, a target's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round. If a target lands before the spell ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, ending the spell for that target.

m.text: a small feather or pinch of down

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 2nd-level spell slot, targets can move horizontally 1 foot for every 1 foot they descend, effectively gliding through the air until they land or the spell ends.

spell.name: Feeblemind

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You blast the target's mind, attempting to crush its intellect and sense of self. The target takes {@dice 4d6} psychic DoT damage.
Then, make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target has disadvantage on spell attacks for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends the target's Intelligence and Charisma scores are both reduced to 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way, but it is still able to recognise, follow, and even protect its allies.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target's Wisdom score is also reduced to 1.
At the end of every 30 days, the creature can make a save against this spell, ending it on a success.
{@spell Greater restoration|sns}, {@spell heal|sns}, or {@spell wish|sns} can also be used to end the spell.

m.text: handful of clay, crystal, glass, or mineral spheres

spell.name: Find Familiar
entries: Your familiar, a spirit that takes the form of any CR 0 beast of Small or Tiny size, appears in an unoccupied space within range. It has the statistics of the chosen form, but is your choice of a celestial, fey, or fiend (instead of a beast).

Your familiar is an independent creature that rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn in combat (but cannot take the Attack action). However, it is loyal to you and always obeys your commands.
When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it vanishes without a trace. Casting the spell again causes it to reappear.

You are able to communicate telepathically with your familiar when it is within 100 feet. As long as it is within this range, you can use an action to see through your familiar's eyes and hear through its ears until the beginning of your next turn, gaining the benefit of any special senses it has. During this time, you are {@condition blinded|sns|blind} and {@condition deafened|sns|deaf} to your body's surroundings.
You can use an action to either permanently dismiss your familiar or temporarily dismiss it to a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons.
While it is temporarily dismissed, you can use an action to call it back, causing it to appear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.
You can't have more than one familiar at a time, but if you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you can cause it to adopt a different form.
Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of Touch and your familiar is within 100 feet of you, it can deliver the spell as if it was the spellcaster.
Your familiar must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. The spell still uses your statistics.

m.text: 10 gold worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be burned in a brass brazier

spell.name: Find Steed
entries: You summon a spirit that takes the form of a loyal mount, creating a lasting bond with it. You decide on the steed's appearance, and choose whether it uses the statistics of an elk, giant lizard, panther, warhorse, or wolf (the DM may offer additional options.) Its statistics change in the following ways:

items: Its type is your choice of celestial, fey, or fiend.
Its size is your choice of Medium or Large.
Its Intelligence is 6.
You can communicate with it telepathically while it's within 1 mile.
It understands one language that you speak.

entries: While mounted on your steed, when you cast a spell that targets only yourself, you may also target the steed.

When you use an action to dismiss the steed, or when it drops to 0 hit points, it temporarily disappears. Casting this spell again resummons the steed, fully healed and with all conditions removed. You can't summon a different steed unless you spend an action to release your current steed from its bond, permanently dismissing it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The steed has an additional 22 hit points for each slot level above 2nd. When using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, you may grant the steed either a swim speed or fly speed equal to its base Speed.

spell.name: Find the Path

entries.name: Target
entries: Self

Name a specific, immovable location that you have visited before. If no such location is within range, the spell fails. For the duration, you know the location's direction and distance. While you are traveling there, you have advantage on ability checks made to determine the shortest path.

m.text: object worth at least 1 silver and from the target location

spell.name: Find Traps
entries: This spell reveals whether there is at least one trap within range and within line of sight. You don't learn the number, location, or kind of traps detected. For the purpose of this spell, a trap is a hidden mechanical device or magical effect which is designed to harm you or put you in danger, such as a pit trap, symbol spell, or alarm bell on a door, but not a natural hazard.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Diogenes' Reactive Find Traps. When you cast the spell, choose a point within 10 feet. The spell triggers {@dice 1d4} traps in a 5-foot radius around that point.

spell.name: Finger of Death

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

Negative energy wracks the target. Make a fortitude attack against the target that deals {@dice 10d6} + 33 necrotic damage. A humanoid killed by this spell turns into a {@creature zombie} at the start of your next turn. It is permanently under your control and follows your spoken commands.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Cyneburg's Shadowed Finger of Death. This spell's duration is 1 hour. You can store the spell harmlessly on a willing creature, causing an inky stain to appear on its finger. That creature can make a melee weapon or spell armour attack to deliver the spell to a target, replacing its usual fortitude attack.
The spell ends once the attack has been made.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 3d6} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Fireball

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere
A fiery mote streaks to a point within range and explodes in a burst of flame. The fire spreads around corners and ignites unattended flammable objects.
Make a reflex attack agains each creature in the area that deals {@dice 5d8} fire damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Katrina's Improved Fireball. The fireball deals {@dice 7d8} fire damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Ravjahani's Shadow Fireball. This spell's silent black flames deal necrotic damage and don't damage objects or leave marks on bodies. Any nonmagical flames in the area are extinguished.
The spell has no vocalized component.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fire Bolt

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or object

You cast a streak of flame at the target. Make an armour attack that deals {@dice 1d10} fire damage. An unattended flammable object is ignited. This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

entries.name: Rare
entries: Katrina's Hellish Fire Bolt. This spell's damage ignores fire resistance and treats a creature's immunity to fire damage as 50% resistance to fire damage.

spell.name: Fire Shield
entries: Until the spell ends, flames envelop your body, casting bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can use an action to end the spell early. Choose one of the following options:

items.name: Chill Shield
entries: You have 50% resistance to fire damage. A creature adjacent to you takes {@dice 2d8} cold DoT damage when it hits you with a melee weapon attack.

items.name: Warm Shield
entries: You have 50% resistance to cold damage. A creature adjacent to you takes {@dice 2d8} fire DoT damage when it hits you with a melee weapon attack.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Katrina's Enhancing Fire Shield. While this spell is active, any cantrips you cast that deal fire damage deal an extra {@dice 1d8} fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The duration increases to 1 hour when using a 6th-level spell slot, or 8 hours when using an 8th-level spell slot.

spell.name: Fire Storm

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

Flames roar. Make an attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 10d8} fire damage. Objects in the area also take this damage and are ignited if unattended and flammable. If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected. This spell's area consists of a contiguous group of ten 10-foot cubes in an arrangement you choose, with each cube adjacent to at least one other cube.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Stekart's Delayed Fire Storm. This spell has a duration of 10 minutes. The flames do not immediately appear when the spell is cast. If a Small or larger creature enters the area of the spell, the flames appear and make the attack, ending the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Flame Blade
entries: A scimitar-shaped blade of fire appears in your hand, lasting for the duration. It disappears if you drop it, but you can use a bonus action to recall it. The blade casts bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for another 10 feet. You can use an action to make a melee spell armour attack with the blade that deals {@dice 3d6} fire damage. The blade cannot be used in any other way, including as part of the Attack action, as a reaction, or when triggered by a maneuver.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Nevard's Radiant Flame Blade. You transform a freshly plucked blade of grass into a scimitar-shaped blade which glows with emerald radiance. Attacks with this weapon deal radiant damage. The duration of this spell is 1 hour, and it doesn't require concentration.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Storming Flame Blade.
This spell produces a crackling white blade which deals lightning damage. Attacks with this weapon have advantage against creatures wearing metal armour.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Flame Strike

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius cylinder that is 40 feet high
A column of divine flame descends on the area. Make a reflex attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 5d6} fire damage and {@dice 5d6} radiant damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Discerning Lightning Strike. This spell deals lightning damage instead of fire damage and is a divination spell. The attack has advantage against a creature which has knowingly lied in the last minute, while a creature which has not lied is immune to the spell's damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Increase either the fire damage or the radiant damage by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Flaming Sphere
entries: A 5-foot-diameter sphere of fire appears within range, lasting for the duration. It casts bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for another 20 feet, and ignites unattended flammable objects it touches.

You can use a bonus action to move the sphere up to 30 feet. It can jump over pits 10 feet wide or obstacles 5 feet tall. If you move the sphere into a creature, the sphere ends its movement for that turn and the creature takes {@dice 1d8} fire DoT damage. A creature that ends its turn adjacent to the sphere takes the same damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Katrina's Chariot Flaming Sphere. If you are Medium or smaller you can use 5 feet of your movement to enter or exit the sphere. While inside, you can't be harmed by the sphere, you move with it when it moves, and creatures take {@dice 1d4} DoT fire damage when they hit you with a melee weapon attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Flex

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You bestow a glamor upon a creature that highlights its physique to show a stunning idealized form. For the spell's duration, the target adds its Strength modifier to any Charisma checks it makes, in addition to its Charisma modifier as usual.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Floating Disk
entries: A metallic disc made of force, 3 feet in diameter and hovering 3 feet off the ground, appears within range. It can support up to 500 pounds. If it is overloaded, or if you move more than 100 feet away from it, the spell ends. You can end the spell as an action. While it is not carrying anything, you can use a bonus action to teleport the disk to an unoccupied space within range.

While you are within 20 feet of the disk, it is immobile. If you move more than 20 feet away, it tries to follow you, remaining 20 feet away. It can traverse stairs, slopes, and obstacles up to 3 feet high.
Additionally, you can ride the disc, spending your movement on your turn to move the disc up to 30 feet (following the movement rules above).
Moving the disk in this way is just as tiring as walking for the same amount of time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When you use a 3rd-level spell slot, either the spell's duration increases to 8 hours or the disk's diameter is 10 feet, it can support up to 2,000 pounds, and it can traverse obstacles up to 10 feet high. When you use a 6th-level spell slot, the disk's diameter is 20 feet, it can support up to 16,000 pounds, and it can traverse obstacles up to 20 feet high.

spell.name: Fly

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is off the ground.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Soliogn's Swift Fly. The target gains a flying speed of 90 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fog Cloud

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere
You create a heavily obscured area of fog. The fog spreads around corners and can be dispersed by a moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour).

entries.name: Rare
entries: Ravjahani's Accompanying Fog Cloud. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to move the area of fog up to 30 feet horizontally and 5 feet vertically.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's radius increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Forbiddance

entries.name: Target
entries: Area up to 40,000 square feet and up to 30 feet tall
You protect the target area against magical travel.
Creatures can't teleport into the area, use a magical portal to enter it, or travel into it from another plane of existence, such as the Astral or Ethereal Plane.
The spell's area can't overlap with another forbiddance spell.

The spell damages specific types of trespassing creatures. Choose one or more of celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. The area is a persistent zone that deals {@dice 5d10} radiant or necrotic DoT damage (your choice when you cast the spell) against creatures of the chosen type. You may designate a password. A creature speaking this password as it enters takes no damage from the spell.
After casting this spell on the same area for 30 consecutive days it becomes permanent until dispelled. This final casting to make the spell permanent consumes its material components.

m.text: holy water, incense, and powdered ruby worth 1,000 gold

spell.name: Forcecage

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot cube
An opaque cube of banded force surrounds the area, preventing any matter or spells from passing through it, though creatures can breathe inside it.

Creatures that pass a save and creatures that are only partially inside the area are pushed out of the area. Any other creature is trapped and can't leave by nonmagical means. The cage also traps creatures on the Ethereal Plane, and can only be destroyed by being dealt at least 28 force damage at once or by a {@spell dispel magic|sns} spell cast using an 8th-level or higher spell slot.
If a trapped creature tries to teleport or travel to another plane, it makes a save.
On a fail, the attempt fails and the spell or effect is wasted.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Imprisoning Forcecage. The spell's duration is 1 day. You can pass in and out of the cage freely, and you can dispel it at any time. If you cast this spell on the same area for 3 consecutive days, it is permanent until dispelled. Each time you cast the spell, any imprisoned creature can make a save to attempt to escape.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's area increases to a 20-foot cube when using a 9th-level spell slot.

spell.name: Force of Will

time.condition: which you take in response to being hit

entries: Your iron resolve allows you to withstand an armour attack. The damage you take from the triggering attack is reduced by {@dice 2d12} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage is reduced by an additional {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Force Punch

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or object within your reach
Make an armour attack that deals {@dice 3d8} force damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Vorax-Hul's Mighty Force Punch. On a hit, the target is pushed 5 feet away from you for every 10 points of damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Foresight
entries: You impart the ability to see flashes of the immediate future. The target can't be surprised and has advantage on ability checks and armour attack rolls. Additionally, all attack rolls have disadvantage against the target.

spell.name: Forest Army
entries: While casting and concentrating on this spell, you enter a deep trance and awaken an army of trees and plants within range. These plants rise up under your control as a {@creature grove swarm|sns}. Although you are in a trance and deaf and blind with regard to your own senses, you see and hear through your grove swarm's senses. You can command your grove swarm telepathically, ordering it to advance, attack, or retreat. If the grove swarm enters your space, you can order it to carry you.
If you take any action, the spell ends and the trees and plants set down roots wherever they are currently located.

spell.name: Freedom of Movement

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

The target ignores difficult terrain. Spells and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition staggered|sns} or {@condition restrained|sns}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or grapples. The target's movement and attacks aren't penalized from being underwater.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 6th-level spell slot the duration is 8 hours. When using an 8th-level spell slot the duration is 24 hours.

spell.name: Freezing Sphere

entries.name: Area
entries: 60-foot radius sphere

A freezing globe streaks to a point within range and explodes. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 6d12} cold damage. Liquid in the area is frozen to a depth of 6 inches for 1 minute. Any creature caught in the ice can use an action to make a Brawn check against your standard DC to escape.

Instead of firing the globe, you can hold it in your hand. If you handle it carefully, it won't explode until a minute after you cast the spell. At any time, you or another creature can strike the globe, throw it up to 60 feet, or use it as a slingstone, causing it to explode on impact.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Friends

entries.name: Target
entries: One nonhostile creature

Once before the start of your next turn, when you make a Charisma ability check against the target, you gain an expertise die. If you roll a 1 on the ability check, the target realizes its judgment was influenced by magic and may become hostile.

spell.name: Gaseous Form

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature that is not incorporeal
The target, along with anything it's wearing and carrying, becomes a hovering, wispy cloud. In this form, it can't attack, use or drop objects, talk, or cast spells.

As a cloud, the target's base Speed is 0 and it gains a flying speed of 10 feet. It can enter another creature's space, and can pass through small holes and cracks, but not through liquid. It has 50% resistance to nonmagical damage, fortitude and reflex attacks against it have disadvantage, and it can't fall.
The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The target's fly speed increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Gate
entries: You create a magic portal, a door between a space you can see and a specific place on another plane of existence. Each portal is a one-sided circular opening from 5 to 25 feet in diameter. Entering either portal transports you to the portal on the other plane. Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals from opening in their domains.

When you cast this spell, you can speak the true name of a specific creature (not its nickname or title). If that creature is on another plane, the portal opens next to it and draws it through to your side of the portal. This spell gives you no power over the creature, and it might choose to attack you, leave, or listen to you.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Roav's Iron Gate. The spell is permanent until dispelled.

spell.name: Geas

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You give a command to a target which can understand you. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition charmed|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition charmed|sns}. While {@condition charmed|sns} in this way, it takes {@dice 5d10} psychic DoT damage the first time each day that it disobeys your command. Your command can be any course of action or inaction that wouldn't result in the target's death. The spell ends if the command is suicidal or you use an action to dismiss the spell. Alternatively, a {@spell remove curse|sns}, {@spell greater restoration|sns}, or {@spell wish|sns} spell cast on the target using a spell slot at least as high as the slot used to cast this spell also ends it.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the damage increases to {@dice 10d10}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's duration is 1 year when using a 7th-level spell slot, or permanent until dispelled when using a 9th-level spell slot.

spell.name: Gentle Repose

entries.name: Target
entries: One corpse
The target can't become undead and doesn't decay. Days spent under the influence of this spell don't count towards the time limit of spells which raise the dead.

m.text: a copper piece placed on each of the corpse's eyes

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's duration is 1 year when using a 3rd-level spell slot, or permanent until dispelled when using a 4th-level spell slot.

spell.name: Giant Insect

entries.name: Target
entries: One centipede or scorpion

You transform insects and other vermin into monstrous versions of themselves. Until the spell ends, a centipede becomes a {@creature giant centipede}, or a scorpion becomes a {@creature giant scorpion}. The spell ends when the target dies or when you use an action to end the effect on it.
While it is within 60 feet you can use a bonus action to mentally command the insect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's duration is 1 hour when using a 5th-level spell slot, or 8 hours when using a 6th-level spell slot.

spell.name: Glibness
entries: When you make a Charisma check, you can replace the number you rolled with 15. Also, magic that prevents lying has no effect on you, and magic cannot determine that you are lying.

spell.name: Globe of Invulnerability

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius sphere

An immobile, glimmering sphere forms around you. Any spell of 5th-level or lower cast from outside the sphere can't affect anything inside the sphere, even if it's cast with a higher level spell slot. Targeting something inside the sphere or including the globe's space in an area has no effect on anything inside.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The barrier blocks spells of one spell slot level higher for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Glyph of Warding

entries.name: Target
entries: One object or a surface no larger than 10 feet in diameter

You trace a glyph on the target. If the glyph is moved more than 10 feet from its original position, or if it comes within 20 feet of another glyph that you have cast, the spell ends. Finding the Tiny glyph requires an Investigation check against your standard DC.

Describe the actions a creature must perform to trigger the spell, such as approaching within a certain distance, opening or touching the object the glyph is inscribed on, or seeing or reading the glyph. The creature must have a clear path to the glyph to trigger it. You can specify certain creatures which don't trigger the spell, such as those with a certain appearance or those who speak a certain phrase. Once the glyph is triggered, the spell ends.
When you cast the spell, choose Explosive Runes or Spell Glyph.

items.name: Explosive Runes
entries: When triggered, the glyph explodes. Make an area reflex spell attack against each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on the glyph that deals {@dice 7d6} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice when you cast the spell). The explosion spreads around corners.

items.name: Spell Glyph
entries: You store a spell of 3rd-level or lower as part of creating the glyph, expending its spell slot. The stored spell must target a single creature or area with a non-beneficial effect and it is cast when the glyph is triggered. A spell that targets a creature targets the triggering creature.

A spell with an area is centered on the targeting creature. A creation or conjuration spell affects an area next to that creature, and targets it with any harmful effects. Spells requiring concentration last for their full duration.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Stekart's Dependable Glyph of Warding. When this spell is triggered, it doesn't end. Instead the spell's effects are suppressed for 24 hours, after which it can be triggered again.

m.text: incense and powdered diamond worth 200 gold, consumed by the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For Explosive Runes, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 3rd, and for Spell Glyph you can store a spell of up to the same level as the spell slot used to cast glyph of warding.

spell.name: Goodberry
entries: You create {@dice 2d4} berries.
For the next 24 hours, any creature that consumes one of these berries regains 2 hit points. Eating or administering a berry is an action. The berries do not provide any nourishment or sate hunger.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Beshela's Bunched Goodberry. Eating or administering any number of berries is a bonus action.

m.text: mistletoe and a handful of grass

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You create {@dice 1d4} additional berries for every 2 slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Grapevine
entries: You cause a message in Druidic to appear on a tree or plant within range which you have seen before.
You can cast the spell again to erase the message.

spell.name: Grease

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot square
Grease erupts from a point that you can see within range and coats the ground in the area, turning it into difficult terrain until the spell ends.
When the grease appears, make a reflex attack against each creature within the area with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The next melee armour attack against the target before the start of its next turn has advantage.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target falls {@condition prone|sns}.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target cannot stand until the end of its next turn.
A creature that enters or ends its turn in the area must succeed on a save or fall {@condition prone|sns}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Katrina's Flammable Grease. Until the spell ends, a creature that has been attacked by the spell or made a save for it gets grease on itself and becomes flammable. When the creature takes fire damage from a hit, it takes {@dice 1d6} ongoing fire damage until it uses an action to douse the flames.

spell.name: Greater Invisibility

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
The target is {@condition invisible}. Anything the target is carrying or wearing is also {@condition invisible} as long as it remains in the target's possession.

spell.name: Greater Restoration

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Healing energy rejuvenates a creature you touch and undoes a negative effect. You can remove one of:

items: a level of {@condition fatigue|sns}.
a level of {@condition strife|sns}.
a charm effect.
a curse or cursed item attunement.
any reduction to a single ability score.
an effect that has reduced the target's hit point maximum.

m.text: 100 gold of diamond dust, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Guards and Wards

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to 2,500 feet of floor space in up to one hundred contiguous 5-foot squares
You create wards that protect the target area.

Each warded area has a maximum height of 20 feet and can be shaped. Several stories of a stronghold can be warded by dividing the area among them if you can walk from one to the next while the spell is being cast.

When cast, you can create a password that can make a creature immune to these effects when it is spoken aloud. You may also specify individuals that are unaffected by any or all of the effects that you choose.
Guards and wards creates the following effects within the area of the spell.

items.name: Corridors
entries: Corridors are heavily obscured with fog. Additionally, creatures that choose between multiple passages or branches have a 50% chance to unknowingly choose a path other than the one they meant to choose.

items.name: Doors
entries: Doors are magically locked as if by an {@spell arcane lock|sns} spell. Additionally, you may conceal up to 10 doors with an illusion as per the illusory object component of the {@spell minor illusion|sns} spell to make the doors appear as unadorned wall sections.

items.name: Stairs
entries: Stairs are filled from top to bottom with webs as per the {@spell web|sns} spell. Until the spell ends, the webbing strands regrow 10 minutes after they are damaged or destroyed.
In addition, one of the following spell effects can be placed within the spell's area.

items: {@spell Dancing lights|sns} can be placed in 4 corridors and you can choose for them to repeat a simple sequence.
{@spell Magic mouth|sns} spells can be placed in 2 locations.
{@spell stinking cloud|sns|Stinking clouds} can be placed in 2 locations. The clouds return after 10 minutes if dispersed while the spell remains.
A {@spell gust of wind|sns} can be placed in a corridor or room.
Pick a 5-foot square. Any creature that passes through it subjected to a {@spell suggestion|sns} spell, hearing the suggestion mentally.

entries: The entirety of the warded area radiates as magic. Each effect must be targeted by separate {@spell dispel magic|sns} spells to be removed.
The spell can be made permanent by recasting the spell every day for a year.

m.text: silver rod worth 10 gold, burning incense, brimstone, and oil

spell.name: Guidance

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
The target may gain an expertise die to one ability check of its choice, ending the spell. The expertise die can be rolled before or after the ability check is made.

spell.name: Guiding Bolt

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

A bolt of light erupts from your hand. Make an armour attack against the target that deals {@dice 4d6} radiant damage. On a hit, the next armour attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has advantage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Leska's Marked Guiding Bolt. On a hit, until the end of your next turn the target glows with bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light an additional 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Gust of Wind

entries.name: Area
entries: Line 60 feet long and 10 feet wide
A torrent of wind erupts from your hand in a direction you choose. The area becomes a persistent zone that forces targets to pass a save or be pushed 15 feet from you in the direction of the line.
Any creature in the area is {@condition sluggish|sns} when trying to approach you.
The blast of wind extinguishes small fires and disperses gas or vapor.
You can use a bonus action to change the direction of the gust.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Traveling Gust of Wind. The spell targets one vehicle of Huge size or smaller that has sails and its duration increases to concentration (1 hour). Until the spell ends, the vehicle's sails are magically filled and it can travel as if it had a strong wind. Additionally, any checks made to pilot the vehicle have advantage.

spell.name: Hallow

entries.name: Area
entries: 60 foot radius

You imbue the area with divine power, bolstering some creatures and hindering others. Celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead cannot enter the area. They are also incapable of charming, frightening, or possessing another creature within the area. Any such effects end on a creature that enters the area. When casting, you may exclude one or more creature types from this effect.
Additionally, you may anchor additional magical effects to the area. Choose one effect from the list below (the DM may also offer specific effects).

Some effects apply to creatures. You may choose to affect all creatures, creatures of a specific type, or those that follow a specific leader or deity. Creatures make a save when the spell is cast, when they enter the area for the first time on a turn, or if they end their turn within the area. On a successful save, a creature is immune to the effect until it leaves the area.

items.name: Courage
entries: Creatures in the area cannot be {@condition frightened|sns}.

items.name: Darkness
entries: The area is filled by darkness, and normal light sources or sources from a lower level spell slot are smothered within it.

items.name: Daylight
entries: The area is filled with bright light, dispelling magical darkness created by spells of a lower level spell slot.

items.name: Energy Protection
entries: Creatures in the area gain 50% resistance to a damage type of your choice (excepting bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing).

items.name: Energy Vulnerability
entries: Creatures in the area gain vulnerability to a damage type of your choice (excepting bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing).

items.name: Everlasting Rest
entries: Dead bodies laid to rest in the area cannot be turned into undead by any means.

items.name: Extradimensional Interference
entries: Extradimensional movement or travel is blocked to and from the area, including all teleportation effects.

items.name: Fear
entries: Creatures are {@condition frightened|sns} while within the area.

items.name: Silence
entries: No sound can enter or emanate from the area.

items.name: Tongues
entries: Creatures within the area can freely communicate with one another whether they share a language or not.

m.text: sanctified oils and incense worth at least 1,000 gold, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Hallucinatory Terrain

entries.name: Area
entries: 150-foot cube

You weave a veil over the natural terrain within the area, making it look, sound, or smell like another sort of terrain. A small lake could be made to look like a grassy glade. A path or trail could be made to look like an impassable swamp. A cliff face could even appear as a gentle slope or seem to extend further than it does. This spell does not affect any manufactured structures, equipment, or creatures. Only the visual, auditory, and olfactory components of the terrain are changed. Any creature that enters or attempts to interact with the illusion feels the real terrain below. If given sufficient reason, a creature may make an Investigation check against your standard DC to disbelieve it. On a success, the creature sees the illusion superimposed over the actual terrain.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Ravjahani's Hallucinatory Domicile. The spell can affect manufactured structures. A crumbling and empty hut could be made to look as though it were fully furnished and well cared for, or a wellappointed room could be made to look empty.

m.text: bit of dirt from the area

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
