entries: The spell targets an additional 50-foot cube for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Harm

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You assail a target with an agonizing disease.

Make a fortitude attack against the target that deals {@dice 10d10} necrotic damage. On a hit, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken for 1 hour or until the disease is magically cured. This spell cannot reduce a target to less than 1 hit point.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Increase the damage by {@dice 2d10} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Harmonic Resonance
entries: You harmonize with the rhythm of those around you until you're perfectly in sync. You may take the Help action as a bonus action. Additionally, when a creature within 30 feet uses a Bardic Inspiration die, you may choose to reroll the die after it is rolled but before the outcome is determined.
You cannot cast another spell that requires a material component while concentrating on this spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Lasting Harmonic Resonance. The spell's effects continue for 1 round after its duration ends.

m.text: the written lyrics of a duet

spell.name: Haste

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

Until the spell ends, the target's Speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to armour, reflex attacks against it have disadvantage, and it gains one additional action on each of its turns. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
When the spell ends, the target is tired and cannot move until after its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. All targets of this spell must be within 30 feet of each other.

spell.name: Heal

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature that is neither a construct nor undead
A torrent of healing energy suffuses the target and it regains 78 hit points. The spell also ends blindness, deafness, and any diseases afflicting the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The hit points regained increase by 11 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Healing Word

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature that is neither a construct nor undead
Healing energy washes over the target and it regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The hit points regained increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Heart of Dis
entries: You magically replace your heart with one forged on the second layer of Hell. While the spell lasts, you are immune to fear and can't be {@condition poisoned|sns}, and you are immune to fire and poison damage. You gain 50% resistance to cold damage, as well as to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from weapons that aren't silvered. Non-armour spell attacks have disadvantage against you. Finally, while you are conscious, any creature hostile to you that starts its turn within 20 feet of you must make a save.
On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened|sns} of you until the start of your next turn. On a success, the creature is immune to the effect for 24 hours.
Casting this spell magically transports your mortal heart to the lair of one of the lords of Hell.
The heart returns to your body when the spell ends.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Roav's True Heart of Dis. Until the spell ends, your type changes to fiend.

m.text: replica iron heart worth at least 1,000 gold

spell.name: Heat Metal

entries.name: Target
entries: One metal object (such as a sword or a suit of metal armor)

The target becomes oven hot. Any creature touching the target takes {@dice 2d8} fire DoT damage when the spell is cast. Until the spell ends, on subsequent turns you can use a bonus action to inflict the same damage. If a creature is holding or wearing the target and suffers damage, it makes a save or it drops the target. If a creature does not or cannot drop the target, it has disadvantage on armour attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Heroes' Feast
entries: The spell summons forth a sumptuous feast with a cuisine of your choosing that provides sustenance for a number of creatures equal to twice your proficiency bonus. Consuming the food takes 1 hour and leaves a creature feeling nourished — it immediately makes a save with advantage against any disease or poison it is suffering from, it is cured of any effect that frightens it, and it recovers 1 level of {@condition fatigue|sns}.

For up to 24 hours afterward will attacks against the feast's participants have disadvantage, as do attacks that can cause disease or poison. Additionally, they gain 50% resistance to damage from poison and disease, and each increases its hit point maximum by {@dice 2d12}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Komanav's Final Heroes' Feast. Instead of receiving any benefits, 10 minutes after the food is consumed all participants other than you take {@dice 8d10} necrotic DoT damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Fantabulous Heroes' Feast. For 24 hours afterward, you gain advantage on Charisma checks made against creatures that participate in the feast.

m.text: beautifully crafted bowl worth at least 1,000 gold, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Heroism

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

The target's spirit is bolstered. Until the spell ends, the target gains temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier plus your proficiency bonus at the start of each of its turns and it cannot be {@condition frightened|sns}. Any temporary hit points remaining are lost when the spell ends.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Glowing Heroism. The target glows with bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light an additional 5 feet. When a creature within the target's glow regains hit points, it regains {@dice 1d6} additional hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Hideous Laughter

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature with an Intelligence of 5 or more
The target is overwhelmed by the absurdity of the world and is crippled by paroxysms of laughter.
Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target falls {@condition prone|sns}.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, the target falls {@condition prone|sns}, becomes {@condition dazed|sns}, and cannot stand.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition debilitated|sns}.
The target may make passive saves to end the spell's effects, and may also make an advantaged save whenever it takes damage, ending the spell on a success.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Beshala's Infectious Hideous Laughter.
Any creature that touches the target must also succeed on a save or be affected by the spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Despairing Hideous Laughter. When the mirth fades the target is affected with crushing grief, sadness, and despair, causing it to sob uncontrollably. The emotional toll of the spell causes the target to have disadvantage on the first ability check or armour attack roll it makes after the spell ends, or if a non-armour attack is made against it before that, it has advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target an additional creature within 30 feet of the original for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Hold Monster

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: Attacks against the target have advantage for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition staggered|sns} until the spell ends or it passes a passive save.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also vulnerable to all damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target an additional creature within 30 feet of the first target for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Hold Person

entries.name: Target
entries: One humanoid
Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: Attacks against the target have advantage for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition staggered|sns} until the spell ends or it passes a passive save.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also vulnerable to all damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target an additional creature within 30 feet of the first target for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Holy Aura

entries.name: Target
entries: Creatures you choose that are within the area

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius

Holy radiance emanates from you and fills the area. Targets shed dim light in a 5-foot radius and attacks against them have disadvantage. When a fiend or undead hits a target with an armour attack, the aura erupts into blinding light, forcing the attacker to make a save, becoming {@condition blinded|sns} until the spell ends on a fail.

m.text: sacred reliquary worth at least 1,000 gold

spell.name: Hypnotic Pattern

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot cube

You conjure a swirling pattern of twisting hues that roils through the air, appearing for a moment and then vanishing. Make a will attack against creatures in the area that can see the pattern with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target becomes {@condition charmed|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target becomes {@condition charmed|sns}. While {@condition charmed|sns} by this spell, the target is {@condition dazed|sns} and {@condition sluggish|sns}.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition debilitated|sns}.
The effect ends on a creature when it takes damage or when another creature uses an action to shake it out of its daze.

spell.name: Ice Storm

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius cylinder that is 40 feet high

A bombardment of jagged ice erupts throughout the target area. Make a reflex attack against all creatures in the area that deals {@dice 4d4} bludgeoning damage and {@dice 5d6} cold damage. Large chunks of ice turn the area into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Shackling Ice Storm. A creature that takes 22 or more damage is ensnared in icy shackles. An ensnared creature is {@condition grappled|sns} and takes {@dice 2d6} ongoing cold damage until it uses an action to make a save to end the effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Identify

entries.name: Target
entries: One object or creature
You learn the target object's magical properties along with how to use them. You learn what spells are affecting the targeted object (if any) along with what spells were used to create it.
Alternatively, you learn any spells that are currently affecting a targeted creature.
What this spell can reveal is at the DM's discretion, and some powerful and rare magics are immune to identify.

m.text: pearl worth at least 100 gold and a feather

spell.name: Illusory Script

entries.name: Target
entries: A piece of paper or other writing material

You inscribe a message onto the target and wrap it in illusion until the spell ends. You and any creatures that you designate when the spell is cast perceive the message as normal. You may choose to have other creatures view the message as writing in an unknown or unintelligible magical script or a different message.
If you choose to create another message, you can change the handwriting and the language that the message is written in, though you must know the language in question.
If the spell is dispelled, both the message and its illusory mask disappear.
The true message can be perceived by any creature with truesight.

spell.name: Imprisonment

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You utter the target's name and attempt to bind them for eternity. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition sluggish|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Choose from one of the forms of bindings below (each lasts until the spell ends).

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you can choose two options instead.
On a minor success or lower, the target is immune to any future attempts by you to cast this spell on it.
Binding options:

items.name: Burial
entries: The target is buried deep below the surface of the earth in a tomb just large enough to contain it. Nothing can enter the tomb. No teleportation or planar travel can be used to enter, leave, or affect the tomb or its contents.

items.name: Chaining
entries: Chains made of unbreakable material erupt from the ground and root the target in place. The target is {@condition restrained|sns} and cannot move or be moved by any means.

items.name: Hedged Prison
entries: The target is imprisoned in a maze-like demiplane of your choosing, such as a labyrinth, a cage, a tower, a hedge maze, or any similar structure you desire. The demiplane is warded against teleportation and planar travel.

items.name: Minimus Containment
entries: The target shrinks to just under an inch and is imprisoned inside a gemstone, crystal, jar, or similar object.

items.name: Slumber
entries: The target is plunged into an unbreakable slumber and cannot be awoken.
The target does not need sustenance or air, nor does it age. No divination spells of any sort can be used to reveal the target's location.

When cast, you must specify a condition that will cause the spell to end and release the target. This condition must be based on some observable action or quality and not related to mechanics like level, hitpoints, or class, and the DM must agree to it.
A {@spell dispel magic|sns} only dispels an imprisonment if it is cast using a 9th-level spell slot and targets the prison or the material component used to create the prison.
Each casting that uses the same spell effect is unique; repeated castings with the same effect free the prior occupant.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Krevan's Insidious Imprisonment. This terrifying variant of the spell is only different when using Slumber. While asleep, the target is subjected to dreams or nightmares specified by you and created by the target's own subconscious.

These nightmares seem more real than the target's memories, which become dreamlike and false, allowing you to implant false narratives, experiences, or episodes in the target's mind, changing the target's nature and turning allies into enemies or heroes into villains. Only a {@spell wish|sns} or similarly powerful effect can restore the target's memories.

m.text: picture or statue of the target worth at least 500 gold per Hit Die of the target and a special component determined by the spell's effects

spell.name: Incendiary Cloud

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere

A cloud of burning embers, smoke, and roiling flame appears within range. The cloud heavily obscures its area, spreading around corners and through cracks. When the cloud appears and a creature is in it, when a creature enters the cloud for the first time on a turn, or when a creature ends its turn within the cloud it takes {@dice 9d6} fire DoT damage.
The cloud can be dispelled by a wind of at least 10 miles per hour. After it is cast, the cloud moves 10 feet away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Katrina's Clinging Incendiary Cloud. Until the spell ends, burning embers stick to any creatures caught within the cloud. A creature that takes damage from this spell must make a save, taking {@dice 1d8} ongoing fire damage on a fail. A creature outside of the cloud can use an action to brush the embers off.

spell.name: Inescapable Malady

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You infect your target with an arcane disease. At any time after you cast this spell, as long as you are on the same plane of existence as the target, you can use an action to deal {@dice 7d10} necrotic DoT damage to the target. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 hit points, you can choose to leave it with 1 hit point.

As part of dealing the damage, you may expend a 7th-level spell slot to sustain the disease. Otherwise, the spell ends. The spell ends when you die. Casting {@spell remove curse|sns}, {@spell greater restoration|sns}, or {@spell heal|sns} on the target allows the target to make a save, ending the disease on a success. Otherwise the disease can only be cured by a {@spell wish|sns} spell.

m.text: hair, fingernail clippings, or some other piece of the target

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Infernal Weapon
entries: A weapon formed from the essence of Hell appears in your hands. The weapon has the Two-handed trait. If you let go of the weapon, it disappears and the spell ends.

When you cast the spell, choose either a flame fork or ice spear. While the spell lasts, you can use an action to make a melee spell armour attack with the weapon against a creature within 10 feet of you. The weapon cannot be used in any other way, including as part of the Attack action, as a reaction, or when triggered by a maneuver.
The attack deals {@dice 5d8} damage of a type determined by the weapon's form. On a critical success, you inflict an additional effect.
In addition, on a hit with the infernal weapon, you can end the spell early to upgrade the attack's success tier to a critical success.

items.name: Flame Fork
entries: The weapon deals fire damage. On a critical success, the target catches fire, taking {@dice 2d6} ongoing fire damage.

items.name: Ice Spear
entries: The weapon deals cold damage. On a critical success, the target is {@condition slowed|sns} for 1 minute, or until it passes a passive save.
A creature reduced to 0 hit points by an infernal weapon immediately dies in a gruesome fashion.

For example, a creature killed by an ice spear might freeze solid, then shatter into a thousand pieces. Each creature of your choice within 60 feet of the creature and who can see it when it dies must make a save. On a fail, a creature becomes {@condition frightened|sns} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Roav's Malevolent Infernal Weapon. The spell may take a third form.
Malevolent Maul: The weapon deals psychic damage. On a critical success, the target is {@condition confused|sns} until it passes a passive save.

spell.name: Inflict Wounds

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You impart fell energies that suck away the target's life force, making an armour attack against the target that deals {@dice 3d10} necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Insect Plague

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere

A roiling cloud of insects appears, biting and stinging any creatures it touches. The cloud lightly obscures its area, spreads around corners, and is considered difficult terrain. When the cloud appears and a creature is in it, when a creature enters the cloud for the first time on a turn, or when a creature ends its turn within the cloud it takes {@dice 4d6} piercing DoT damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Roav's Infernal Insect Plague. The spell summons hellish insects from the depths of the realms infernal. When a creature takes damage from this spell it becomes {@condition frightened|sns} of the swarm until the spell ends, even after it leaves the cloud.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Instant Summons

entries.name: Target
entries: One object weighing no more than 10 pounds.
Until the spell ends, a mystical bond connects the target and the precious stone used to cast this spell.

Any time after, you may crush the stone and speak the name of the item, summoning it instantly into your hand no matter the physical, metaphysical, or planar distances involved, at which point the spell ends. If another creature is holding the item when the stone is crushed, the item is not summoned to you. Instead, the spell grants you the knowledge of who possesses it and a general idea of the creature's location.
Each time you cast this spell, you must use a different precious stone.
{@spell Dispel magic|sns} or a similar effect targeting the stone ends the spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koran's Reinforcement Instant Summons.

The spell can target a willing creature and uses a precious statue carved to resemble the target. This material component costs 1,000 gold per Hit Die that the creature possesses. Once cast, you may summon the target the same way that you would summon an item. If the target is asleep, it is awakened when summoned. The target may decline the summons, in which case you are granted a general idea of the target's current location.

spell.name: Invigorated Strikes

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You allow long-forgotten fighting instincts to boil up to the surface. For the duration of the spell, whenever the target hits with an unarmed strike, it deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 3rd-level spell slot, the extra damage increases from {@dice 1d4} to {@dice 1d6}. When you cast this spell with a 5th-level spell slot, the extra damage increases to {@dice 1d8}.
When you cast this spell with a 7th-level spell slot, the extra damage increases to {@dice 1d10}.

spell.name: Invisibility

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You wreathe a creature in an illusory veil, making it {@condition invisible}. Anything the target is carrying or wearing is also {@condition invisible} as long as it remains in the target's possession. The spell's effects end for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Ravjahani's Imparted Invisibility. Until the spell ends, any object that the target picks up becomes {@condition invisible} even after it is dropped.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Irresistible Dance

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature capable of being charmed
You murmur a tune that takes root in the target's mind until the spell ends, forcing it to caper, dance, and shuffle. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition sluggish|sns}.

items.name: Standard success
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the target must use half of its movement to dance in its space, and it has disadvantage on armour attack rolls, and attack rolls against it have advantage. On each of its turns, the target can use an action to make a save, ending the spell on a success.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition staggered|sns}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Beshala's Wild Irresistible Dance. The target is forced to dance with such vigor that it suffers a level of {@condition fatigue|sns} when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target one additional creature within 30 feet for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Jump

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You imbue the target with the ability to make impossible leaps. The target's jump distances increase 15 feet vertically and 30 feet horizontally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Each of the target's jump distances increase by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Knock

entries.name: Target
entries: One object

Make a check against the DC of a lock or door using your spellcasting ability modifier plus your proficiency bonus. On a success, you unlock or open the target with a loud metallic clanging noise easily audible at up to 300 feet. In addition, any traps on the object are automatically triggered. An item with multiple locks requires multiple castings of this spell to be opened.
When you target an object held shut by an {@spell arcane lock|sns}, that spell is suppressed for 10 minutes, allowing the object to be opened and shut normally during that time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The level of the {@spell arcane lock|sns} you can suppress increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd. In addition, if the level of your knock spell is 2 or more levels higher than that of the {@spell arcane lock|sns}, you may dispel the arcane lock instead of suppressing it.

spell.name: Legend Lore

entries.name: Target
entries: An object, creature, or location you name or describe

You learn significant information about the target. This could range from the most up-todate research, lore forgotten in old tales, or even previously unknown information. The spell gives you additional, more detailed information if you already have some knowledge of the target. The spell will not return any information for items not of legendary renown.
The knowledge you gain is always true, but may be obscured by metaphor, poetic language, or verse.
If you use the spell for a cursed tome, for instance, you may gain knowledge of the dire words spoken by its creator as they brought it into the world.

m.text: 250 gold of incense consumed by the spell and 4 blank, exquisitely bound books worth at least 50 gold each

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Your intuition surrounding the target is enhanced and you gain advantage on one Investigation check regarding it for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Lemure Transformation
entries: Your body melts into a humanoid-shaped mass of liquid flesh. Each creature within 5 feet of you that can see the transformation must make a save. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions and is {@condition frightened|sns} until the start of its next turn. Until the end of your turn, your Speed becomes 20 feet, you can't speak, and you can move through spaces as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. You revert to your normal form at the end of your turn.

spell.name: Lesser Restoration

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

Your glowing hand removes one disease or condition affecting the target. Choose from {@condition blinded|sns}, {@condition deafened|sns}, {@condition staggered|sns}, or {@condition poisoned|sns}. At the DM's discretion, some diseases might not be curable with this spell.

spell.name: Levitate

entries.name: Target
entries: Creature or object under 500 lbs.
If the target is an unwilling creature, make a fortitude attack against them. Otherwise, automatically use the standard success outcome of the attack. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target floats an inch of the ground and is {@condition sluggish|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, the target rises vertically in the air up to 20 feet and remains floating there, able to move only by pushing or pulling on fixed objects or surfaces within its reach. This allows the target to move as if it was climbing.

On subsequent turns, you can use your action to alter the target's altitude by up to 20 feet in either direction so long as it remains within range. If the target is yourself, you may move up or down as part of your movement.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition restrained|sns}.
The target floats gently to the ground if it is still in the air when the spell ends.

m.text: sycamore seed or scrap of silver cloth

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 5th-level spell slot the target can levitate or come to the ground at will. When using a 7th-level spell slot its duration increases to 1 hour and it no longer requires concentration.

spell.name: Light

entries.name: Target
entries: Object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension

Until the spell ends, the target emits bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light an additional 20 feet. Light emanating from the target may be any color. Completely covering the target with something that is not transparent blocks the light. The spell ends when you use an action to dismiss it or if you cast it again.
If the target is being held or worn by a hostile creature, you must make a reflex attack against that creature with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target emits bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light an additional 5 feet, but only for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The spell functions as normal.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the radius of both the bright and dim light is increased to 30 feet.

spell.name: Lightning Bolt

entries.name: Area
entries: Line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide

A bolt of lightning arcs out from you in a direction you choose. Make a reflex attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 7d8} lightning damage. The lightning ignites flammable objects in its path that aren't worn or carried by another creature.
If the spell is stopped by an object at least as large as its width, it ends there unless it deals enough damage to break through. When it does, it continues to the end of its area.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Conductive Lightning Bolt. The attack has advantage against metallic creatures and creatures wearing metal armour.

m.text: small metal rod and rain water

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Locate Animals or Plants

entries.name: Target
entries: Self

Name or describe in detail a specific kind of beast or plant. The natural magics in range reveal the closest example of the target within 5 miles, including its general direction (north, west, southeast, and so on) and how many miles away it currently is.

spell.name: Locate Creature

entries.name: Target
entries: Self

Name or describe in detail a creature familiar to you. The spell reveals the general direction the creature is in (south, east, northwest, and so on) if it exists within range. This includes its current trajectory if it's travelling.

You may locate specific, known creatures, or the nearest creature of a specific type (like a bat, gnome, or red dragon) provided that you have observed that type within 30 feet at least once. If a specific creature you seek is in a different form (for example a wildshaped druid) the spell is unable to find it.
The spell cannot travel across running water 10 feet across or wider — it is unable to find the creature and the trail ends.

spell.name: Locate Object

entries.name: Target
entries: Self

Name or describe in detail an object familiar to you. The spell reveals the general direction the object is in (south, east, northwest, and so on) if it exists within range. This includes its current trajectory if it's travelling. You may locate a specific object known to you, provided that you have observed it within 30 feet at least once. You may also find the closest example of a certain type of object (for example an instrument, item of furniture, compass, or vase).
When there is any thickness of lead in the direct path between you and the object the spell is unable to find it.

spell.name: Longstrider

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Until the spell ends, the target's Speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Precarious Longstrider. Targets ignore nonmagical difficult terrain.

m.text: coiled wire and the sole of a shoe

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mage Armour

entries.name: Target
entries: A willing, unarmored creature

Until the spell ends, the target is protected by a shimmering magical force. Its armour becomes 10 plus half its spellcasting ability modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor, or if you use an action to dismiss it.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Stekart's Enhanced Mage Armour. The target's armour becomes 10 plus your proficiency bonus plus half its spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The target gains 6 temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st. The temporary hit points last for the spell's duration.

spell.name: Mage Hand
entries: A faintly shimmering phantasmal hand appears at a point you choose within range. It remains until you dismiss it as an action, or until you move out of range of it.
You can use an action to control the hand and direct it to do any of the following:

items: manipulate an object.
open an unlocked container or door.
stow or retrieve items from unlocked containers.

entries: The hand cannot attack, use magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

spell.name: Magic Circle

entries.name: Target
entries: Celestials, elementals, fey, fiends or undead (designate one)

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius cylinder that is 20 feet high
Magical energies surround the area and stop the type of designated creature from willingly entering by nonmagical means.

Designated creatures have disadvantage when making armour attacks against creatures within the area and are unable to charm, frighten, or possess creatures within the area. When a designated creature attempts to teleport or use interplanar travel to enter the area, it must succeed on a save or its attempt fails.
You may also choose to reverse this spell, trapping a creature of your chosen type within the area in order to protect targets outside it.

m.text: holy water or ornately engraved padlocks worth 100 gold, consumed by the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's duration increases by 1 hour for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Jar

entries.name: Target
entries: Self
Your body becomes catatonic as your soul enters the vessel used as a material component. While within this vessel, you're aware of your surroundings as if you physically occupied the same space.
The only action you can take is to project your soul within range, whether to return to your living body (and end the spell) or to possess a humanoid.

You may not target creatures protected by {@spell protection from good and evil|sns} or {@spell magic circle|sns} spells. Make a will attack against a creature you try to possess with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition charmed|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Your soul moves from your vessel and into the target's body. The target's soul is now within the container.

Once you possess a target, you have control of it. Replace your game statistics with the target's, except your Charisma, Intelligence, and Wisdom scores. Your own class features also remain, and you may not use the target's passive features (if it has any).

During possession, you can use an action to return to the vessel if it is within range, returning the host target to its body. If the host body dies while you are possessing it, the target also dies and you must make a save. On a success you return to the container if it's within range. Otherwise, you die. If the vessel is destroyed, the spell ends and your soul returns to your body if it's within range. If your body is out of range or dead when you try to return, you die.

The possessed target perceives the world as if it occupied the same space as the vessel, but may not take any actions or movement. If the vessel is destroyed while occupied by a target other than yourself, the target returns to its body if the body is alive and within range. Otherwise, the target dies. The vessel is destroyed when the spell ends.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you can use the target's passive features.
If the attack scores a minor success or lower, you may not attempt to possess the target again for 24 hours.

m.text: box, locket, gem, or other highly decorated vessel worth at least 500 gold

spell.name: Magic Missile

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to three creatures
A trio of glowing darts of magical force unerringly and simultaneously strike the targets, each dealing {@dice 1d4+1} force DoT damage. Any bonuses to this damage apply only once per target.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Ruinous Magic Missile. Creatures damaged by this spell must make a save or become {@condition rattled|sns} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Evoke one additional dart and target up to one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Magic Mouth

entries.name: Target
entries: One unattended object
The target is imbued with a spoken message of 25 words or fewer which it speaks when a trigger condition you choose is met. The message may take up to 10 minutes to convey.

When your trigger condition is met, a magical mouth appears on the object and recites the message in the same voice and volume as you used when instructing it. If the object chosen has a mouth (for example, a painted portrait) this is where the mouth appears.
You may choose upon casting whether the message is a single event, or whether it repeats every time the trigger condition is met.
The trigger condition must be based upon audio or visual cues within 30 feet of the object, and may be highly detailed or as broad as you choose.
For example, the trigger could be when any attack action is made within range, or when the first spring shoot breaks ground within range.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Mocking Magic Mouth. As long as you also know the {@spell vicious mockery|sns} cantrip, when you cast this spell with a trigger that is a single event you can choose to cast {@spell vicious mockery|sns} through the magical mouth.

m.text: slice of dried ox tongue or a feather from a lyrebird

spell.name: Magic Weapon

entries.name: Target
entries: One nonmagical weapon
Until the spell ends, the target becomes gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, and its base damage ignores resistances and immunities.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The bonus increases by +1 for every 2 slot levels above 2nd (maximum +3).

spell.name: Magnificent Mansion
entries: You conjure an extradimensional residence within range. It has one entrance that is in a place of your choosing, has a faint luster to it, and is 5 feet wide and 10 feet tall. You and any designated creature may enter your mansion while the portal is open. You may open and close the portal while you are within 30 feet of it. Once closed the entrance is {@condition invisible}. The entrance leads to an opulent entrance hall, with many doors and halls coming from it. The atmosphere is welcoming, warm, and comfortable, and the whole place is sparkling clean.
The floor plan of the residence is up to you, but it must be made up of fifty or fewer 10-foot cubes.

The furniture and decor are chosen by you. The residence contains enough food to provide Supply for a number of people equal to 5 x your proficiency bonus. A staff of translucent, lustrous servants dwell within the residence. They may otherwise look how you wish. These servants obey your commands without question, and can perform the same nonhostile actions as a human servant—they might carry objects, prepare and serve food and drinks, clean, make simple repairs, and so on. Servants have access to the entire mansion but may not leave.

All objects and furnishings belonging to the mansion evaporate into shimmering smoke when they leave it. Any creature within the mansion when the spell ends is expelled into an unoccupied space near the entrance.

m.text: ornately engraved padlock, a square of embroidered silk, and highly polished ebony worth at least 300 gold

spell.name: Major Image

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot cube

Until the spell ends, you create an image that appears completely real. The illusion includes sounds, smells, and temperature in addition to visual phenomena. None of the effects of the illusion are able to cause actual harm.

While within range you can use an action to move the illusion. As the image moves you may also change its appearance to make the movement seem natural (like a roc moving its wings to fly) and also change the nonvisual elements of the illusion for the same reason (like the sound of beating wings as the roc flies).

Any physical interaction immediately reveals the image is an illusion, as objects and creatures alike pass through it. An Investigation check against your standard DC also reveals the image is an illusion.
When a creature realizes the image is an illusion, the effects become fainter for that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a 6th-level spell slot the illusion lasts until dispelled without requiring concentration.

spell.name: Mass Cure Wounds

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to six creatures that are not constructs or undead
Glowing energy rushes through the air and each target regains hit points equal to {@dice 5d6} + your spellcasting modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The hit points regained increase by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Mass Heal

entries.name: Target
entries: Any number of creatures that are not constructs or undead
Healing energy erupts from your steepled hands and restores up to 787 hit points between the targets.

Creatures healed in this way are also cured of any diseases, and any effect causing them to be {@condition blinded|sns} or {@condition deafened|sns}. In addition, on subsequent turns within the next minute you can use a bonus action to distribute any unused hit points.

spell.name: Mass Healing Word

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to six creatures that are not constructs or undead
Healing energy flows from you in a wash of restorative power and each target regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The hit points regained increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Mass Suggestion

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to twelve creatures that can hear and understand you
Creatures that cannot be {@condition charmed|sns} are immune to this spell. Make a will attack against each target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: You gain an expertise die on the first Persuasion check you make against the target before the end of your next turn.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Suggest an activity phrased in a sentence or two. The target is magically influenced to follow that course of activity. The suggestion must be worded to sound reasonable. Asking the target to perform an action that is obviously harmful to it ends the spell.

The target carries out the activity suggested by you as well as it can. The activity can last for the duration of the spell, and if it requires less time the spell ends after the target has carried out the activity.

You may specify trigger conditions that cause the target to perform a specific activity while the spell lasts. For example, you may suggest that the target takes off its clothes and dives the next time it sees a body of water. If the target does not see a body of water before the spell ends, the specific activity isn't performed.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the suggestion can span up to three sentences.
Any damage done to a target by you or an ally ends the spell for that creature.

m.text: miniature bottle of wine and some soap

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a 7th-level spell slot, the duration of the spell increases to 10 days. When cast using an 8th-level spell slot, the duration increases to 30 days. When cast using a 9th-level spell slot, the duration increases to a year and a day.

spell.name: Maze

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
The target is banished to a complex maze on its own demiplane, and remains there for the duration or until the target succeeds in escaping.

The target can use an action to attempt to escape, making a save. On a successful save it escapes and the spell ends. A creature with Labyrinthine Recall (or a similar trait) automatically succeeds on its save.
When the spell ends the target reappears in the space it occupied before the spell was cast, or the closest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

spell.name: Meld Into Stone

entries.name: Target
entries: A stone object or surface large enough to contain your body

Until the spell ends, you meld yourself and your carried equipment into the target stone. Using your movement, you may enter the stone from any point you can touch. No trace of your presence is visible or detectable by nonmagical senses.

Within the stone, you can't see outside it and have disadvantage on Perception checks made to hear beyond it. You are aware of time passing, and may cast spells upon yourself. You may use your movement only to step out of the target where you entered it, ending the spell.

If the target is damaged such that its shape changes and you no longer fit within it, you are expelled and take {@dice 6d6} bludgeoning DoT damage. Complete destruction of the target, or its transmutation into another substance, expels you and you take 50 bludgeoning DoT damage. When expelled you fall {@condition prone|sns} into the closest unoccupied space near your entrance point.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Mobile Meld Into Stone. Until the spell ends, you gain a burrow speed of 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 5th-level spell slot, you may reach out of the target to make spell armour attacks or ranged weapon attacks without ending the spell. You make these attacks with disadvantage.

spell.name: Mending

entries.name: Target
entries: One object

You repair a single rip or break in the target object (for example, a cracked goblet, torn page, or ripped robe). The break must be smaller than 1 foot in all dimensions. The spell leaves no trace that the object was damaged.

Magic items and constructs may be repaired in this way, but their magic is not restored. You gain an expertise die on maintenance checks if you are able to cast this spell on the item you are treating.

spell.name: Mental Grip
entries: You conjure extensions of your own mental fortitude to keep your foes at bay. For the spell's duration, you can use an action to attempt to {@condition grappled|sns|grapple} a creature within range by making a check with your spellcasting ability modifier against its standard DC.
Successful escape attempts do not break your concentration on the spell.

spell.name: Message

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You point and whisper your message at the target.
It alone hears the message and may reply in a whisper audible only to you.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and are certain it is beyond the barrier. The message is blocked by 3 feet of wood, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metals, or a thin sheet of lead.
The spell moves freely around corners or through openings.

spell.name: Meteor Swarm

entries.name: Area
entries: Four 40-foot radius spheres

Scorching spheres of flame strike the ground at 4 different points within range. The effects of a sphere reach around corners. Make a reflex attack against creatures and objects in each area that deals {@dice 10d10} fire damage and {@dice 10d10} bludgeoning damage, and flammable unattended objects catch on fire. If a creature is in the area of more than one sphere, it is affected only once.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Decisive Meteor Swarm. A creature that takes 56 or more damage is knocked {@condition prone|sns}. A creature that takes 112 or more damage is {@condition debilitated|sns} until the end of its next turn and knocked {@condition prone|sns}.

spell.name: Mind Blank

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
The target is immune to psychic damage, any effect that would read its emotions or thoughts, divination spells, and the {@condition charmed|sns} condition.
This immunity extends even to the {@spell wish|sns} spell, and magical effects or spells of similar power that would affect the target's mind or gain information about it.

spell.name: Mindshield

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
The target has 50% resistance to psychic damage and attacks against it that can {@condition charmed|sns|charm} or {@condition frightened|sns|frighten} have disadvantage.

spell.name: Minor Illusion

entries.name: Area
entries: 5-foot cube
This spell creates a sound or image of an object.
The illusion disappears if dismissed or you cast the spell again.

You may create any sound you choose, ranging in volume from a whisper to a scream. You may choose one sound for the duration or change them at varying points before the spell ends. Sounds are audible outside the spell's area.
Visual illusions may replicate any image and remain within the spell's area, but cannot create sound, light, smell, or other sensory effects.

The image is revealed as an illusion with any physical interaction as physical objects and creatures pass through it. An Investigation check against your standard DC also reveals the image is an illusion. When a creature realizes the image is an illusion, the effects become fainter for that creature.

spell.name: Mirage Arcane

entries.name: Area
entries: Special (1-mile square)
You make terrain within the spell's area appear as another kind of terrain, tricking all senses (including touch).

The general shape of the terrain remains the same, however. A small town could resemble a woodland, a smooth road could appear rocky and overgrown, a deep pit could resemble a shallow pond, and so on.
Structures may be altered in the similar way, or added where there are none. Creatures are not disguised, concealed, or added by the spell.

The illusion appears completely real in all aspects, including physical terrain, and can be physically interacted with. Clear terrain becomes difficult terrain, and vice versa. Any part of the illusory terrain such as a boulder, or water collected from an illusory stream, disappears immediately upon leaving the spell's area.

Creatures with truesight see through the illusion, but are not immune to its effects. They may know that the overgrown path is in fact a well maintained road, but are still impeded by illusory rocks and branches.

spell.name: Mirror Image
entries: A total of 3 illusory copies of yourself appear in your space. For the duration, these copies move with you and mimic your actions, creating confusion as to which is real.
You can use an action to dismiss them.
Each time you're targeted by a creature's armour attack, roll a {@dice d20} to see if it targets you or one of your copies.
With 3 copies, a roll of 6 or higher means a copy is targeted. With two copies, a roll of 8 or higher targets a copy, and with 1 copy a roll of 11 or higher targets the copy.
A copy's armour is 0, and when it is hit by an attack a copy is destroyed.
It may be destroyed only by an armour attack that hits it.
All other damage and effects have no impact.
Attacking creatures that have truesight, cannot see, have blindsight, or rely on other nonvisual senses are unaffected by this spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Beshela's Blinding Mirror Image. When one of your illusory copies is destroyed, it explodes in a brilliant flash of light. A creature that destroys an illusory copy must succeed on a save or be {@condition blinded|sns} until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 5th-level spell slot, the duration increases to concentration (1 hour).

spell.name: Mislead
entries: You become {@condition invisible}. At the same time, an illusory copy of you appears where you're standing.
This invisibility ends when you cast a spell but the copy lasts until the spell ends.
You can use an action to move your copy up to twice your Speed, have it speak, make gestures, or behave however you'd like.

You may see and hear through your copy. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to switch between your copy's senses and your own, or back again. While using your copy's senses you are blind and deaf to your body's surroundings.
The copy is revealed as an illusion with any physical interaction, as solid objects and creatures pass through it.

spell.name: Misty Step

entries.name: Target
entries: Self
You teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see, disappearing and reappearing in a swirl of shimmering mist.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Cyneburg's Elusive Misty Step. Until the start of your next turn, armour attack rolls against you are made with disadvantage.

spell.name: Modify Memory

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Make a will attack against the target, which has disadvantage if you are in combat with the target. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition charmed|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target becomes {@condition charmed|sns} and {@condition dazed|sns}. Until the spell ends, any memories of an event that took place within the last 24 hours and lasted 10 minutes or less may be altered.
You may destroy the memory, have the target recall the event with perfect clarity, change the details, or create a new memory entirely with the same restrictions in time frame and length.
You must speak to the target in a language you both know to modify its memories and describe how the memory is changed. The target fills in the gaps in details based on your description.

If the spell ends before you have finished modifying its memories, the alteration fails. Otherwise, the alteration is complete when the spell ends and only {@spell greater restoration|sns} or {@spell remove curse|sns} can restore the memory.

The DM may deem a modified memory too illogical or nonsensical to affect a creature, in which case the modified memory is simply dismissed by the target. In addition, a modified memory doesn't specifically change the behaviour of a creature, especially if the memory conflicts with the creature's personality, beliefs, or innate tendencies.

There may also be events that are practically unforgettable and after being modified can be remembered correctly when another creature succeeds on a Persuasion check to stir the target's memories. This check is made with disadvantage if the creature does not have indisputable proof on hand that is relevant to the altered memory.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the events that can be altered can be up to 1 hour in duration.
The spell automatically ends if the target takes any damage or if it is targeted by another spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 6th-level spell slot, the event can be from as far as 7 days ago. When using a 7th-level spell slot, the event can be from as far as 30 days ago. When using an 8th-level spell slot, the event can be from as far as 1 year ago. When using a 9th-level spell slot, any event can be altered.

spell.name: Moonbeam

entries.name: Area
entries: 5-foot radius cylinder that is 40 feet high
A beam of moonlight fills the area with dim light.
The area becomes a persistent zone which strikes creatures with silver flames that deal {@dice 2d6} radiant DoT damage.
A shapeshifted creature is forced to take its original form while within the zone.
On your turn, you may use an action to move the beam 60 feet in any direction.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Nevard's Cursed Moonbeam. An ominous moon of darkness appears above the target location. The cursed moon emanates no light and deals necrotic damage as grasping shadows tear into creatures in the zone. While inside the zone, a creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

m.text: moonseed seeds and a piece of feldspar

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Move Earth

entries.name: Area
entries: Square of clay, dirt, or sand up to 40 feet on a side
You reshape the area, changing its elevation or creating and eliminating holes, walls, and pillars.
The only limitation is that the elevation change may not exceed half the area's horizontal dimensions.
For example, affecting a 40-by-40 area allows you to include 20 foot high pillars, holes 20 feet deep, and changes in terrain elevation of 20 feet or less.
Changes that result in unstable terrain are subject to collapse.

Changes take 10 minutes to complete, after which you can choose another area to affect. Due to the slow speed of transformation, it is nearly impossible for creatures to be hurt or captured by the spell.
This spell has no effect on stone, objects crafted from stone, or plants, though these objects will shift based on changes in the area.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Vorax-Hul's Holey Move Earth. The spell's duration is instantaneous and it no longer requires your concentration. You affect up to 4 areas but only make caverns or holes (determined at the time of casting), each of which must be 20-foot cubes or smaller.

m.text: iron blade and a bag of mixed soils

spell.name: Nondetection

entries.name: Target
entries: Creature, place or object
The target is hidden from divination magic and cannot be perceived by magical scrying sensors.
When used on a place or object, the spell only works if the target is no larger than 10 feet in any given dimension.

m.text: 25 gold worth of diamond dust, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Passwall

entries.name: Target
entries: Plaster, stone, or wooden surface

Until the spell ends, you create a passage extending into the target surface. When creating the passage you define its dimensions, as long as they do not exceed 5 feet in width, 8 feet in height, or 20 feet in depth.
The appearance of the passage has no effect on the stability of the surrounding environment.
Any creatures or objects within the passage when the spell ends are expelled without harm into unoccupied spaces near where the spell was cast.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Ravjahani's Trapped Passwall. Within a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus, the passage left by this spell (which can be as minimal as an inch depression) becomes trapped. Choose one of the following.

items.name: Slippy
entries: One side of the passage is covered in slippery soap. When a creature enters the passage's area or first moves through the area on a turn it must make a save or fall {@condition prone|sns}.

items.name: Sticky
entries: Goo covers one side of the passage, making it difficult terrain.

items.name: Subtle
entries: An illusion covers the passage making it appear as if nothing has happened to the target surface. The illusion does not hold up to physical inspection. A creature that tries to push against the illusion, for example, instead passes straight through the figment. To see through your illusion without such an inspection, a creature must use its action to make an Investigation check against your standard DC.

spell.name: Pass Without Trace

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius
You and allies within the area gain advantage and an expertise die on Stealth checks as an aura of secrecy enshrouds you. Creatures in the area leave behind no evidence of their passage.

spell.name: Pestilence

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot sphere

A swarm of insects fills the area, which becomes a persistent zone dealing 1 piercing DoT damage. The pests also ravage any unattended organic material within their radius, such as plant, wood, or fabric.
This spell's damage increases by 1 when you reach 5th level (2), 10th level (3), and 15th level (4).

spell.name: Phantasmal Killer

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You create an illusion that invokes the target's deepest fears. Only the target can see this illusion. When the spell is cast, make a will attack against the target that deals {@dice 7d6} psychic damage. On a hit, the target becomes {@condition frightened|sns} and takes {@dice 4d10} ongoing psychic damage until it passes a passive save.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Aurana's Creeping Phantasmal Killer. When the spell ends early from the target passing a passive save, you may choose a new target for the spell. That target must make its own save, and on a fail the spell's {@condition frightened|sns} condition and ongoing damage continue on this new target without the expenditure of an additional spell slot, using the same duration.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Aurana's Draining Phantasmal Killer. Whenever a target is damaged by this spell, you regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The attack damage increases by {@dice 2d6} and the ongoing damage by {@condition 1d10} for each slot level above the 4th.

spell.name: Phantasmal Talons
entries: You silently clench your hand into a claw and talons of pure will sprout from your fingers.

The talons do not interact with physical matter, but rip viciously at the psyche of any creature struck by them. For the duration, your unarmed attacks are governed by your choice of either Strength or Dexterity, and their base damage is converted to psychic. In addition, if your unarmed strike's base damage die is less than {@dice 1d4}, it is instead {@dice 1d4}.

spell.name: Phantom Steed
entries: You create an illusory Large creature with an appearance determined by you that comes into being with all the necessary equipment needed to use it as a mount. This equipment vanishes when more than 10 feet away from the creature.
You or any creature you allow may ride the steed, which uses the statistics for a {@creature riding horse} but has a Speed of 100 feet.
The steed vanishes if it takes damage (disappearing instantly) or you use an action to dismiss it (fading away, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount).

entries.name: Rare
entries: Cavel's Carting Phantom Steed. Instead of conjuring a mount, you conjure a Large vehicle such as a boat, wagon, or cart. You decide on its appearance. If the vehicle normally requires horses, quasi-real beasts with an appearance of your choosing are conjured along with it. The vehicle can transport up to 6 Medium creatures.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kasvarina's Stalwart Phantom Steed. If the steed takes damage and disappears, you can use an action to resummon it as long as you are not in combat and the original duration has not passed.
The steed follows all other restrictions of the original spell.

spell.name: Planar Ally
entries: An entity from beyond the realm material answers your call for assistance. You must know this entity whether it is holy, unholy, or beyond the bounds of mortal comprehension. The entity sends forth a servant loyal to it to aid you in your endeavors. If you have a specific servant in mind you may speak its name during the casting, but ultimately who is sent to answer your call is the entity's decision.

The creature that appears (a celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend), is under no compulsion to behave in any particular way other than how its nature and personality direct it. Any request made of the creature, simple or complex, requires an equal amount of payment which you must bargain with the creature to ascertain. The creature can request either items, sacrifices, or services in exchange for its assistance. A creature that you cannot communicate with cannot be bargained with. A task that can be completed in minutes is worth 100 gold per minute, a task that requires hours is worth 1,000 gold per hour, and a task requiring days is worth 10,000 gold per day (the creature can only accept tasks contained within a 10 day timeframe). A creature can often be persuaded to lower or raise prices depending on how a task aligns with its personality and the goals of its master — some require no payment at all if the task is deemed worthy. Additionally, a task that poses little or no risk only requires half the usual amount of payment, and an extremely dangerous task might call for double the usual payment. Still, only extreme circumstances will cause a creature summoned this way to accept tasks with a near certain result of death.
A creature returns to its place of origin when a task is completed or if you fail to negotiate an agreeable task and payment.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Leska's Forbidden Planar Ally. The spell allows the summoning of an aberration.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Roav's Cruel Planar Ally. The creature summoned by this spell is always a fiend linked to you. The bargaining costs for all requests made with the fiend are halved, but in exchange the fiend uses the link to grant disadvantage to attacks that could banish or bind it, gain 50% resistance to all damage, and cause you to take an equal amount of damage each time it takes damage. Damage inflicted to you by this spell is non-lethal.

spell.name: Planar Binding

entries.name: Target
entries: One celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend
The target must remain within range for the entire casting of the spell (usually by means of a {@spell magic circle|sns} spell). Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The next Charisma check you make to interact with the target before the end of your next turn has advantage.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, you force the target to serve you. If the target was summoned through some other means, like a spell, the duration of the original spell is extended to match this spell's duration.

Once it is bound to you the target serves as best it can and follows your orders, but only to the letter of the instruction. A hostile or malevolent target actively seeks to take any advantage of errant phrasing to suit its nature. When the target completes a task you've assigned to it, if you are on the same plane of existence the target travels back to you to report it has done so. Otherwise, it returns to where it was bound and remains there until the spell ends.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the DM will tell you if the target plans to take advantage of your wording, and you may then alter your wording. You must use your second set of wording.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Leska's Star Sign Planar Binding. The spell can also target an aberration.

m.text: jewel worth at least 1,000 gold, consumed by the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 6th-level spell slot, its duration increases to 10 days. When using a 7th-level spell slot, its duration increases to 30 days. When using an 8th-level spell slot, its duration increases to 180 days. When using a 9th-level spell slot, its duration increases to a year and a day.

spell.name: Plane Shift

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature, or you and up to 8 willing creatures linking hands in a circle

Willing targets are transported to a plane of existence that you choose. If the destination is generally described, targets arrive near that destination in a location chosen by the Narrator. If you know the correct sequence of an existing teleportation circle (see {@spell teleportation circle|sns}), you can choose it as the destination (when the designated circle is too small for all targets to fit, any additional targets are shunted to the closest unoccupied spaces).
Alternatively this spell can be used offensively to banish an unwilling target. You make an armour attack with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition debilitated|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is rendered {@condition unconscious|sns} until it passes a passive save.

items.name: Major success
entries: The target is transported to a random location on a plane of existence that you choose. Once transported, you must spend 1 minute concentrating on this spell or the target returns to the last space it occupied (otherwise it must find its own way back).

items.name: Critical success
entries: As major success, but you only need to spend 18 seconds concentrating on the spell.

m.text: metal rod attuned to a particular plane of existence worth 250 gold

spell.name: Plant Growth

entries.name: Area
entries: 100-foot radius (rapid) or half-mile radius (enlarged)
You channel vitality into vegetation to achieve one of the following effects, chosen when casting the spell.

items.name: Enlarged
entries: Plants in the area are greatly enriched. Any harvests of the affected plants provide twice as much food as normal.

items.name: Rapid
entries: All nonmagical plants in the area surge with the power of life. A creature that moves through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every foot it moves. You can exclude one or more areas of any size from being affected.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Nevard's Overwhelming Plant Growth. This spell doesn't require the presence of pre-existing vegetation to take effect, but must use the Rapid option, and plants that appear only last for a day before fading away.

spell.name: Poison Skin

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

The target becomes poisonous to the touch. Until the spell ends, whenever a creature adjacent to the target hits the target with a melee weapon attack, the creature makes a save, becoming {@condition poisoned|sns} and taking {@dice 1d6} ongoing poison damage on a fail, both until the target passes a passive save.
The target of the spell also becomes bright and multicolored like a poisonous dart frog, giving it disadvantage on Stealth checks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The target's skin is also covered in mucus, granting attacks against it that can {@condition grappled|sns|grapple} or {@condition restrained|sns|restrain} disadvantage. In addition, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Power Word Kill

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

With but a word you snuff out the target's life and it immediately dies if it has 112 or fewer hit points. If you cast this on a creature with more than 112 hit points, it takes 56 hit points of true damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Roav's Sacrificial Power Word Kill. When a target dies from the effects of this spell, you may use its life force to save yourself. For the next 8 hours, the first time you would drop to 0 hit points or be outright killed, you instead drop to 1 hit point. Once this effect is used, the life force is expended and the effect ends.

spell.name: Power Word Debilitate

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You utter a powerful word that {@condition debilitated|sns|debilitates} a target with 168 hit points or less until they pass a passive save. If the target has more than 168 hit points, it is instead {@condition rattled|sns} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Maiming Power Word Debilitate. When a target succeeds on its passive save, its movement is halved and it is either {@condition blinded|sns} or {@condition deafened|sns} (your choice) until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Prayer of Healing

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to six creatures that are not constructs or undead
The targets regain hit points equal to {@dice 3d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Komanov's Fell Prayer of Healing. After casting this spell, the targets gain temporary hit points equal to the amount healed as a tenuous connection to dark entities increases their tolerance to pain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The hit points regained increase by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Prestidigitation
entries: You wield arcane energies to produce minor effects. Choose one of the following:

items: create a single burst of magic that manifests to one of the senses (for example a burst of sound, sparks, or an odd odor).
clean or soil an object of 1 cubic foot or less.
light or snuff a flame.
chill, warm, or flavor nonliving material of 1 cubic foot or less for 1 hour.
color or mark an object or surface for 1 hour.
create an ordinary trinket or illusionary image that fits in your hand and lasts for 1 round.

entries: You may cast this spell multiple times, though only three effects may be active at a time. Dismissing each effect requires an action.

spell.name: Prismatic Spray

entries.name: Area
entries: 60-foot cone

You unleash 8 rays of light, each with a different purpose and effect. For each target in the area, roll a {@dice d8} to determine the ray that affects it. An affected target can ignore the effects of the ray by passing a save.

items.name: 1. Red
entries: The target takes {@dice 10d6} fire DoT damage.

items.name: 2. Orange
entries: The target takes {@dice 10d6} acid DoT damage.

items.name: 3. Yellow
entries: The target takes {@dice 10d6} lightning DoT damage.

items.name: 4. Green
entries: The target takes {@dice 10d6} poison DoT damage.

items.name: 5. Blue
entries: The target takes {@dice 10d6} cold DoT damage.

items.name: 6. Indigo
entries: The target is {@condition restrained|sns} for 1 minute.

items.name: 7. Violet
entries: The target is {@condition blinded|sns}. At the start of your next turn, the target makes a save, ending the effect on a success.

On a failed save, the target is banished to another random plane and is no longer blind. If it originated from another plane it returns there, while other creatures are generally cast into the Astral Plane or Ethereal Plane.

items.name: 8. Special
entries: The target is hit by two rays.
Roll a {@dice d8} twice to determine which rays, rerolling any 8s.

spell.name: Prismatic Wall

entries.name: Area
entries: 15-foot radius sphere, or 90-foot long wall that is 30 feet high and 1 inch thick

You create a nontransparent barrier of prismatic energy that sheds bright light in a 100-foot radius and dim light for an additional 100 feet. You and creatures you choose at the time of casting are immune to the barrier's effects and may pass through it at will.
The barrier can be created as either a vertical wall or a sphere. If the wall intersects a space occupied by a creature the spell fails, you lose your action, and the spell slot is wasted.
When a creature that can see the barrier moves within 20 feet of the area or starts its turn within 20 feet of the area, it makes a save, becoming {@condition blinded|sns} for 1 minute on a fail.
The wall has 7 layers, each layer of a different color in order from red to violet. Once a layer is destroyed, it is gone for the duration of the spell.

To pass or reach through the barrier a creature does so one layer at a time and must make a save for each layer or be subjected to that layer's effects. On a successful save, any damage taken from a layer is reduced by half.
An {@spell antimagic field|sns} has no effect on the wall or its layers.

items.name: Red
entries: The creature takes {@dice 10d6} fire DoT damage.
While active, nonmagical ranged attacks can't penetrate the barrier. The layer is destroyed by 28 cold damage.

items.name: Orange
entries: The creature takes {@dice 10d6} acid DoT damage. While active, magical ranged attacks can't penetrate the barrier. The layer is destroyed by strong winds.

items.name: Yellow
entries: The creature takes {@dice 10d6} lightning DoT damage. This layer is destroyed by 67 force damage.

items.name: Green
entries: The creature takes {@dice 10d6} poison DoT damage. A {@spell passwall|sns} spell, or any spell of equal or greater level which can create a portal on a solid surface, destroys the layer.

items.name: Blue
entries: The creature takes {@dice 10d6} cold DoT damage.
This layer is destroyed by 28 fire damage.

items.name: Indigo
entries: The creature is {@condition restrained|sns} for the spell's duration.

items.name: Violet
entries: The creature is {@condition blinded|sns}. At the start of your next turn, the creature makes a save, ending the effect on a success.

On a failed save, the creature is banished to another random plane and is no longer blind. If it originated from another plane it returns there, while other creatures are generally cast into the Astral Plane or Ethereal Plane. This layer can be destroyed by {@spell dispel magic|sns} or a similar spell of equal or greater level capable of ending spells or magical effects.

spell.name: Private Sanctum

entries.name: Area
entries: Cube of at least 5-feet or up to 100-feet
You increase the magical security in an area, choosing one or more of the following:

items: sound cannot pass the edge of the area.
light and vision cannot pass the edge of the area.
sensors created by divination spells can neither enter the area nor appear within it.
creatures within the area cannot be targeted by divination spells.
nothing can teleport into or out of the area.
planar travel is impossible within the area.

entries: Casting this spell on the same area every day for a year makes the duration permanent.

m.text: sheet of lead, piece of glass, wad of cotton or cloth, powdered chrysolite

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Increase the size of the sanctum by up to 100 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Produce Flame
entries: You create a flame in your hand which lasts until the spell ends and does no harm to you or your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

The spell ends when you dismiss it, cast it again, or attack with the flame. As part of casting the spell or as an action on a following turn, you can fling the flame at a creature within 30 feet, making an armour attack that deals {@dice 1d8} fire damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Charged Produce Flame. You conjure a ball of lightning in your hand instead of flame. The ball of lightning produces bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and when flung deals lightning damage instead of fire damage.

spell.name: Programmed Illusion

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot cube
You craft an illusory object, creature, or other effect which executes a scripted performance when a specific condition is met within 30 feet of the area.
You must describe both the condition and the details of the performance upon casting. The trigger must be based on something that can be seen or heard.
