Once the illusion triggers, it runs its performance for up to 5 minutes before it disappears and goes dormant for 10 minutes. The illusion is undetectable until then and only reactivates when the condition is triggered and after the dormant period has passed.

A creature can use an action to attempt an Investigation check against your standard DC to reveal the spell's illusory nature. Physical interactions reveal the illusion for what it is as things can pass through it with ease. A creature aware of the illusion perceives the image as transparent and the sounds it generates hollow.

m.text: some fleece and jade dust worth 25 gold

spell.name: Project Image
entries: You create an illusory duplicate of yourself that looks and sounds like you but is intangible. The duplicate can appear anywhere within range as long as you have seen the space before (it ignores any obstacles in the way).

You can use an action to move this duplicate up to twice your Speed and make it speak and behave in whatever way you choose, mimicking your mannerism with perfect accuracy. You can use a bonus action to see through your duplicate's eyes and hear through its ears until the beginning of your next turn. During this time, you are blind and deaf to your body's surroundings.

A creature can use an action to attempt an Investigation check against your standard DC to reveal the spell's illusory nature. Physical interactions reveal the illusion for what it is as things can pass through it with ease. A creature aware of the illusion perceives the image as transparent and the sounds it generates hollow.

m.text: replica of yourself made from materials worth 5 gold

spell.name: Protection from Energy

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
Until the spell ends, the target has 50% resistance to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 2nd, the target gains 50% resistance to one additional type of damage listed above, with a maximum number equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

spell.name: Protection from Evil and Good

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

The target is protected against the following types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on armour attack rolls against the target and are unable to {@condition charmed|sns|charm}, {@condition frightened|sns|frighten}, or possess the target.
If the target is already {@condition charmed|sns}, {@condition frightened|sns}, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any saves against that effect.

m.text: holy water or powdered silver and iron, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Protection from Poison

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

Attacks against the target that can {@condition poisoned|sns|poison} have disadvantage. Additionally, the target has 50% resistance to poison damage and advantage on saves against the {@condition poisoned|sns} condition.

Additionally, if the target is {@condition poisoned|sns}, you negate one poison affecting it. If more than one poison affects the target, you negate one poison you know is present (otherwise you negate one at random).

spell.name: Purify Food and Drink

entries.name: Area
entries: 5-foot radius sphere
You remove all poison and disease from a number of food and drink items equal to your proficiency bonus.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Remove all poison and disease from an additional food or drink item for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Rage of the Meek
entries: You unleash the discipline of your magical training and let arcane power burn from your fists, consuming the material components of the spell. Until the spell ends you have 50% resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and on each of your turns you can use an action to make a melee spell armour attack against an adjacent target that deals {@dice 4d8} force damage.

For the duration, you cannot cast other spells or concentrate on other spells. The spell ends early if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end this spell early on your turn as a bonus action.

curio,.text: or toy worth at least 20 gold, consumed by the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a spell slot of 5th- or 6th-level, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.
When using a spell slot of 7th- or 8th-level, the damage increases to {@dice 6d8}. When using a spell slot of 9th-level, the damage increases to {@dice 7d8}.

spell.name: Raise Hell

entries.name: Area
entries: Up to a 300-foot sphere

You transform the land around you into a blasted hellscape. When you cast the spell, all nonmagical vegetation in the area immediately dies. In addition, you can create any of the following effects within the area. Fiends are immune to these effects, as are any creatures you specify at the time you cast the spell. A successful {@spell dispel magic|sns} ends a single effect, not the entire area.

items.name: Brimstone Rubble
entries: You can fill any number of unoccupied 5-foot squares in the area with smoldering brimstone. These spaces become difficult terrain. These spaces are also a persistent zone that deals {@dice 2d10} fire DoT damage.

items.name: Field of Fear
entries: Dread pervades the entire area. A creature that starts its turn in the area must make a save, becoming {@condition frightened|sns} until the start of its next turn on a fail. While {@condition frightened|sns}, a creature must move at least half its Speed to escape the area by the safest available route on each of its turns. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to this effect for 24 hours.

items.name: Spawning Pits
entries: The ground opens to create up to 6 pits filled with poisonous bile. Each pit fills a 10-foot cube that drops beneath the ground.

When this spell is cast, any creature whose space is on a pit may make a save, moving to an unoccupied space next to the pit on a success. The pit is a persistent zone that deals {@dice 10d6} poison DoT damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage immediately dies and rises as a {@creature lemure} at the start of its next turn. Lemures created this way obey your verbal commands, but they disappear when the spell ends or if they leave the area for any reason.

items.name: Unhallowed Spires
entries: Up to four spires of black ice rise from the ground in unoccupied 10-foot squares within the area. Each spire can be up to 66 feet tall and is immune to all damage and magical effects. Whenever a creature within 30 feet of a spire would regain hit points, it does not regain hit points and instead takes {@dice 3d6} necrotic DoT damage.
If you maintain concentration on the spell for the full duration, the effects are permanent until dispelled.

m.text: drop of blood from a fallen angel, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Ray of Enfeeblement

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
A black ray of necrotic energy shoots from your fingertip. Make an armour attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target deals 1 fewer damage with weapon attacks governed by Strength for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: For the duration or until the target passes a passive save, it is weakened and only deals half damage with weapon attacks governed by Strength.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target's weapon attacks governed by Strength are also reduced by 1 success tier.

spell.name: Ray of Frost

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
An icy beam shoots from your outstretched fingers.
Make an armour attack that deals {@dice 1d8} cold damage and reduces the target's Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn on a hit.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Frigid Ray of Frost. A target that takes 20 or more damage from this spell reduces its Speed to 0 and becomes {@condition rattled|sns} until the beginning of your next turn as the cold penetrates to its very core.

spell.name: Regenerate

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You touch a creature, causing its body to spontaneously heal itself. The target immediately regains {@dice 3d12 + 16} hit points and regains 2 hit points at the start of each of its turns.
If the target is missing any body parts, the lost parts are restored after 2 minutes. If a severed part is held against the stump, the limb instantaneously reattaches itself.

spell.name: Remove Curse

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or object

This spell ends a curse inflicted with a spell slot of 3rd-level or lower. If the curse was instead inflicted by a feature or trait, the spell ends a curse inflicted by a creature of Challenge Rating 6 or lower. If cast on a cursed object, this spell breaks the owner's attunement to the item (although it does not end the curse on the object).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 3rd, the spell ends a curse inflicted either by a spell one level higher or by a creature with a Challenge Rating two higher.

spell.name: Resilient Sphere

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or object of Large size or smaller
A transparent sphere of force encloses the target. If the target is unwilling, make a reflex attack against it. Otherwise, use the standard success outcome. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The sphere lasts for 1 round and grants all attacks against the target disadvantage and grants all of the target's attacks disadvantage.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The sphere lasts until the spell ends and can be destroyed without harming anyone inside by being dealt at least 16 force damage at once or by being targeted with a {@spell dispel magic|sns} spell cast using a 4th-level or higher spell slot. The sphere is immune to all other damage, and no spell effects, physical objects, or anything else can pass through, though a target can breathe while inside it. The target cannot be damaged by any attacks or effects originating from outside the sphere, and the target cannot damage anything outside of it.
The target can use an action to roll the sphere at half its Speed. Similarly, the sphere can be picked up and moved by other creatures.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target cannot roll the sphere.

spell.name: Resistance

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and reduce a non-armour attack roll against them by that amount. It can roll the die before or after the attack roll is made. The spell then ends.

spell.name: Reverse Gravity

entries.name: Area
entries: 50-foot radius cylinder that is 100 feet high

Gravity reverses in the area. Any creatures or objects not anchored to the ground fall upward until they reach the top of the area. A creature may make a save, preventing the fall by grabbing hold of something on a success. If a solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered, the affected creatures and objects impact against it with the same force as a downward fall. When an object or creature reaches the top of the area, it remains suspended there until the spell ends.
When the spell ends, all affected objects and creatures fall back down.

spell.name: Rope Trick

entries.name: Target
entries: Rope that is up to 60 feet long

One end of the target rope rises into the air until it hangs perpendicular to the ground. At the upper end, a nearly imperceptible entrance opens to an extradimensional space that can fit up to 8 Medium or smaller creatures. The entrance can be reached by climbing the rope. Once inside, the rope can be pulled into the extradimensional space.

No effects can cross into or out of the extradimensional space. Creatures inside the extradimensional space can see out of a 3-foot-by5-foot window centered on its entrance. Creatures outside the space can spot the entrance with a Perception check against your standard DC. If they can reach it, creatures can pass in and out of the space.
When the spell ends, anything inside the extradimensional space falls to the ground.

m.text: braided silver chain of at least 50 gold, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Sacred Flame

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
A radiant holy flame envelops the target. Make a reflex attack against the target that deals {@dice 1d8} radiant damage. This attack ignores up to three-quarters cover.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

entries.name: Rare
entries: Komanov's Purifying Flame. When a target hit by this spell is undead, has the Evil trait, or is vulnerable to radiant damage, it is {@condition rattled|sns} for the next minute, or until it passes a passive save.

spell.name: Sanctuary

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You ward a creature against intentional harm.
Any creature that makes a non-area attack against the target must first make a save. On a failure, the attacking creature must choose a different creature to attack or it loses the attack.
This spell ends early when the target makes an attack.

spell.name: Scorching Ray

entries.name: Target
entries: One or more creatures or objects

Three rays of blazing orange fire shoot from your fingertips, which can all be shot at one target, or be divided across the targets in any way. For each unique target, make an armour attack that deals {@dice 2d6} fire damage for each ray shot at them. For example, if two rays are shot at one target, one attack is made against that target which deals {@dice 4d6} fire damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kasvarina's Imbued Ray. The rays are a different color chosen by you and deal damage of the corresponding type: black (necrotic), blue (cold), green (acid), purple (psychic), white (lightning), yellow (poison).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Create an additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Scrying

entries.name: Target
entries: A creature on the same plane of existence as you or a location you've seen before
You can see and hear a specific creature that you choose. If the target is unwilling, make a will attack against it. Otherwise, use the standard success outcome of the attack.
You have penalties or bonuses to the attack roll based on your knowledge of the target and whether you possess a physical item with a connection to the target.

entries.caption: Scrying
rows: You have heard of the target
Lock of hair, nail clipping, tooth, finger, true name, and so on

entries: The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: You get a still, instantaneous image from a sensor that appears within 10 feet of the target, pointed at the target. The sensor only appears for a fraction of a second, but when it does it flashes with bright, white light and makes an audible snapping sound that can be heard from up to 30 feet away.

items.name: Standard success
entries: You can see and hear the target through an {@condition invisible} sensor that appears within 10 feet of it and moves with the target. Any creature who can see invisibility perceives the sensor as a fist-sized glowing orb hovering in the air. Creatures cannot see or hear you through the sensor.
If you choose to target a location, the sensor appears at that location and is immobile.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you can change the angle and rotation of the sensor at will, so long as it remains within 10 feet of the target.

spell.name: Searing Equation

entries.name: Area
entries: 15-foot cone

You briefly go into a magical trance and whisper an alien equation which you never fully remember once the spell is complete. Make a will attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 3d6} psychic damage. On a hit, the target is also {@condition deafened|sns} for 1 round.
Creatures who are unable to hear the equation, immune to psychic damage, or who have an Intelligence score lower than 4 are immune to this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Creatures are {@condition deafened|sns} for 1 additional round for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Secret Chest
entries: You stash a chest and its contents on the Ethereal Plane. To do so, you must touch the chest and its Tiny replica. The chest can hold up to 12 cubic feet of nonliving matter. Food stored in the chest spoils after 1 day.

While the chest is in the Ethereal Plane, you can recall it to you at any point by using an action to touch the Tiny replica. The chest reappears in an unoccupied space on the ground adjacent to you. You can use an action at any time to return the chest to the Ethereal Plane so long as you are touching both the chest and its Tiny replica.

This effect ends if you cast the spell again on a different chest, if the replica is destroyed, or if you use an action to end the spell. After 60 days without being recalled, there is a cumulative 5% chance per day that the spell effect will end. If for whatever reason the spell ends while the chest is still in the Ethereal Plane, the chest and all of its contents are lost.

m.text: chest 3 feet by 2 feet by 2 feet, constructed from materials worth at least 5,000 gold, and a Tiny replica made of the same materials worth at least 50 gold

spell.name: Seed Bomb
entries: Up to four seeds appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. As an action, a creature can throw one of these seeds at a point up to 60 feet away. Regardless of who threw the seed, you make a ranged reflex spell attack against each creature adjacent to that point that deals {@dice 4d6} piercing damage. Depending on the material component used, a seed bomb also causes one of the following additional effects:

items.name: Pinecone
entries: Seed shrapnel explodes outward. If the attack scores a major success, the target is {@condition blinded|sns} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Sunflower
entries: Seeds enlarge into a blanket of pointy needles. The area affected by the exploding seed bomb becomes difficult terrain for the next minute.

items.name: Tumbleweed
entries: The weeds unravel to latch around creatures. If the attack scores a major success, the target becomes {@condition grappled|sns} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Nevard's Psionic Seed Bomb. The seed bombs created by this spell explode with the cries of dying sproutlings and deal psychic damage instead of piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: See Invisibility
entries: You can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear translucent.

spell.name: Seeming

entries.name: Target
entries: Any number of creatures in range

Until the spell ends or you use an action to dispel it, you can change the appearance of the targets. If a target is unwilling, make a will attack against it. Otherwise, use the standard success outcome of the attack. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: You can alter the target's physical facial features for 1 round, but not any of their clothing, weapons, or items.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The spell disguises the target's clothing, weapons, and items as well as changes to their physical appearance.

You can alter the appearance of the target as you see fit, including but not limited to: its heritage, 1 foot of height, weight, clothing, tattoos, piercings, facial features, hair style and length, skin and eye colouration, sex, and any other distinguishing features.

You cannot disguise the target as a creature of a different size category, and its limb structure remains the same; for example if it's bipedal, you can't use this spell to make it appear as a quadruped.

The disguise does not hold up to physical inspection. A creature that tries to grab an illusory hat, for example, finds its hand passes straight through the figment. To see through your disguise without such an inspection, a creature must use its action to make an Investigation check against your standard DC.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but you can alter a creature's shape to be one size category larger or smaller.

spell.name: Sending

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature you are familiar with

You send a message of 25 words or less to the target. It recognizes you as the sender and can reply immediately in kind. The message travels across any distance and into other planes of existence. If the target is on a different plane of existence than you, there is a 5% chance it doesn't receive your message. A target with an Intelligence score of at least 1 understands your message as you intend it (whether you share a language or not).

spell.name: Sequester

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature or object

You magically hide away a willing creature or object. The target becomes {@condition invisible}, and it cannot be traced or detected by divination or scrying sensors. If the target is a living creature, it falls into a state of suspended animation and stops aging.

The spell ends when the target takes damage or a condition you set occurs. The condition can be anything you choose, like a set amount of time or a specific event, but it must occur within or be visible within 1 mile of the target.

m.text: dust of diamonds, emeralds, rubies, and sapphires worth at least 5,000 gold, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Shatter

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius sphere

An ear-splitting ringing sound emanates through the area. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 4d6} thunder damage. The attack has advantage against a target made of stone, metal, or other inorganic material.
Any nonmagical items within the area that are not worn or carried also take damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shattering Barrage

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to three creatures
You create three orbs of jagged broken glass and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

For each unique target, make an armour attack that deals {@dice 2d4} slashing damage for each orb hurled at them (for example, a creature with two orbs hurled at them receives an attack that deals {@dice 4d4} slashing damage). On a hit, the shards of broken glass remain suspended in midair, filling the area they occupy (or 5 feet of the space they occupy if the creature is Large-sized or larger) with shards of suspended broken glass. This becomes a persistent zone that deals {@dice 1d4} slashing DoT damage for each orb that shattered there.
The shards of broken glass dissolve into harmless wisps of sand and blow away after 1 minute.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Persistent Shattering Barrage. The shards of broken glass do not dissolve harmlessly and instead fall, turning the area they occupy into difficult terrain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You create one additional orb for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shield

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the {@spell magic missile|sns} spell

entries: You create a shimmering arcane barrier between yourself and an oncoming attack. Until the spell ends, all armour attacks made against you have their success tier reduced by 1 (including the triggering attack) and any {@spell magic missile|sns} targeting you is harmlessly deflected.

spell.name: Shield of Faith

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Until the spell ends, a barrier of divine energy envelops the target and increases its armour by +2.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Komanov's Radiant Shield. When a creature makes a melee weapon attack against the target, it takes {@dice 1d6} radiant DoT damage as the shield sparks and flares with holy power.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The bonus to armour increases by +1 for every three slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Shillelagh

entries.name: Target
entries: A weapon you are carrying of the club category

You imbue the target with nature's magical energy. Until the spell ends, the target becomes a magical weapon (if it wasn't already) and its damage becomes {@dice 1d8} + INT/WIS/CHA. The spell ends if you cast it again or let go of the target.

spell.name: Shocking Grasp

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

Electricity arcs from your hand to shock the target. Make an armour attack (with advantage if the target is wearing body armour made of metal) that deals {@dice 1d8} lightning damage, and on a hit the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn as the electricity courses through its body.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Silence

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere
Until the spell ends, a bubble of silence envelops the area, and no sound can travel in or out of it.
While in the area a creature is {@condition deafened|sns} and immune to thunder damage. Casting a spell that requires a vocalized component is impossible while within the area.

spell.name: Silent Image

entries.name: Target
entries: 15-foot cube

You create an illusory image of a creature, object, or other visible effect within the area. The illusion is purely visual, it cannot produce sound or smell, and items and other creatures pass through it.
As an action, you can move the image to any point within range. The image's movement can be natural and lifelike (for example, a ball will roll and a bird will fly).
A creature can spend an action to make an Investigation check against your standard DC to determine if the image is an illusion. On a success, it is able to see through the image.

spell.name: Simulacrum

entries.name: Target
entries: One beast or humanoid that is within range for the entire casting time

You sculpt an illusory duplicate of the target from ice and snow. The duplicate looks exactly like the target and uses all the statistics of the original, though it is formed without any gear, and has only half of the target's hit point maximum. The duplicate is a creature, can take actions, and be affected like any other creature. If the target is able to cast spells, the duplicate cannot cast spells of 7th-level or higher.

The duplicate is friendly to you and creatures you designate. It follows your spoken commands, and moves and acts on your turn in combat. It is a static creature and it does not learn, age, or grow, so it never increases in levels and cannot regain any spent spell slots.
The simulacrum remains until it is reduced to 0 hit points, at which point it crumbles into snow and melts away immediately.
If you cast this spell again, any existing simulacrum you have created with this spell is instantly destroyed.

m.text: a snow or ice copy of the target, a piece of the target's body placed inside the snow or ice, and powdered ruby worth 1,500 gold sprinkled over the duplicate, all consumed by the spell

spell.name: Sleep

entries.name: Target
entries: The creature in the area with the fewest hit points

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius
You send the target into a magical slumber.
The target falls {@condition unconscious|sns}. Slumbering creatures stay asleep until the spell ends, they take damage, or someone uses an action to physically wake them.
Constructs and undead are not affected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Add an additional target with the next-fewest hit points in the area for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sleet Storm

entries.name: Area
entries: 40-foot radius cylinder that is 20 feet high

You conjure a storm of freezing rain and sleet in the area. The ground in the area is covered with slick ice that makes it difficult terrain, exposed flames in the area are doused, and the area is heavily obscured.

The area becomes a persistent zone that forces creatures within it to succeed on a save or fall {@condition prone|sns}. Additionally, if the creature is concentrating, it must succeed on a save or lose concentration.

spell.name: Slow

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to six creatures of your choice

entries.name: Area
entries: 40-foot cube
You alter the flow of time around your targets. Make a will attack against each target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition rattled|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target becomes {@condition slowed|sns} until it passes a passive save.
The {@condition slowed|sns} target is also {@condition debilitated|sns} while casting spells.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is {@condition debilitated|sns}.

spell.name: Soulwrought Fists

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

The target's hands harden with inner power, turning dexterous fingers into magical iron cudgels. If the target is unwilling, make a fortitude attack against it. Otherwise, automatically use the standard success outcome without making an attack. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target immediately drops anything it is holding with its main hand.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Until the spell ends, the target drops anything it is holding and cannot use its hands to grasp objects or perform complex tasks. A target can still cast any spell that does not specifically require its hands.

When making unarmed strikes with its hands, the target can use its spellcasting ability or Dexterity (its choice) to govern the attack. In addition, the target's unarmed strikes with its hands have a base damage die of {@dice 1d8}, deal bludgeoning damage, and their base damage ignores resistance and immunity.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target cannot cast any spells that require a somatic component.

spell.name: Spare the Dying

entries.name: Target
entries: One living creature with 0 hit points
A jolt of healing energy flows through the target. Make a Medicine check with advantage to stabilise the target.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Komanov's Costly Spare the Dying. For the next 3 rounds, at the start of its turn the target rolls {@dice 1d20}, regaining 1 hit point on a result of 20.
Whether or not it regains any hit points, for the next 24 hours the target is {@condition rattled|sns}.

spell.name: Speak with Animals
entries: You call upon the secret lore of beasts and gain the ability to speak with them. Beasts have a different perspective of the world, and their knowledge and awareness is filtered through that perspective. At a minimum, beasts can tell you about nearby locations and monsters, including things they have recently perceived. At the DM's discretion, you might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Nevard's Insightful Speak with Animals. So long as your standard DC is higher than the passive Insight score of a beast you are conversing with, you can use an action to view the memories of an event the beast is describing.

spell.name: Speak with Dead

entries.name: Target
entries: One corpse

You call forth the target's memories, animating it enough to answer 5 questions. The corpse's knowledge is limited: it knows only what it knew in life and cannot learn new information or speak about anything that has occurred since its death. It speaks only in the languages it knew, and is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if it has reason not to. Answers might be brief, cryptic, or repetitive. This spell does not return a departed soul, nor does it have any effect on an undead corpse, or one without a mouth.

spell.name: Speak with Plants

entries.name: Target
entries: Plants in a 30-foot radius

Your voice takes on a magical timbre, awakening the targets to limited sentience. Until the spell ends, the targets can communicate with you and follow simple commands, telling you about recent events including creatures that have passed, weather, and nearby locations.

The targets have a limited mobility: they can move their branches, tendrils, and stalks freely. This allows them to turn ordinary terrain into difficult terrain, or make difficult terrain caused by vegetation into ordinary terrain for the duration as vines and branches move at your request. This spell can also release a creature {@condition restrained|sns} by an {@spell entangle|sns} spell.

At the DM's discretion the targets may be able to perform other tasks, though each must remain rooted in place. If a plant creature is in the area, you can communicate with it but it is not compelled to follow your requests.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Insightful Speak with Plants. So long as your standard DC is higher than the passive Insight score of a plant you are conversing with, you can use an action to view the memories of an event the plant is describing.

spell.name: Spider Climb

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
The target gains the ability to walk on walls and upside down on ceilings, as well as a climbing speed equal to its base Speed.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Cyneburg's Sure-Footed Spider Climb. The target automatically succeeds on ability checks and saves made to keep its balance, and similar attacks against it always score critical failures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You can affect one additional target for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Spike Growth

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius

You cause sharp spikes and thorns to sprout in the area, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters or moves within the area, it takes {@dice 2d4} piercing DoT damage for every 5 feet it travels.

Your magic causes the ground to look natural. A creature that can't see the area when the spell is cast can spot the hazardous terrain just before entering it by making a Perception check against your standard DC.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Sneaky Spike Growth. The spikes and thorns created by this spell are {@condition invisible} and a creature cannot perceive them until it has been damaged by this spell.

m.text: seven sharp thorns, or small, sharpened twigs

spell.name: Spirit Guardians

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius
You call down spirits of divine fury, filling the area with flitting spectral forms. You choose the form taken by the spirits.
Creatures of your choice halve their Speed while in the area. The area also becomes a persistent zone that deals {@dice 2d6} radiant or necrotic DoT damage (your choice).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spiritual Weapon
entries: You create a floating, incandescent weapon with an appearance of your choosing and use it to attack your enemies. On the round you cast it, a creature of your choice adjacent to the weapon takes force DoT damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
As a bonus action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and deal the damage to a creature adjacent to it.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Komanov's Fell Spiritual Weapon. The weapon deals necrotic damage instead of force damage, and when it rolls maximum damage its target is {@condition rattled|sns} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Sporesight

entries.name: Area
entries: 50-foot radius sphere

You throw a mushroom at a point within range and detonate it, creating a cloud of spores that fills the area. The cloud of spores travels around corners, and the area is considered lightly obscured for everyone except you. Creatures and objects within the area are covered in spores.

Until the spell ends, you know the exact location of all affected objects and creatures. Any armour attack roll you make against an affected creature or object has advantage, and the affected creatures and objects can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Sidoneth's Poisonous Sporesight. Choose a number of creatures in the area equal to your proficiency bonus. The area is a persistent zone that deals {@dice 1d10} poison DoT damage.

spell.name: Stinking Cloud

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere
You create a roiling, noxious cloud that hinders creatures and leaves them retching. The cloud spreads around corners and lingers in the air until the spell ends.
The area is heavily obscured. A creature in the area at the start of its turn makes a save or becomes {@condition debilitated|sns} until the end of that turn.
Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on the save.
A moderate wind (10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds, a strong wind (20 miles per hour) after 1 round.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Diogenes' Dyed Stinking Cloud. Choose a color for the cloud when you cast this spell.
When a creature makes a save against this spell it is dyed that color until it uses an action to wipe away the residue.

m.text: rotten egg or dried fish scale

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's area increases by 5 feet for every 2 slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Stone Shape

entries.name: Target
entries: One stone object of Medium size or smaller, or a 5-foot section of stone
You reshape the target into any form you choose.

For example, you could shape a large rock into a weapon, statue, or chest, make a small passage through a wall (as long as it isn't more than 5 feet thick), seal a stone door shut, or create a hiding place. The target can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

m.text: soft clay shaped as part of the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You may select one additional target for every slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Stoneskin

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
Until the spell ends, the target's flesh becomes as hard as stone and it gains 50% resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

m.text: diamond dust worth 100 gold, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Storm Kick

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You must be able to move in order to cast this spell.

You leap into the air and flash across the battlefield, arriving feet-first with the force of a thunderbolt. As part of casting this spell, make an armour attack against a creature within range. You instantly flash to an open space of your choosing adjacent to the target, and the attack deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting modifier plus {@dice 3d8} thunder damage and {@dice 6d8} lightning damage. If your unarmed strike normally uses a larger die, use that instead of a {@dice d6}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 6th-level spell slot or higher, if you have the Empowered Attack feature, one instance of it applies to this spell. When using a 7th-level spell slot, you may choose an additional target within 30 feet of the target for each spell slot level above 6th, forcing each additional target to make a save or take {@dice 6d8} lightning DoT damage.

spell.name: Storm of Vengeance

entries.name: Target
entries: 360-foot radius area that is up to 5,000 feet in the air

You conjure a churning storm cloud that spreads to cover the target area. As it forms, lightning and thunder mix with howling winds. Make a fortitude attack against each creature beneath the cloud that deals {@dice 2d6} thunder damage. On a hit, a target becomes {@condition deafened|sns} for 5 minutes.
Until the spell ends, at the start of your turn the cloud produces additional effects:

items.name: Round 2
entries: Acidic rain falls throughout the area dealing {@dice 1d6} acid DoT damage to each creature and object beneath the cloud.

items.name: Round 3
entries: Lightning bolts strike up to 6 creatures or objects of your choosing that are beneath the cloud (no more than one bolt per creature or object). A creature struck by this lightning takes {@dice 5d8} lightning DoT damage.

items.name: Round 4
entries: Hailstones fall throughout the area dealing {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning DoT damage to each creature beneath the cloud.

items.name: Round 5-10
entries: Gusts and freezing rain turn the area beneath the cloud into difficult terrain that is heavily obscured. Ranged weapon attacks are impossible while a creature or its target are beneath the cloud. When a creature concentrating on a spell starts its turn beneath the cloud or enters into the area, it makes a save, losing concentration on a fail. Gusts of strong winds between 20-50 miles per hour automatically disperse fog, mists, and similar effects (whether mundane or magical). Finally, each creature beneath the cloud takes {@dice 1d6} cold DoT damage.

spell.name: Suggestion

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Creatures that cannot be {@condition charmed} are immune to this spell. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: You gain an expertise die on the first Persuasion check you make against the target before the end of your next turn.

items.name: Standard success
entries: Suggest an activity phrased in a sentence or two. The target is magically influenced to follow that course of activity. The suggestion must be worded to sound reasonable. Asking the target to perform an action that is obviously harmful to it ends the spell.

The target carries out the activity suggested by you as well as it can. The activity can last for the duration of the spell, and if it requires less time the spell ends after the target has carried out the activity.

You may specify trigger conditions that cause the target to perform a specific activity while the spell lasts. For example, you may suggest that the target takes off its clothes and dives the next time it sees a body of water. If the target does not see a body of water before the spell ends, the specific activity isn't performed.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the suggestion can span up to three sentences.
Any damage dealt to the target by you or an ally ends the spell for that creature.

m.text: miniature bottle of red wine and some soap

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 4th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 24 hours. When using a 5th-level spell slot, the duration is 7 days. When using a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is 1 year. When using a 9th-level spell slot, the suggestion lasts until it is dispelled.
Any use of a 5th-level or higher spell slot grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Sunbeam

entries.name: Area
entries: Line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide

A beam of radiant sunlight streaks from your hand. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 9d6} radiant damage. This attack has advantage on oozes and undead. On a hit, a target is {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

Until the spell ends, you can use an action on subsequent turns to create a new beam of sunlight and a mote of brilliant radiance lingers on your hand, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light an additional 30 feet. This light is sunlight.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using an 8th-level spell slot the damage increases by {@dice 2d6}.

spell.name: Sunburst

entries.name: Area
entries: 60-foot radius

You create a burst of radiant sunlight that fills the area. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 7d12} radiant damage. This attack has advantage against oozes and undead. On a hit, a target is {@condition blinded|sns} for 1 minute, or until it passes a passive save.
This spell dispels any magical darkness in its area.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Disorienting Sunburst. A creature that takes 56 or more damage from this spell is {@condition confused|sns}. At the start of each of its turns, a creature {@condition confused|sns} by this spell makes a save, ending that effect on itself on a success.

m.text: piece of sunstone and a bead of stained glass

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 9th-level spell slot the damage increases by {@dice 2d12}.

spell.name: Symbol

entries.name: Target
entries: One object or a surface no larger than 10 feet in diameter

You inscribe a potent glyph on the target, setting a magical trap for your enemies. If the glyph is moved more than 10 feet from its original position, or if it comes within 20 feet of another glyph that you have cast, the spell ends. Finding the Tiny glyph requires an Investigation check against your standard DC.

Describe the actions a creature must perform to trigger the spell, such as approaching within a certain distance, opening or touching the object the glyph is inscribed on, or seeing or reading the glyph. The creature must have a clear path to the glyph to trigger it. You can specify certain creatures which don't trigger the spell, such as those with a certain appearance or those who speak a certain phrase. Once the glyph is triggered, the spell ends.

When triggered, the glyph sheds dim light in a 60-foot radius for 10 minutes, after which the spell ends. Each creature within the sphere's area is targeted by the glyph, as are creatures that enter the sphere for the first time on a turn.
When you cast the spell, choose one of the following effects.

items.name: Death
entries: Make a fortitude attack against creatures in the area that deals {@dice 10d12} necrotic damage.

items.name: Discord
entries: Creatures in the area make a save or bicker and argue with other creatures for 1 minute. While bickering, a creature cannot meaningfully communicate and it has disadvantage on armour attack rolls and ability checks.

items.name: Confusion
entries: Creatures in the area make a save or become {@condition confused|sns} for 1 minute.

items.name: Fear
entries: Creatures in the area make a save or are {@condition frightened|sns} for 1 minute.
While {@condition frightened|sns}, a creature drops whatever it is holding and must move at least 30 feet away from the glyph on each of its turns.

items.name: Hopelessness
entries: Creatures in the area make a save or become overwhelmed with despair for 1 minute. While despairing, a creature can't attack any creature.

items.name: Pain
entries: Creatures in the area make a save or become {@condition dazed|sns} for 1 minute.

items.name: Sleep
entries: Creatures in the area make a save or fall {@condition unconscious|sns} for 10 minutes.
A sleeping creature awakens if it takes damage or an action is used to wake it.

items.name: Debilitation
entries: Creatures in the area make a save or become {@condition debilitated|sns} for 1 minute

m.text: mercury, phosphorous, and powdered diamond and opal with a total value of at least 1,000 gold, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Tearful Sonnet

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius

You quietly play a tragedy, a song that fills those around you with magical sorrow. Each creature in the area makes a save at the start of its turn. On a fail, a creature takes {@dice 2d4} psychic DoT damage, it is {@condition debilitated|sns} for that turn due to its crying, and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. Creatures that are immune to the {@condition charmed|sns} condition automatically succeed on this save.

If a creature other than you hears the entire song (remaining within the spell's area from the casting through the duration) it is so wracked with sadness that it is {@condition debilitated|sns} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
You cannot cast another spell with material components while concentrating on this spell.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Pervading Tearful Sonnet. This spell deals double the normal damage against {@condition frightened|sns} creatures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Telekinesis

entries.name: Target
entries: One Huge or smaller creature or object (up to 1,000 pounds)
You move the target with the power of your mind.

Until the spell ends you can use an action on subsequent turns to pick a new target or continue to affect the same target. Depending on whether you target a creature or an object, the spell has the following effects:

items.name: Creature
entries: The target makes a Brawn check against your standard DC or it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction and {@condition restrained|sns} (even in mid-air) until the end of your next turn. You cannot move a target beyond the range of the spell.

items.name: Object
entries: You move the target 30 feet in any direction. If the object is worn or carried by a creature, that creature can make a Brawn check against your standard DC. If the target fails, you pull the object away from that creature and can move it up to 30 feet in any direction, but not beyond the range of the spell.
You can use telekinesis to finely manipulate objects as though you were using them yourself — you can open doors and unscrew lids, dip a quill in ink and make it write, and so on.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using an 8th-level spell slot, this spell does not require your concentration.

spell.name: Telepathic Bond

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to eight willing creatures of Intelligence 3 or higher

Until the spell ends, a telepathic link connects the minds of the targets. So long as they remain on the same plane of existence, targets may communicate telepathically with each other regardless of language and across any distance.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Aurana's Exceptional Telepathic Bond. This spell functions even when targets are on different planes of existence.

m.text: two matching cards from different decks

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's duration increases by {@dice 1d4} hours for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Teleport

entries.name: Target
entries: You and up to 8 willing creatures within 10 feet of you, or a single unattended object that fits entirely inside a 10-foot cube

You teleport the targets instantly across vast distances. When you cast this spell, choose a destination. You must know the location you're teleporting to, and it must be on the same plane of existence.

Teleportation is difficult magic and you may arrive off-target or somewhere else entirely depending on how familiar you are with the location you're teleporting to. When you teleport, the DM rolls 1d100 and consults Table: Teleport Familiarity.
Familiarity is determined as follows:

items.name: Permanent Circle
entries: A permanent teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know (see teleportation circle).

items.name: Associated Object
entries: You have an object taken from the target location within the last 6 months, such as a piece of wood from the pew in a grand temple or a pinch of grave dust from a vampire's hidden redoubt.

items.name: Very Familiar
entries: A place you have frequented, carefully studied, or can see at the time you cast the spell.

items.name: Seen Casually
entries: A place you have seen more than once but don't know well. This could be a castle you've passed by but never visited, or the farms you look down on from your tower of ivory.

items.name: Viewed Once
entries: A place you have seen once, either in person or via magic.

items.name: Description
entries: A place you only know from someone else's description (whether spoken, written, or even marked on a map).

items.name: False Destination
entries: A place that doesn't actually exist. This typically happens when someone deceives you, either intentionally (like a wizard creating an illusion to hide their actual tower) or unintentionally (such as when the location you attempt to teleport to no longer exists).
Your arrival is determined as follows:

items.name: On Target
entries: You and your targets arrive exactly where you mean to.

items.name: Off Target
entries: You and your targets arrive some distance away from the target in a random direction. The further you travel, the further away you are likely to arrive. You arrive off target by a number of miles equal to 1d10 x 1d10 percent of the total distance of your trip.

If you tried to travel 1,000 miles and roll a 2 and 4 on the d10s, you land 6 percent off target and arrive 60 miles away from your intended destination in a random direction. Roll 1d8 to randomly determine the direction: 1 — north, 2 — northeast, 3 — east, 4 — southeast, 5 — south, 6 — southwest, 7 — west, 8 — northwest.

items.name: Similar Location
entries: You and your targets arrive in a different location that somehow resembles the target area. If you tried to teleport to your favorite inn, you might end up at a different inn, or in a room with much of the same decor.
Typically you appear at the closest similar location, but that is not always the case.

items.name: Mishap
entries: The spell's magic goes awry, and each teleporting creature or object takes 3d10 force damage. The Narrator rerolls on the table to determine where you arrive. When multiple mishaps occur targets take damage each time.

spell.name: Teleportation Circle

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot diameter circle

You draw a 10-foot diameter circle on the ground and open within it a shimmering portal to a permanent teleportation circle elsewhere in the world. The portal remains open until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the portal instantly travels to the destination circle.

Permanent teleportation circles are commonly found within major temples, guilds, and other important locations. Each circle has a unique sequence of magical runes inscribed in a certain pattern called a sigil sequence.

When you cast teleportation circle, you inscribe runes that match the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle you know. When you first gain the ability to cast this spell, you learn the sigil sequences for 2 destinations on the Material Plane, determined by the DM. You can learn a new sigil sequence with 1 minute of observation and study.

Casting the spell in the same location every day for a year creates a permanent teleportation circle with its own unique sigil sequence. You do not need to teleport when casting the spell to make a permanent destination.

m.text: rare chalks and inks worth 50 gold

spell.name: Thaumaturgy

entries.name: Area
entries: Special
You draw upon divine power and create a minor divine effect. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following:

items: Your voice booms up to three times louder than normal
You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color
You send harmless tremors throughout the ground.
You create an instantaneous sound, like ethereal chimes, sinister laughter, or a dragon's roar at a point of your choosing within range.
You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
You alter the appearance of your eyes.

entries: Lingering effects last until the spell ends. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to 3 of the lingering effects active at a time, and can dismiss an effect at any time on your turn.

spell.name: Thunderwave

entries.name: Area
entries: 15-foot cube

You create a wave of thunderous force, damaging creatures and pushing them back. Make a fortitude attack against all creatures in the area that deals {@dice 4d4} thunder damage. On a hit, a creature is pushed 10 feet away from you.
Unsecured objects completely within the area are also pushed 10 feet away from you. The thunderous boom of the spell is audible out to 300 feet.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Vorax-Hul's Shaking Thunderwave. A creature hit by this spell that takes 10 or more damage is knocked {@condition prone|sns}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Time Stop
entries: You stop time, granting yourself extra time to take actions. When you cast the spell, the world is frozen in place while you take {@dice 1d4 + 1} turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal.
The spell ends if you move more than 1,000 feet from where you cast the spell, or if you affect either a creature other than yourself or an object worn or carried by someone else.

spell.name: Tiny Hut

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius hemisphere

You create an immobile dome of protective force that provides shelter and can be used as a haven. The dome is of a color of your choosing, can't be seen through from the outside, is transparent on the inside, and can fit up to 10 Medium creatures (including you) within.

The dome prevents inclement weather and environmental effects from passing through it, though creatures and objects may pass through freely. Spells and other magical effects can't cross the dome in either direction, and the dome provides a comfortable dry interior no matter the conditions outside of it. You can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark at any time on your turn.
The spell fails if a Large creature or more than 10 creatures are inside the dome. The spell ends when you leave the dome.

m.text: piece of thatched roof woven into a dome and a sculpture of a protective deity worth 200 gold, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Tongues

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
The target understands any words it hears, and when the target speaks its words are understood by creatures that know at least one language.

spell.name: Transport via Plants

entries.name: Target
entries: Large or larger inanimate plant

You create a magical pathway between the target and a second plant that you've seen or touched before that is on the same plane of existence. Any creature can step into the target and exit from the second plant by using 5 feet of movement.

spell.name: Traveler's Ward

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
Until the spell ends, creatures have disadvantage on Sleight of Hand checks made against the target.
If a creature fails a Sleight of Hand check to steal from the target, the ward creates a loud noise and a flash of bright light easily heard and seen by creatures within 100 feet.

spell.name: Tree Stride
entries: Until the spell ends, once per round you can use 5 feet of movement to enter a living tree and move to inside another living tree of the same kind within 500 feet so long as you end your turn outside of a tree. Both trees must be at least your size. You instantly know the location of all other trees of the same kind within 500 feet. You may step back outside of the original tree or spend 5 more feet of movement to appear within a spot of your choice adjacent to the destination tree. If you have no movement left, you appear adjacent to the tree you entered.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Target one additional creature within reach for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: True Seeing

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
Until the spell ends, the target gains truesight to a range of 120 feet. The target also notices secret doors hidden by magic.

m.text: an ointment for the eyes made from mushroom powder, saffron, and fat costing 25 gold, consumed by the spell

spell.name: True Strike
entries: You gain an innate understanding of the defenses of a creature or object in range. You have advantage on your first armour attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kasvarina's Greater True Strike. You gain an almost total understanding of a creature or object's defenses and body language. The duration increases to Concentration (1 minute) and you gain advantage to three additional armour attack rolls of your choice that are made before the spell ends. Once per round, you can choose to use that advantage when you make your first armour attack roll on your turn.

spell.name: Unholy Star

entries.name: Area
entries: Four 5-foot radius spheres
A meteor ripped from diabolical skies streaks through the air and explodes at a point 100 feet directly above you.

Make a reflex attack against each creature within range that can see the meteor (other than you) must make a save, becoming {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn on a fail. Fiery chunks of the meteor then plummet to the ground at different areas you choose within range. Make a reflex attack against each creature in an area that deals {@dice 5d8} fire damage and {@dice 5d8} necrotic damage. A creature in more than one area is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

spell.name: Unseen Servant
entries: You create an {@condition invisible}, mindless, shapeless force to perform simple tasks. The servant appears in an unoccupied space on the ground that you can see and endures until it takes damage, moves more than 60 feet away from you, or the spell ends. It has 0 in all defences, a Strength of 2, and it can't attack.
You can use a bonus action to mentally command it to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object.

The servant can do anything a humanoid servant can do — fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, pouring wine, and so on. Once given a command the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until the task is completed, then waits for its next command.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Harkover's Improved Unseen Servant. The servant has a Strength of 10, allowing it to accomplish physical labors such as lifting a fallen tree or clearing a hallway blocked with rubble.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You create an additional servant for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Vampiric Touch
entries: Shadows roil about your hand and heal you by siphoning away the life force from others. On the round you cast it, and as an action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can make a melee spell armour attack against a creature within your reach.
The attack deals {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Ravjahani's Distant Vampiric Touch. Instead of making melee attacks, you make ranged attacks (range 10/20 ft.) in the form of shadowy lines that streak from your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Venomous Succor

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You cause a searing poison to burn quickly through the target's wounds. The target makes a save. On a fail, the target takes {@dice 1d6} poison DoT damage and regains {@dice 1d10} hit points at the start of each of its turns for the next {@dice 1d4+1} rounds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 2nd, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and target regains an additional {@dice 1d10} hit points.

spell.name: Vicious Mockery

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You verbally insult or mock the target so viciously its mind is seared. As long as the target hears you (understanding your words is not required), make a will attack against it that deals {@dice 1d6} psychic damage. On a hit, the target has disadvantage on the first armour attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

entries.name: Rare
entries: Koren's Taunting Vicious Mockery. Your amazingly effective insults and mockeries also entertain others— even the target's allies. On a hit the target has disadvantage on all armour attack rolls next round, and if it makes an armour attack it can only target you (it can take other actions, but if the target takes the Attack action or casts a spell that includes an armour attack, that attack must be against you). Persuasion checks you make against the target have disadvantage, even after the spell's duration ends.

spell.name: Wall of Fire

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

You create a wall of fire on a solid surface. The wall can be up to 60 feet long (it does not have to be a straight line; sections of the wall can angle as long as they are contiguous), 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall blocks sight. When the wall appears, make a reflex attack against each creature within its area that deals {@dice 7d6} fire damage.

One side of the wall (chosen when the spell is cast) deals {@dice 5d8} fire DoT damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall itself for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Wall of Flesh

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

A squirming wall of bodies, groping arms and tentacles, and moaning, biting mouths heaves itself up from the ground at a point you choose. The wall is 6 inches thick and is made up of a contiguous group of ten 10-foot square sections. The wall can have any shape you desire.
If the wall enters a creature's space when it appears, the creature makes a save, and on a success it moves up to its Speed to escape. On a failed save, it is swallowed by the wall (as below).

When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn within 10 feet of the wall, tentacles and arms reach out to grab it. The creature makes a save or takes {@dice 5d8} bludgeoning DoT damage and becomes {@condition grappled|sns}. If the creature was already {@condition grappled|sns} by the wall at the start of its turn and fails its save, a mouth opens in the wall and swallows the creature.
A creature swallowed by the wall takes {@dice 5d8} ongoing bludgeoning damage and is {@condition blinded|sns}, {@condition deafened|sns}, and {@condition restrained|sns}.

A creature {@condition grappled|sns} or {@condition restrained|sns} by the wall can use its action to make a save. On a success, a {@condition grappled|sns} creature frees itself and a {@condition restrained|sns} creature claws its way out of the wall's space, exiting to an empty space next to the wall and still {@condition grappled|sns}.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Eager Wall of Flesh. The wall's reach increases and it can target creatures within 15 feet of it. In addition, when a creature substantially fails its save against the wall the wall swallows the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above the 6th.

spell.name: Wall of Force

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

You create an {@condition invisible} wall of force at a point you choose. The wall is a horizontal or vertical barrier, or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere, either with a radius of up to 10 feet. You may also choose to create a flat surface made up of a contiguous group of ten 10-foot square sections. The wall is 1/4 inch thick.

If the wall enters a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice), but when a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall (or the wall and another solid surface), it can use its reaction to make a save. On a success, it can move up to its Speed to escape. Any creature without a special sense like blindsight has disadvantage on this save.
Nothing can physically pass through the wall.

It can be destroyed with {@spell dispel magic|sns} cast using a spell slot of at least 5th-level or by being dealt at least 28 force damage at once. It is otherwise immune to damage. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through it.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Aurana's Superior Forcewall. Creatures pushed to one side of the wall are knocked {@condition prone|sns}. The wall can be destroyed with a {@spell dispel magic|sns} cast using a spell slot of at least 6th-level or by being dealt at least 56 force damage at once. It is otherwise immune to damage.

spell.name: Wall of Ice

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

You create a wall of ice on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere, either with a radius of up to 10 feet. You may also choose to create a flat surface made up of a contiguous group of ten 10-foot square sections. The wall is 1 foot thick.
If the wall enters a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of it (your choice).
In addition, make a reflex attack against the creature that deals {@dice 6d12} cold damage.

The wall is an object with vulnerability to fire damage, with 1 Armour and 33 hit points per 10-foot section. Reducing a 10-foot section of wall to 0 hit points destroys it and leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the section occupied. A creature moving through the sheet of frigid air for the first time on a turn takes {@dice 2d10} cold DoT damage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Glacier. The wall is not vulnerable to fire damage. Each section has 2 Armour and 39 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage the wall deals when it appears increases by {@dice 2d12} and the damage from passing through the sheet of frigid air increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Wall of Stone

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

A nonmagical wall of solid stone appears at a point you choose. The wall is 6 inches thick and is made up of a contiguous group of ten 10-foot square sections. Alternatively, you can create 10-foot-by-20- foot sections that are only 3 inches thick.
The wall can have any shape you desire, though it can't occupy the same space as a creature or object.
The wall doesn't need to be vertical or rest on any firm foundation but must merge with and be solidly supported by existing stone. Thus, you can use this spell to bridge a chasm or create a ramp.

If the wall enters a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice), but when a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall (or the wall and another solid surface), it can use its reaction to make a save. On a success, it can move up to its Speed to escape.
If you create a span greater than 20 feet in length, you must halve the size of each panel to create supports. You can crudely shape the wall to create crenelations, battlements, and so on.
The wall is an object made of stone. Each panel has 2 Armour and 33 hit points per inch of thickness.
Reducing a panel to 0 hit points destroys it and at the DM's discretion might cause connected panels to collapse.
You can make the wall permanent by concentrating on the spell for the full duration.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Gabal's Hardy Wall of Stone. Each panel has 4 Armour and 45 hit points per inch of thickness.
Reducing a panel to 0 hit points destroys it but does not cause connected panels to collapse.

spell.name: Wall of Thorns

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

You create a wall of tough, pliable, tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns on a solid surface. You can choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight. When the wall appears, make a reflex attack against each creature within its area that deals {@dice 10d6} piercing damage.

A creature can move through the wall, albeit slowly and painfully. For every 1 foot a creature moves through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. The first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, it takes {@dice 6d6} slashing DoT damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Damage dealt by the wall increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Warding Bond

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

Until the spell ends, the target is warded by a mystic connection between it and you. While the target is within 60 feet it gains a +1 bonus to all defences, and it has 50% resistance to all damage. Each time it takes damage, you take an equal amount of damage.

The spell ends if you are reduced to 0 hit points or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if you use an action to dismiss it, or if the spell is cast again on either you or the target.

m.text: pair of platinum rings worth at least 50 gold each, which you and the target must wear for the duration

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Warrior's Instincts
entries: Your senses sharpen, allowing you to anticipate incoming attacks and find weaknesses in the defenses of your foes. Until the spell ends, creatures cannot gain bonuses (like those granted by bless or expertise dice) or advantage on armour attack rolls against you. In addition, none of your movement provokes opportunity attacks, and you ignore nonmagical difficult terrain. Finally, you can end the spell early to treat a single weapon attack roll as though you had rolled a 15 on the {@dice d20}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 5th, you can also apply this spell's benefits to an additional creature you can see within 30 feet.

spell.name: Water Breathing

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to ten willing creatures you can see
Until the spell ends, the targets are able to breathe underwater (and still able to respirate normally).

m.text: short reed or piece of straw

spell.name: Water Walk

entries.name: Target
entries: Up to ten willing creatures you can see
Until the spell ends, the targets are able to move across any liquid surface (such as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava) as if it was solid ground.
Creatures can still take damage from surfaces that would deliver damage from corrosion or extreme temperatures, but they do not sink while moving across it.
A target submerged in a liquid is moved to the surface of the liquid at a rate of 60 feet per round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Web

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot cube
Thick, sticky webs fill the area, lightly obscuring it and making it difficult terrain.

You must anchor the webs between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layer them across a flat surface. If you don't the conjured webs collapse and at the start of your next turn the spell ends.
Webs layered over a flat surface are 5 feet deep.
The area becomes a persistent zone that forces creatures within to pass a save or become {@condition restrained|sns} as long as it remains in the webs (or until the creature breaks free).
A creature {@condition restrained|sns} by the webs can escape by using its action to make a Brawn check against your standard DC.
Any 5-foot cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing {@dice 2d4} fire DoT damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Kreven's Potent Web. Checks made by {@condition restrained|sns} creatures to escape the web have disadvantage.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Katrina's Flammable Web. Any 10-foot cube of webs exposed to fire burns away instantly, dealing {@dice 3d4} fire DoT damage to any creature in the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 4th-level spell slot, you also summon a {@creature giant wolf spider} in an unoccupied space within the web's area. When using a 7th-level spell slot, you summon a {@creature giant spider}.
The spider is friendly to you and your companions and counts as a minion. The spider obeys your verbal commands, but it disappears when the spell ends or when it leaves the web's area.

spell.name: Weird

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot sphere

You create illusions which manifest the deepest fears and worst nightmares in the minds of all creatures in the spell's area. Make a will attack against each creature in the area with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition sluggish|sns} while moving towards you for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target becomes {@condition frightened|sns} until the spell ends, or it passes a passive save. Whenever the target fails this passive save, it takes {@dice 4d10} psychic DoT damage.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the psychic damage is increased to {@dice 8d10}.

spell.name: Whirlwind Kick

entries.name: Area
entries: Line up to 60 feet long and 15 feet wide

You must have a usable speed greater than 0 and not be {@condition sluggish|sns} to cast this spell. You leap into the air and spin like a tornado, striking foes all around you with supernatural force as you fly up to 60 feet in a straight line. Your movement (which does not provoke attacks of opportunity) must end on a surface that can support your weight or you fall as normal.

As part of the casting of this spell, make an armour attack against any number of creatures in the area that deals your unarmed strike damage plus {@dice 2d6} thunder damage. On a major success, a target is either pulled 10 feet closer to you or pushed 10 feet away (your choice).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The extra thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wind Up
entries: You wind your power up like a spring. You gain advantage on the next melee weapon attack you make before the end of the spell's duration, after which the spell ends.

spell.name: Wind Walk

entries.name: Target
entries: You and up to 10 willing creatures you can see

The targets assume a gaseous form and appear as wisps of cloud. Each target has a flying speed of 300 feet and 50% resistance to weapon damage, but the only action it can take is the Dash action or to revert to its normal form (a process that takes 1 minute during which it is {@condition incapacitated|sns} and can't move).
Until the spell ends, a target can change again to cloud form (in an identical transformation process).
