When the effect ends for a target flying in cloud form, it descends 60 feet each round for up to 1 minute or until it safely lands. If the target can't land after 1 minute, the creature falls the rest of the way normally.

spell.name: Wind Wall

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground.
When the wall appears, make a fortitude attack against each creature within its area that deals {@dice 4d6} bludgeoning damage.

The wall keeps fog, smoke, and other gases (including creatures in gaseous form) at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the area fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically score critical failures on any attacks they may make (larger projectiles such as boulders and siege engine attacks are unaffected).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wish
entries: This is the mightiest of mortal magics and alters reality itself.
The safest use of this spell is the duplication of any other spell of 8th-level or lower without needing to meet its requirements (including components).
You may instead choose one of the following:

items: One nonmagical object of your choice that is worth up to 25,000 gold and no more than 300 feet in any dimension appears in an unoccupied space you can see on the ground.
Up to 20 creatures that you can see to regain all their hit points, and each is further healed as per the {@spell greater restoration|sns} spell.
Up to 10 creatures that you can see gain 50% resistance to a damage type you choose.
Up to 10 creatures you can see gain immunity to a single spell or other magical effect for 8 hours.

You force a reroll of any roll made within the last round (including your last turn). You can force the reroll to be made with advantage or disadvantage, and you can choose whether to use the reroll or the original roll.

entries: You might be able to achieve something beyond the scope of the above examples. State your wish to the DM as precisely as possible, being very careful in your wording. Be aware that the greater the wish, the greater the chance for an unexpected result. This spell might simply fizzle, your desired outcome might only be partly achieved, or you might suffer some unforeseen consequence as a result of how you worded the wish. The DM has the final authority in ruling what occurs — and reality is not tampered with lightly.

entries.name: Multiple Wishes
entries: The stress of casting this spell to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. Until finishing a long rest, each time you cast a spell you take {@dice 1d10} true damage per level of that spell. In addition, your Strength drops to 3 for {@dice 2d4} days (if it isn't 3 or lower already). For each of those days that you spend resting and doing nothing more than light activity, your remaining recovery time decreases by 2 days. Finally, there is a 33% chance that you are unable to cast wish ever again.

spell.name: Word of Recall

entries.name: Target
entries: You and up to 5 willing creatures
The targets instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary, appearing in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary.
You must first designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location aligned with your faith, such as a temple dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Leska's Expeditious Word of Recall. Targets instantly teleport to the last location aligned with your faith that you physically entered but have not designated as a sanctuary. Attempts to cast this spell again before 7 days have passed automatically fail.

spell.name: Wormway

entries.name: Target
entries: You and up to 50 willing creatures of Large size or smaller

You call a Gargantuan monstrosity from the depths of the world to carry you and your allies across great distances. When you cast this spell, the nearest {@creature purple worm} within range is {@condition charmed|sns} and begins moving toward a point on the ground that you can see. If there are no purple worms within range, the spell fails. The earth rumbles slightly as it approaches and breaks through the surface. Any creatures within 20 feet of that point must make a save or be knocked {@condition prone|sns} and pushed 10 feet away from it.
Upon emerging, the purple worm lays down before you and opens its maw. Targets can climb inside where they are enclosed in an impervious hemispherical dome of force.

Once targets are loaded into the purple worm, nothing — not physical objects, energy, or other spell effects — can pass through the barrier, in or out, though targets in the sphere can breathe there. The hemisphere is immune to all damage, and creatures and objects inside can't be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a target inside the hemisphere damage anything outside it.
The atmosphere inside the dome is comfortable and dry regardless of conditions outside it.

The purple worm waits until you give it a mental command to depart, at which point it dives back into the ground and travels, without need for rest or food, as directly as possible while avoiding obstacles to a destination known to you. It travels 150 miles per day.
When the purple worm reaches its destination it surfaces, the dome vanishes, and it disgorges the targets in its mouth before diving back into the depths again.

The purple worm remains {@condition charmed|sns} by you until it has delivered you to your destination and returned to the depths, or until it is attacked at which point the charm ends, it vomits its targets in the nearest unoccupied space as soon as possible, and then retreats to safety.

entries.name: Rare
entries: Cyneburg's Surfacing Wormway. When this spell ends early because the purple worm is attacked, it travels to the surface to spit the targets out and then retreats to safety.

spell.name: Writhing Transformation
entries: As part of the casting of this spell, you lay down in the coffin on a patch of bare earth and it buries itself.

Over the following week, you are {@condition incapacitated|sns} and do not need air, food, or sleep. Your insides are eaten by worms, but you do not die and your skin remains intact. If you are exhumed during this time, or if the spell is otherwise interrupted, you die.
At the end of the week, the transformation is complete and your true form is permanently changed.

Your appearance is unchanged but underneath your skin is a sentient mass of worms. Any creature that makes a Medicine check against your standard DC realizes that there is something moving underneath your skin.
Your statistics change in the following ways:

items: Your type changes to aberration, and you do not age or require sleep.
You cannot be healed by normal means, but you can spend an action or bonus action to consume {@dice 3d4} live worms, regaining an equal amount of hit points by adding them to your body.
You can sense and telepathically control all worms that have the beast type and are within 60 feet of you.

entries: In addition, you are able to discard your shell of skin and travel as a writhing mass of worms. As an action, you can abandon your skin and pour out onto the ground. In this form you have the statistics of swarm of insects with the following exceptions:

You keep your hit points, Wisdom, Intelligence, and Charisma scores, and proficiencies. You know but cannot cast spells in this form. You also gain a burrow speed of 10 feet. Any worms touching you instantly join with your swarm, granting you a number of temporary hit points equal to the number of worms that join with your form (maximum 45 temporary hit points). These temporary hit points last until you are no longer in this form.

If you spend an hour in the same space as a dead creature of your original form's size, you can eat its insides and inhabit its skin in the same way you once inhabited your own. While you are in your swarm form, the most recent skin you inhabited remains intact and you can move back into a previously inhabited skin in 1 minute. You have advantage on checks made to impersonate a creature while wearing its skin.

m.text: coffin filled with worms, consumed by the spell

spell.name: Zone of Truth

entries.name: Area
entries: 15-foot sphere
You create a zone that minimizes deception. Any creature that is able to be {@condition charmed|sns} can't speak a deliberate lie while in the area.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can choose not to speak, or it might be evasive in its communications. The area becomes a persistent zone that forces creatures within to make a save. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 2d4} psychic DoT damage when it intentionally tries to mislead or occlude important information for the remainder of the spell's duration. Each time the spell damages a creature, it makes a Deception check (DC 8 + the damage dealt) or its suffering is obvious. You know whether a creature succeeds on its save.

spell.name: Blade Ward
entries: You extend your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air. Until the spell ends, armour attack rolls against you are reduced by {@dice 1d4}.

spell.name: Poison Spray

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. Make a fortitude attack against the target that deals {@dice 1d12} poison damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Thorn Whip

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command towards a creature in range. Make an armour attack against the target that deals 1d6 piercing damage, and on a hit, if the target is Large or smaller, you pull the target up to 10 feet closer to you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Armour of Agathys
entries: A protective magical force surrounds you, manifesting as a spectral frost that covers you and your gear. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration, or until you have 0 temporary hit points. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while this spell is active, the creature takes 5 cold DoT damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Both the temporary hit points and the cold damage increase by 5 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Arms of Hadar

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot radius sphere

You invoke the power of Hadar, the Dark Hunger. Tendrils of dark energy erupt from you and batter all creatures within 10 feet of you. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in that area that deals {@dice 3d4} necrotic damage. On a hit, a target can't take reactions until its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Chromatic Orb

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You hurl a 4-inch-diameter sphere of energy at a creature that you can see within range. You choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder for the type of orb you create, and then make an armour attack against the target that deals {@dice 3d8} damage of the type you chose.

m.text: a diamond worth at least 50 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Compelled Duel

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You attempt to compel the target into a duel. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: For 1 round, when the target attempts to move to a space that is more than 30 feet away from you, it must make a save, reducing its speed to 0 until the end of the turn on a failure.

items.name: Standard success
entries: For the duration, the target has disadvantage on armour attack rolls against creatures other than you, and must make a save each time it attempts to move to a space that is more than 30 feet away from you, reducing its speed to 0 until the end of the turn on a failure.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target cannot make armour attacks against creatures other than you.

The spell ends if you attack any other creature, if you cast a spell that targets a hostile creature other than the target, if a creature friendly to you damages the target or casts a harmful spell on it, or if you end your turn more than 30 feet away from the target.

spell.name: Dissonant Whispers

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You whisper a discordant melody that only the target can hear, wracking it with terrible pain. Make a will attack against the target that deals {@dice 2d10} psychic damage. On a hit, the target must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its Speed allows away from you. The target doesn't move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. A {@condition deafened|sns} target reduces the success tier of the attack by 1.

spell.name: Hellish Rebuke

time.condition: which you take in response to being hit by a damaging attack from a creature within range

entries: You point your finger, and the creature that hit you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. Make a reflex attack against the creature that deals {@dice 2d12} fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell deals an extra {@dice 1d12} damage for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Hex

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You place a curse on the target. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an armour attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.
If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to curse a new creature.
A {@spell remove curse|sns} cast on the target ends this spell early.

m.text: the petrified eye of a newt

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.

spell.name: Ray of Sickness

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

A ray of sickening greenish energy lashes out towards the target. Make an armour attack against the target that deals {@dice 2d8} poison damage. On a major success, the target is also {@condition poisoned|sns} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Searing Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during the spell's duration, your weapon flares with white-hot intensity and the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} fire damage to the target and causes the target to ignite in flames. The target makes passive saves to end the spell, but whenever it fails one, it takes {@dice 1d6} fire DoT damage. If the target or a creature adjacent to it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames (such as the target being submerged in water), the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The initial extra damage dealt by the hit increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunderous Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon rings with thunder that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d6} thunder damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature and the attack scored a major success, the target is pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone|sns}.

spell.name: Witch Bolt

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out towards the target, forming a sustained arc of lightning between it and you. Make an armour attack against the target that deals {@dice 1d12} lightning damage. On a hit, you can use your action on subsequent turns for the duration to deal {@dice 1d12} lightning DoT damage to the target automatically. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.

m.text: a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The initial damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunderous Smite
entries: The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} psychic damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature and the attack scored a major success, the target is {@condition frightened|sns} until the spell ends. As an action, the creature can make a Wisdom check against your standard DC to steel its resolve and end this spell.

spell.name: Beast Sense

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing beast

You touch the target. For the duration of the spell, you can use your action to see through the target's eyes and hear what it hears, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses. While perceiving through the beast's senses, you gain the benefits of any special senses possessed by that creature, though you are {@condition blinded|sns} and {@condition deafened|sns} to your own surroundings.

spell.name: Branding Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon gleams with astral radiance and the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d6} radiant damage to the target. On a hit, the target becomes visible if it's {@condition invisible}, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can't become {@condition invisible} until the spell ends.

spell.name: Cloud of Daggers

entries.name: Area
entries: 5-foot cube
You fill the air with spinning daggers centred on a point you choose within range. This is a persistent zone that deals {@dice 4d4} slashing DoT damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Crown of Madness

entries.name: Target
entries: One humanoid
Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition charmed|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition charmed|sns} until either the spell ends or it passes a passive save. While {@condition charmed|sns} in this way, a twisted crown of jagged iron appears on the target's head, and a madness glows in its eyes.
The target gains a free action at the start of each of its turns that must be used to make a melee weapon attack against a creature other than itself that you mentally choose.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is {@condition dominated|sns} instead of gaining the free action for melee attacks.
On your subsequent turns until the spell ends, you must use your action to maintain control over the target, or the spell ends.

spell.name: Phantasmal Force

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
You craft an illusion that takes root in the target's mind. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: You create an illusion as per the {@spell minor illusion|sns} cantrip that is perceivable only to the target and lasts for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: You create a phantasmal object, creature, or other visible phenomenon of your choice that is no larger than a 10-foot cube and that is perceivable only to the target for the duration.
The phantasm includes sound, temperature, and other stimuli, also evident only to the creature.

The target can use its action to examine the phantasm with an Investigation check against your standard DC. If the check succeeds, the target realises that the phantasm is an illusion, and the spell ends.

While a target is affected by the spell, the target treats the phantasm as if it were real. The target rationalises any illogical outcomes from interacting with the phantasm. For example, a target attempting to walk across a phantasmal bridge that spans a chasm falls once it steps onto the bridge. If the target survives the fall, it still believes that the bridge exists and comes up with some other explanation for its fall - it was pushed, it slipped, or a strong wind might have knocked it off.

An affected target is so convinced of the phantasm's reality that it can even take damage from the illusion. A phantasm created to appear as a creature can strike the target. Similarly, a phantasm created to appear as fire, a pool of acid, or lava can burn the target. Each round on your turn, the phantasm can deal {@dice 1d6} psychic DoT damage to the target if it is in the phantasm's area or within 5 feet of the phantasm, provided that the illusion is of a creature or hazard that could logically deal damage, such as by attacking. The target perceives the damage as a type appropriate to the illusion.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the phantasm can by up to a 15-foot cube in size.
This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

spell.name: Aura of Vitality

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius

Healing energy radiates from you in an aura. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. You can use a bonus action to cause one creature in the aura (including you) to regain {@dice 3d4} hit points.

spell.name: Blinding Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack before this spell ends, your weapon flares with bright light, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 3d8} radiant damage to the target. Additionally, if the attack scores a major success, the target is {@condition blinded|sns} until either the spell ends or it passes a passive save.

spell.name: Crusader's Mantle

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius

Holy power radiates from you in an aura, awakening boldness in friendly creatures. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. While in the aura, each non-hostile creature in the aura (including you) deals an extra {@dice 1d4} radiant damage when it hits with a weapon armour attack.

spell.name: Elemental Weapon

entries.name: Target
entries: One weapon

Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. For the duration, the target has a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deals an extra {@dice 1d4} damage of the chosen type when it hits.

spell.name: Feign Death

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature
You put the target into a cataleptic state that is indistinguishable from death.

For the spell's duration, or until you use an action to touch the target and dismiss the spell, the target appears dead to all outward inspection and to spells used to determine the target's status. The target is {@condition blinded|sns} and {@condition incapacitated|sns}, and its speeds drop to 0. The target has 50% resistance to all damage except psychic damage. If the target is diseased or {@condition poisoned|sns} when you cast the spell, or becomes diseased or {@condition poisoned|sns} while under the spell's effect, the disease and poison have no effect until the spell ends.

spell.name: Hunger of Hadar

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot-radius sphere

You open a gateway to the dark between the stars, a region infested with unknown horrors. The area is filled with blackness and bitter cold, lasting for the duration. This void is filled with a cacophony of soft whispers and slurping noises that can be heard up to 30 feet away. No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and creatures fully within the area are {@condition blinded|sns}.

The void creates a warp in the fabric of space, and the area is difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes {@dice 2d6} cold DoT damage. Any creature that ends its turn in the area takes {@dice 1d6} acid DoT damage as milky, otherworldly tentacles rub against it.

spell.name: Aura of Life

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius

Life-preserving energy radiates from you. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) has 50% resistance to necrotic damage, and its hit point maximum can't be reduced. In addition, a nonhostile, living creature regains 1 hit point when it starts its turn in the aura with 0 hit points.

spell.name: Aura of Purity

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius

Purifying energy radiates from you. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each nonhostile creature in the area (including you) can't become diseased, has 50% resistance to poison damage, and grants disadvantage to incoming attacks that can cause any of the following conditions: {@condition blinded|sns}, {@condition charmed|sns}, {@condition deafened|sns}, {@condition frightened|sns}, {@condition staggered|sns}, {@condition poisoned|sns}, and {@condition debilitated|sns}.

spell.name: Compulsion

entries.name: Target
entries: Any number of creatures you choose that can hear you
Make a will attack against each target. If a target can't be {@condition charmed|sns}, the attack against them automatically scores a critical failure. The attack has the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target moves 5 feet in a random direction at the end of their next turn.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is compelled by this spell.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition dominated|sns}.

Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to designate a direction that is horizontal to you. Each compelled target must use as much of its movement as possible to move in that direction on its next turn. It can take its action before it moves. After moving in this way, it can make a save to try to end the effect.
A compelled target isn't compelled to move into an obviously deadly hazard, such as a fire or pit.

spell.name: Grasping Vine
entries: You conjure a vine that sprouts from the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. When you cast this spell, you can direct the vine to lash out at a creature within 30 feet of it. The creature makes a save, being pushed 20 feet directly towards the vine on a fail.
Until the spell ends, you can direct the vine to lash out at the same creature or another one as a bonus action on each of your turns.

spell.name: Guardian of Faith
entries: A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. The guardian occupies that space and is indistinct except for a gleaming sword and shield emblazoned with the symbol of your deity.

Any creature hostile to you that moves to a space within 10 feet of the guardian for the first time on a turn takes 13 radiant DoT damage. The guardian vanishes when it has dealt a total of 39 damage.

spell.name: Sapping Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon pierces both body and mind, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 4d6} psychic damage to the target. If the attack scores a major success, the target has disadvantage on armour attack rolls and ability checks, and can't take reactions, until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Banishing Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack before this spell ends, your weapon crackles with force, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 5d10} force damage to the target. Additionally, if this attack reduces the target to 56 hit points or fewer, you banish it. If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the target disappears, returning to its home plane. If the target is native to the plane you're on, the creature vanishes into a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is {@condition dazed|sns}. It remains there until the spell ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. If the target returns early during combat and it had at least one turn while banished, it immediately takes a turn. This does not change initiative order.

spell.name: Cricle of Power

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius

Divine energy radiates from you, distorting and diffusing magical energy. Until the spell ends, the area moves with you, centered on you. For the duration, non-armour attacks from spells and other magical effects have disadvantage against friendly creatures in the area (including you). Additionally, when a damaging non-armour attack from a spell or other magical effect scores a minor success against an affected creature, it instead counts as a critical failure.

spell.name: Destructive Wave

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius centered on you

You strike the ground, creating a burst of divine energy that ripples outwards from you. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 3d12 thunder damage}, as well as {@dice 3d12} radiant or necrotic damage (your choice). On a hit, the target is knocked {@condition prone|sns}.

spell.name: Arcane Gate
entries: You create linked teleportation portals that remain open for the duration. Choose two points on the ground that you can see, one point within 10 feet of you and one point within 500 feet of you. A circular portal, 10 feet in diameter, opens over each point. If the portal would open in the space occupied by a creature, the spell fails, and the casting is lost.

The portals are two-dimensional glowing rings filled with mist, hovering inches from the ground and perpendicular to it at the points you choose. A ring is visible only from one side (your choice), which is the side that functions as a portal.

Any creature or object entering the portal exits from the other portal as if the two were adjacent to each other; passing through a portal from the nonportal side has no effect. The mist that fills each portal is opaque and blocks vision through it. On your turn, you can rotate the rings as a bonus action so that the active side faces in a different direction.

spell.name: Telepathy
entries: You create a telepathic link between yourself and a willing creature with which you are familiar. The creature can be anywhere on the same plane of existence as you. The spell ends if you or the target are no longer on the same plane.

Until the spell ends, you and the target can instantaneously share words, images, sounds, and other sensory messages with one another through the link, and the target recognises you as the creature it is communicating with. The spell enables a creature with an Intelligence score of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your words and take in the scope of any sensory messages you send to it.

m.text: a pair of linked silver rings

spell.name: Tsunami
entries: A wall of water springs into existence at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 300 feet long, 300 feet high, and 50 feet thick. The wall lasts for the duration.
When the wall appears, make a fortitude attack against each creature within its area that deals {@dice 8d8} bludgeoning damage.

At the start of each of your turns after the wall appears, the wall, along with any creatures in it, moves 50 feet away from you. Any Huge or smaller creature inside the wall or whose space the wall enters when it moves take {@dice 3d8} bludgeoning DoT damage. A creature can take this damage only once per round. At the end of the turn, the wall's height is reduced by 50 feet, and the damage creatures take from the spell on subsequent turns is reduced by {@dice 1d8}. When the wall reaches 0 feet in height, the spell ends.

A creature caught in the wall can move by swimming. Because of the force of the wall, though, the creature must make a successful Athletics check against your standard DC in order to move at all. If it fails the check, it can't move. A creature that moves out of the area falls to the ground.

spell.name: Power Word Heal
entries: A wave of healing energy washes over the creature you touch. The target regains all its hit points. If the creature is {@condition charmed|sns}, {@condition frightened|sns}, {@staggered|sns}, or {@condition debilitated|sns}, the condition ends. If the creature is {@condition prone|sns}, it can use its reaction to stand up. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

spell.name: Booming Blade

entries.name: Target
entries: One adjacent creature

You make a melee weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly moves 5 feet or more before then, it takes {@dice 1d8} thunder DoT damage, and the spell ends.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d8} thunder damageto the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for moving increases to {@dice 2d8}. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 3d8}) and again at 17th level ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 4d8}).

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

spell.name: Control Flames

entries.name: Target
entries: Nonmagical flame that fits within a 5-foot cube
You affect the target in one of the following ways:

items: You instantaneously expand the target 5 feet in one direction, provided that wood or other fuel is present in the new location.
You instantaneously extinguish the target.
You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the target, change its colour, or both. The change lasts for 1 hour.
You cause simple shapes - such as the vague form of a creature, an inanimate object, or a location - to appear within the target and animate as you like. The shapes last for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three non-instantaneous effects created by it active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Create Bonfire

entries.name: Area
entries: 5-foot cube

You create a bonfire on ground within range. Until the spell ends, the magic bonfire fills the area. Any creature in the bonfire's space when you cast the spell takes {@dice 1d4} fire DoT damage. A creature also takes this damage when it moves into the bonfire's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The bonfire ignites flammable objects in its area that aren't being worn or carried.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Frostbite

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You cause numbing frost to form on the target. Make a fortitude attack against the target that deals {@dice 1d6} cold damage. On a hit, the target has disadvantage on the next weapon armour attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

Casting this spell while holding a thought strand allows you to instantly receive whatever memory, idea, or message the thought strand contains. (Casting {@spell detect thoughts|sns} on the strand has the same effect.)

spell.name: Green-Flame Blade

entries.name: Target
entries: One melee weapon you are holding in your main hand

You brandish the target and make a melee weapon attack with it against one adjacent creature. On a hit, you can cause green fire to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice adjacent to it. The second creature takes fire DoT damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the weapon attack deals an extra {@dice 1d8} fire damage to the target on a hit, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

spell.name: Gust
entries: You seize the air and compel it to create one of the following effects at a point within range:
Make a fortitude attack against one Medium or smaller creature that you choose with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target's Speed is reduced by 5 feet for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is pushed 5 feet away from you.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the push is increased to 10 feet.

items: You create a small blast of air capable of moving one object that is neither held nor carried and that weighs no more than 5 pounds. The object is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. It isn't pushed with enough force to cause damage.
You create a harmless sensory effect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters closed, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.

spell.name: Infestation

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You cause a cloud of mites, fleas, and other parasites to appear momentarily on the target. Make a fortitude attack against the target that deals {@dice 1d6} poison damage. On a hit, the target shifts 5 feet in a random direction if it can move and its Speed is at least 5 feet.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Lightning Lure

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature within 15 feet of you
You create a lash of lightning energy that strikes at the target. Make a fortitude attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is pushed 5 feet straight towards you.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is pushed 10 feet straight towards you and then takes {@dice 1d8} lightning damage if it is within 5 feet of you.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the damage is increased to {@dice 2d8}.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d9} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Magic Stone

entries.name: Target
entries: One to three pebbles

You touch the targets and imbue them with magic. You or someone else can make a ranged spell armour attack with one of the pebbles by throwing it as an action. If thrown, a pebble has a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with a pebble, that attack scales with your stats, not the attacker's. The attack deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. After the attack, the spell ends on the stone.
If you cast this spell again, the spell ends on any pebbles still affected by your previous casting.

spell.name: Mold Earth

entries.name: Target
entries: Portion of dirt or stone that fits within a 5-foot-cube
You manipulate the target in one of the following ways:

items: If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn't involve enough force to cause damage.
You cause shapes, colours, or both to appear on the target, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

If the target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Primal Savagery
entries: You channel primal magic to cause your teeth or fingernails to sharpen, ready to deliver a corrosive attack. Make an armour attack against one adjacent creature that deals {@dice 1d10} acid damage. After you make the attack, your teeth or fingernails return to normal.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Shape Water

entries.name: Target
entries: Water that fits within a 5-foot cube
You manipulate the target in one of the following ways:

items: You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the target as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn't haev enough force to cause damage.
You cause the target to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You change the target's colour or opacity. The target must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You freeze the target, provided that there are no creatures in it. The target unfreezes in 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Sword Burst
entries: You create a momentary circle of spectral blades that sweep around you. Make a reflex attack against all adjacent creatures that deals {@dice 1d6} force damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Thunderclap
entries: You create a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Make a fortitude attack against each creature within range that deals {@dice 1d6} thunder damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Toll the Dead

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You point at the target and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for the moment. Make a will attack against the target that deals {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, the attack instead deals {@dice 1d12} necrotic damage.
This spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} or {@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} or {@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} or {@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Word of Radiance
entries: You utter a divine word, and burning radiance erupts from you. Make a fortitude attack against each creature of your choice within range that deals {@dice 1d6} radiant damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Absorb Elements

time.condition: which you take when you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

entries: The spell captures some of the incoming energy, lessening its effect on you and storing it for your next melee weapon attack. You have 50% resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. Also, the first time you hit with a melee weapon attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of the triggering type, and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Beast Bond
entries: You establish a telepathic link with one beast you touch that is friendly to you or {@condition charmed|sns} by you. The spell fails if the beast's Intelligence score is 4 or higher. Until the spell ends, the link is active while you and the beast are within line of sight of each other. Through the link, the beast can understand your telepathic messages to it, and it can telepathically communicate simple emotions and concepts back to you. While the link is active, the beast gains advantage on armour attack rolls against any creature adjacent to you.

m.text: a bit of fur wrapped in a cloth

spell.name: Catapult

entries.name: Target
entries: One object weighing 1 to 5 pounds that isn't being worn or carried

The target flies in a straight line up to 90 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, make a reflex attack against that creature that deals {@dice 3d8} bludgeoning damage. When this attack is made, the object stops moving and also takes the same damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The maximum weight of objects that you can target with this spell increases by 5 pounds, and the damage increases by {@dice 1d8}, for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cause Fear

entries.name: Target
entries: One non-construct, non-undead creature
You awaken the sense of mortality in the target. Make a will attack against the target with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition rattled|sns} for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition frightened|sns} until either the spell ends or it passes a passive save.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition debilitated|sns}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Chaos Bolt

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at the target. Make an armour attack against the target that deals {@damage 2d8 + 1d6} damage. Choose one of the {@dice d8}s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.

If you roll the same number on both {@dice d8}s, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 30 feet of it. Make a new attack rolls against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again.
A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: Each target takes {@dice 1d6} extra damage of the type rolled for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Earth Tremor
entries: You cause a tremor in the ground within range. Make a reflex attack against each creature in that area that deals {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage. On a hit, a target is knocked {@condition prone|sns}. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Frost Fingers

entries.name: Area
entries: 15-foot cone
Freezing cold blasts from your fingertips. Make a fortitude attack against each creature in the area that deals {@dice 4d4} cold damage.
The cold freezes nonmagical liquids in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ice Knife

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

You create a shard of ice and fling it at the target. Make an armour attack against the target that deals {@dice 1d10} piercing damage. After the attack, the shard explodes. The target and each creature adjacent to it takes {@dice 1d6} cold DoT damage.

m.text: a drop of water or piece of ice

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The cold damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Silvery Barbs

time.condition: which you take when a creature within range succeeds on an attack roll, an ability check, or a save

entries: You magically distract the triggering creature and turn its momentary uncertainty into encouragement for another creature. The triggering creature must reroll the {@dice d20} and use the lower roll.

You can then choose a different creature within range. The chosen creature has advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or save it makes within 1 minute. A creature can be empowered by only one use of this spell at a time.

spell.name: Snare
entries: As you cast this spell, you use the rope to create a circle with a 5-foot radius on the ground or the floor. When you finish casting, the rope disappears and the circle becomes a magic trap.
This trap is nearly {@condition invisible}, requiring a successful Investigation check against your standard DC to be discerned.

The trap triggers when a Small, Medium, or Large creature moves onto the ground or the floor in the spell's radius. That creature must make a save, being magically hoisted in the air on a fail, leaving it hanging upside down 3 feet above the ground or the floor. The creature is {@condition restrained|sns} there until either the spell ends or it passes a passive save. Alternatively, the creature or someone else who can reach it can use an action make an Arcana check against your standard DC. On a success, the {@condition restrained|sns} effect ends.
After the trap is triggered, the spell ends when no creature is {@condition restrained|sns} by it.

spell.name: Caustic Brew

entries.name: Area
entries: Line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide
A stream of acid emanates from you in a direction you choose. Make a reflex attack against each creature in the area with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target immediately takes {@dice 1d4} acid DoT damage.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is covered in acid for the spell's duration or until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes {@dice 2d4} ongoing acid damage.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the damage increases to {@dice 4d4}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Disarm

entries.name: Points
entries: 0 points
You can use the Disarm maneuver to attempt to knock an item or weapon from a creature's hand.
The target must be within your reach and be holding an item (either carried or wielded). The target drops the item in its space.

spell.name: Grab On

entries.name: Points
entries: 0 points

While you cannot {@spell grapple|sns} a creature two or more size categories larger than you, you can grab onto it. You cling to or balance upon its body, moving into the creature's space where you can move upon its body as if it is difficult terrain.

While grabbing onto a creature, you gain advantage on armour attack rolls against it. The creature may be able to attack you as normal, depending on its limbs or attacks. It can also use an action to try to dislodge you, such as shaking you loose or bashing you against a wall, making a fortitude or reflex attack (your choice) against you. On a success, you take damage equal to the higher of the creature's Strength or Dexterity modifier (minimum 1) and fall {@condition prone|sns} into the nearest space adjacent to it.
If the creature chooses to roll over in order to dislodge you, it becomes {@condition prone|sns}, but its attack to dislodge you has advantage.

spell.name: Grapple

entries.name: Points
entries: 0 points
You can use the Grapple maneuver to grab or wrestle a creature.

Your target must be within your reach, and it must be no more than one size category larger than you. The target becomes {@condition grappled|sns}. In addition to things that end the condition, you can release the target at any time (no action required).

entries.name: Escaping a Grapple
entries: A creature can use its action to either attempt to escape a grapple or free another {@condition grappled|sns} creature within its reach. It must succeed on a save to free the target.

entries.name: Moving a Grappled Creature
entries: When you move, you can drag or carry the grappled creature with you. When you do so, your Speed is halved, unless the creature's weight is within your carrying capacity - a tiny creature counts as 1 heavy item, small counts as 2, medium as 4, large as 8, huge as 16, and gargantuan as 32.

spell.name: Knockdown

entries.name: Points
entries: 0 points
You can use the Knockdown maneuver to trip or push a creature down.
The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you. You knock the target {@condition prone|sns}.

spell.name: Overrun

entries.name: Points
entries: 0 points

You can make an Overrun maneuver to move through a hostile creature's space by forcing your way past. You can move through the hostile creature's space once this turn. You still provoke opportunity attacks if you move beyond a creature's reach.

spell.name: Shove

entries.name: Points
entries: 0 points
You can use the Shove maneuver to push a creature away.

The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you. You push the target 5 feet away from you horizontally. If the triggering attack scored a major success, you push the target an additional 5 feet away, and on a critical success you push the target a further 5 feet away. You can move the creature in any horizontal direction away from you (to the side, forward, or diagonally away).
A creature that is shoved off of a precipice is propelled off of whatever it is standing on — it does not receive any save or ability check to grab onto something to avoid falling down below.

spell.name: Cleaving Swing

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
After you slam your weapon into an opponent you work the momentum of the blow into another strike at a second enemy nearby in a devastating display of might.
When you hit with a melee weapon attack using a two-handed weapon, you can use your reaction to deal half the attack's damage against a second creature that is also within your reach.

spell.name: Heavy Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You set yourself firmly in place, determined not to move.

You gain an expertise die on Athletics and Brawn checks that use Strength, all incoming combat maneuver attack rolls against you are reduced by {@dice 1d4}, and you ignore the first 10 feet of difficult terrain when you move on your turn.

spell.name: Lean Into It

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
Not just commiting to an assault, you shoulder into it with all the strength you can bear and deliver hits that resonate in the very bones of your foes.
When you activate this maneuver, you take the Attack action.
Until the start of your next turn, when you score a major success against a creature with a melee weapon attack it is knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Reactive Knockdown

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
Putting yourself in just the right position as you strike, your unbalancing hit sends a retreating opponent into a reeling stumble and then the ground.

When a creature within your reach provokes an opportunity attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack. On a major success, the creature moves 10 feet in a straight line in the direction it was attempting to move in and is knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Shrug It Off

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
Girding yourself when your body is assaulted by more than clenched fists or sharp steel, you defy weakness and overcome.
When an effect causes you to be {@condition frightened|sns}, {@condition poisoned|sns}, or {@condition debilitated|sns}, you can use your reaction to prevent it.

spell.name: Warding Wield

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
With seeming ease you whirl your weapon about your body, weaving it in a threatening pattern that makes your opponents hesitant to attack.
Until the start of your next turn, your armour increases by 1.

spell.name: Battering Strike

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
A powerful blow smashes a weapon from your enemy's grasp.

When you score a major success against a creature with an attack from a two-handed melee weapon, you can use your reaction knock a weapon it is wielding (your choice) from its grip, causing it to land in a randomly determined space 10 feet away.
You require a critical success on the attack against a creature that is two or more size categories larger than you.

spell.name: Crushing Blow

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The Empowered Attack feature
With a bone crushing strike you briefly deprive an opponent of their very ability to defend themselves.
Make a melee weapon attack using a two-handed weapon. On a major success, the target is {@condition staggered|sns} until it takes damage or the end of your next turn (whichever comes first).

spell.name: Unbreakable

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points
At the edge of death, you cling firmly to life.
When you fail a death saving throw, you instead succeed. You can take this reaction even if you are {@condition incapacitated|sns}.

spell.name: Stand Tall Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You set yourself firmly against maneuvers.
You count as being one size category larger.
When you use an Adamant Mountain maneuver that requires a major success on an attack to take effect, it only requires a hit if the target is smaller than you.

spell.name: Unstoppable

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points
You power through your enemy's special attacks.

When an effect causes you to be {@condition staggered|sns} or {@condition debilitated|sns}, you can use your reaction to prevent it. You can take this reaction even if you are {@condition incapacitated|sns}.

spell.name: Wild Swing

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You wield your weapon with abandon, striking seemingly at random.

When you fail to hit with an attack using a two-handed weapon, you can use your reaction to ignore the results of that attack and instead make an attack with the same weapon against another target within your reach.

spell.name: Unyielding

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points
Badly wounded, you force yourself to keep fighting.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d12} + your proficiency bonus.
You can take this reaction even if you are {@condition incapacitated|sns}.

spell.name: World-Shaking Strike

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The Empowered Attack feature
You smash the ground, knocking down your enemies with a shockwave.

You hit the ground using a two-handed weapon, sending out a shockwave in a 35-foot cube centered on you. Make a fortitude attack against each other creature in the area, dealing damage as if hit by the weapon and knocking them {@condition prone|sns} on a hit.

spell.name: Covering Fire

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
Making haphazard shots to dissuade enemies, you force opponents onto the defensive by unleashing death from above so an ally can move into position.

Choose a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus that you can see within your weapon's normal range. Until the start of your next turn, a chosen creature's movement does not provoke opportunity attacks from creatures you can see as you pelt the area nearby with missiles.

spell.name: Doubleshot

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You palm two blades or nock two arrows, launching both missiles at the same opponent.
The next ranged weapon attack you make uses two missiles instead of one. On a hit, you deal an additional weapon damage die.

spell.name: Farshot Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
By arching your back and stretching your arms to their fullest extent, you make your ranged weaponry travel further than usual.
When you use a weapon to make a ranged attack, increase its normal range by 20 feet and long range by 50 feet.

spell.name: Point Blank Shot

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
With uncanny swiftness you ready a weapon normally only used at range, compensating for making an attack at an opponent within only a few feet and giving your enemies reason to be wary.

Until the end of your next turn, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature who can see you and who isn't {@condition incapacitated|sns} does not give you disadvantage when making a ranged weapon attack.
In addition, when an adjacent hostile creature that you can see moves 5 feet or more away from you, you can use your reaction to make a ranged weapon attack against it.

spell.name: Countershot

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
With awe-inspiring skill you unleash a thrown weapon or arrow, knocking a missile out of the air.
When you see a missile from a ranged weapon attack enter into the normal range of a weapon you are wielding, you can use your reaction to deflect it. The attack's success tier is reduced by one.
At the Narrator's discretion, certain ranged weapon attacks (like a giant's thrown rock) may be too heavy to be deflected by Countershot.

spell.name: Quickdraw

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
With incredible swiftness you tear your weapon from its sheath and let fly a reckless attack.
As long as you are not surprised, when initiative is rolled you can use your reaction to draw a weapon and make a ranged attack with it.

spell.name: Trickshot

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
Carefully judging the wind and everything else that might interfere, you unleash an impressive shot that delights all who see it.

Make a ranged weapon attack with advantage against an unattended object. You can use the result of the attack roll instead of making a Performance check, and you gain an expertise die when doing so. Otherwise the kinds of trick shots you can make are at the Narrator's discretion. The attack has no other effect.

spell.name: Blindshot

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
By closing your eyes and focusing on the sound of the environment, you target an unseen foe with uncanny accuracy.

Make a Perception check contested by the Stealth check of a target you cannot see that is within 30 feet. On a success, you know the target's location and do not have disadvantage on your next ranged attack against it before the end of your turn.

spell.name: Missile Volley

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The Empowered Attack feature
Seizing upon the moment you make the sky rain death, striking at a multitude of creatures in rapid succession.
Make a ranged weapon attack against a number of creatures within 10 feet of a point you can see within your weapon's range.
You may only target a number of creatures equal to or less than your proficiency bonus and you make a separate attack roll for each target.

spell.name: Ricochet

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

With careful judgments of distances, materials, wind, and applied force you let loose a shot that bounces off of one or more surfaces to strike opponents crouching behind walls or otherwise hidden from sight by cover.
On the next ranged weapon attack you make before the start of your turn, you can completely ignore a target's cover.

Only targets that have total cover from being entirely enclosed by an object or effect (such as inside of a chamber with no openings to shoot through or a sphere from wall of force) have cover against this attack, and you do not have disadvantage from attacking a target you cannot see.

spell.name: Dive For Cover

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
Under fire, you dive for cover.
When you are targeted by a ranged armour attack, after the attack roll is made but before effects are resolved, you can use your reaction to move up to your Speed.

If your movement ends adjacent to either a solid barrier as big as you are or a creature the same size as you or larger, until the beginning of your next turn you have three-quarters cover against ranged armour attacks as long as you remain adjacent to the barrier or creature.

spell.name: Heartseeker

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
You aim carefully at your opponent's most vulnerable spot.
Make a ranged weapon attack with advantage against a creature within your weapon's normal range.
If both attack rolls would hit, it's a critical success. If only one of the rolls would be a critical success but the other roll would still hit, you deal an additional weapon damage die.

spell.name: Mundane Missile Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
By focusing on balance and heft you can throw whatever you have in hand with deadly accuracy.
While you are wielding a one-handed weapon, it gains the thrown property.

spell.name: Hear the Wind

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points
You can literally hear the sound of incoming missiles and react to them easily.
Until the end of your next turn, you gain blindsight to a range of 20 feet. When you are hit by a ranged attack, you make a disadvantaged Perception check against a DC equal to the attack roll.
On a success the attack misses you, and on a critical success you redirect it back at the attacker.

spell.name: Horizon Shot

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The Empowered Attack feature
No matter how far away a foe is, if you can see them they're still in danger.

When you activate this maneuver, you take the Attack action. Choose one target. Until the start of your next turn, the target is considered to be within your weapon's normal range and it gains no benefit from cover less than total cover.

spell.name: Knockdown Assault

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
Your unpredictable maneuvering puts your opponent off-balance —when you connect with your weapon they stumble and fall.

When you activate this maneuver, you take the Attack action. Until the start of your next turn, when you score a major success with a melee weapon attack against a creature and deal 8 or more damage it is knocked {@condition prone|sns}.

spell.name: Leading Throw

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
An opponent that strikes at you invites peril as they find the momentum from their attack turned against them.
When a creature within your reach fails to hit you with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to try to throw it. Make a reflex attack against the creature with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is pushed 5 feet in a horizontal direction of your choice.

items.name: Standard success
entries: As minor success, but increased to 15 feet.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As minor success, but increased to 20 feet.

spell.name: Warning Strike

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
When an opponent opens themself up to a reflexive strike you can deliver a blow that shakes them to their core and forces them to hesitate.
When a hostile creature moves out of a space adjacent to you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack and on a hit its Speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Wary Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
With a keen eye you constantly assess everything within sight, paying close attention to subtle visual cues and tells to better anticipate an opponent.
You gain an expertise die on Insight checks and increase your passive Insight score by 3.

spell.name: Assisted Roll

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You take the force delivered by an opponent's failed attack and make it your own, propelling yourself away.
When a creature within your reach fails to hit you with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to shift 15 feet after the attack's effects are resolved.

spell.name: Off-Balancing Strikes

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
Focusing your attacks on an opponent's weak points allows you to not just wound, but to confound.

Until the start of your next turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, instead of dealing damage and triggering major effects you can choose to use pulls, shoves, and strikes to put your target off-balance.
Until the end of your next turn, the target is {@condition sluggish|sns}, it has disadvantage on ability checks, and reflex attacks against it have advantage.

spell.name: Take Weapon

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
You snatch your enemy's weapon and use it against them.

When a creature fails to hit you with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to flip the weapon out of the creature's hands after the attack's effects have been resolved. Make a reflex attack against the creature with the following outcomes: The creature makes a Dexterity saving throw, and on a failure it drops the weapon and you grab it from mid-air.

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target drops the weapon.

items.name: Standard success
entries: As minor success, and you grab the weapon from mid-air, stowing one of your held items at the same time so that you can hold it.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, and the exertion cost to immediately deal damage to the target (see below) is reduced to 1.
If the attack hit, you can spend 2 exertion points to immediately have the creature take half of the weapon's damage.

spell.name: Flowing Form

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
You turn into a twisting leaf upon the wind of battle, turning every dodged strike into a sublime counterattack.

You take the Dodge action. Until the start of your next turn you make one melee weapon attack against each target that fails to hit you with a melee weapon attack, and you have disadvantage on Perception checks.

spell.name: Redirect

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
Your opponent's blow is not simply turned away but re-oriented entirely, forced into inflicting a wound against a foe unfortunate enough to be nearby.

When you are hit with a melee weapon attack from a Large or smaller creature, you can use your reaction to reduce the attack's success tier by one against you, and also cause the difference in effect that this tier reduction made to be applied to another creature adjacent to you.
Once you have used this maneuver against a creature, it has no effect against that creature for the remainder of combat.

spell.name: Discerning Strike

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The Empowered Attack feature
A probing blow allows you to take the measure of your foe.
When you activate this maneuver, you take the Attack action.
Until the start of your next turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack you learn its current hit points, hit point maximum, immunities, resistances, and vulnerabilities.

If you score a critical hit you can choose one of the creature's resistances or immunities. The creature loses that resistance or immunity until the end of your next turn. In addition, until the beginning of your next turn you gain advantage on melee weapon attacks against that creature.

spell.name: Retributive Blow

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
You return a blow so quickly that your opponent is shocked.

When you are hit with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacker. On a hit, that creature has disadvantage on armour attack rolls against you until the beginning of your next turn.

spell.name: Strike the Cracks Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
You focus on targeting your enemy's weakest spots.
Your critical hit range for melee weapon attacks is increased by 1.
You deal one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee weapon attack.

spell.name: Blinding Strikes

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The Empowered Attack feature
With a vicious strike, you blind your enemy.
When you activate this maneuver, you take the Attack action.
Until the start of your next turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, it is {@condition blinded|sns} and can't benefit from either blindsight or tremorsense.
At the beginning of each of its turns, a creature {@condition blinded|sns} by this maneuver can make a save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spell.name: Reflect Attack

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points
You redirect your enemy's attack back upon itself.

When you are hit with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to redirect the force back to the attacker. The attack's success tier is reduce by one and the attacker takes the difference in effect that this tier reduction made.
If you have already hit that creature with a Mirror's Glint maneuver since the beginning of your last turn, the attack's success tier is reduced by two instead.

spell.name: Anticipate Spell

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You make your move while your foe is busy casting a spell.
Until the start of your next turn, when you see a creature within 5 feet of you cast a spell you can use your reaction to make either an opportunity attack or a Sleight of Hand check against it.

spell.name: Deceptive Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
With practice and training you learn how to shut off your facial reactions amidst battle, taking on a passive countenance from which nothing can be easily gleaned.
You gain an expertise die on Deception and Sleight of Hand checks made in combat.

spell.name: Painful Pickpocket

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
Sometimes a good diversion is presented to you and though a foe might bloody you, your light fingers find opportunity in the exchange.
When a creature hits you with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to make a Sleight of Hand check against it.

spell.name: Perplexing Flurry

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
A rain of short, sharp strikes disorients your enemy.

When you activate this maneuver, you take the Attack action. As long as your attack is a melee weapon attack, the target has disadvantage on armour attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Agile Feint

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
You juke left and right, throw sand, whip out your cloak, or otherwise try to distract your opponent and make them vulnerable to attack.
Choose a creature within your reach. You have advantage on your next weapon attack roll against it.

spell.name: Force Hesitation

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

After working your way into an opponent's guard you convince them that every step will lead to a disastrous end, and that to divert their attention away from you for even a moment invites devastation.

Make a reflex attack against a creature within your reach with the following outcomes:. On a failure, it reacts to a strike from you that never comes. As long as you remain within the target's reach, until the start of your next turn it cannot attack any creature other than you.

items.name: Minor success
entries: As long as your remain within its reach, the target has disadvantage on armour attacks against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Standard success
entries: As long as your remain within its reach, the target cannot make armour attacks against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As long as you remain within its reach, the target cannot make attacks against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.
After you have used this maneuver against a creature, its attack has disadvantage against that creature until the end of combat.

spell.name: Mugging Hit

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
As your enemy howls in pain, you swiftly snatch something away from them.
Choose a creature you can see. On a hit with your next melee weapon attack against it before the start of your next turn, you can also make a Sleight of Hand check against the creature.

spell.name: Douse

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You quickly dash a container of liquid over your opponent at an opportune moment.
You splash a held container of liquid, such as a contact poison, holy water, or alchemical substance, at a target within 20 feet.
This maneuver can also be used to extinguish a small nonmagical fire in a 5-foot-square area.

spell.name: Feinting Strike

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
You make a skillful, deceptive strike which your foe doesn't see coming.
Make a melee weapon attack using the result of a disadvantaged Sleight of Hand check instead of your usual attack roll.

spell.name: Pickpocket

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You snatch something from your enemy.
When a creature is within your reach, you can use your reaction to make a Sleight of Hand check against it.

spell.name: Blinding Blow Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
You pace your attacks in a disruptive flow that makes it easy to follow a strike with maneuvering that temporarily blinds your foes.

After you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 exertion to make a Sleight of Hand check. Reduce the result by the target's armour, and if it succeeds against a DC of 15, the target is {@condition blinded|sns}.
At the beginning of each of its turns, the {@condition blinded|sns} creature can make a save to recover from its blindness.

spell.name: Spinning Parry

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
A quick step and suddenly you and your foe exchange places.
You can use your reaction to reduce the success tier of a creature's makes a melee weapon attack against you by one.
In addition, you may also swap places with the attacker (no opportunity attacks provoked), then make a will attack against it with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition staggered|sns} until the start of its next turn.

items.name: Critical success
entries: The target is {@condition staggered|sns} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Steal Momentum

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
A quick jab to a pressure point locks your opponent's joints.

When a creature moves into your reach you can use your reaction to make a Sleight of Hand check. Reduce the result by the creature's armour, and if it succeeds against a DC of 15, the creature is {@condition restrained|sns} until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Armour Lock

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The Empowered Attack feature
You swiftly adjust your enemy's armor so that they cannot move.

Make a Sleight of Hand check. Reduce the result by the armour of a creature within reach that is wearing armour, and if it succeeds against a DC of 15, the creature is {@condition staggered|sns}.
