You may also choose to make the space you've chosen the centre of a 40-foot line. Creatures and objects within the line when it is created take bludgeoning DoT damage equal to your Strength modifier. Striking a surface that is 1 foot thick or less, such as a rooftop or bridge, severely damages it, causing creatures and objects in the area to fall.

spell.name: Malicious Mark

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point

As a bonus action, you can mark a creature within 15 feet with a sigil. Alternatively, you may activate this stance by expending your reaction after hitting with a weapon attack, marking the creature you hit. While a target is marked in this way, any attempt to use the Help action against that target is a bonus action, rather than an action. This stance ends early if you wish to mark another creature or if the target is more than 30 feet away from you.

spell.name: Mystic Feint

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point

When a creature makes a melee weapon attack against you, you can use your reaction to gain an expertise die to your armour against that creature. This increase only applies to the attacking creature and ends at the start of your next turn. Once the attack is resolved, you may choose to switch spaces with the target.

spell.name: Quickening

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point
You can expend your reaction to gain advantage on an initiative roll.

spell.name: Reactive Ward

entries.name: Points
entries: 1-3 points

When you or an ally within 15 feet are targeted by a spell with a duration of 1 round or less, you may briefly manifest a 5-foot-square shield centered on the target. The creature gains three-quarters cover against the spell, potentially preventing it from doing anything. You may also spend up to a total of 3 exertion on this reaction, protecting one extra creature within range for each additional point spent.

spell.name: Stormrider

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

As an action, teleport up to your Speed to an unoccupied space. Make an area weapon fortitude attack against all enemies within 10 feet of the space that deals lightning damage equal to your weapon's base damage. On a hit, a target is pushed 5 feet away from you.

spell.name: Warding Flourish

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

Choose an ally within 15 feet that you can see. As long as that ally stays within 15 feet of you, they increase their armour by 2. You can only ward one creature at a time. This effect ends if you are {@condition incapacitated|sns}.

spell.name: Attack in Tandem

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

You and your beast minion must both take this stance to gain its benefits. When you make a melee weapon attack against a creature, your beast minion gains advantage on armour attack rolls against that creature until the start of your next turn.
In addition, non-armour attacks against your beast minion have disadvantage and it has 50% resistance to damage.

spell.name: Bounding Charge

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point

You command your beast minion to move up to its Speed in a straight line towards a creature. If your beast minion ends this movement within reach of the creature, it makes one attack against that creature. Your beast minion cannot take the Dash action and this maneuver on the same turn.

spell.name: Bring the Mighty Low

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

When a creature of up to one size category larger than your beast minion makes a melee weapon attack against it, you command your beast minion to respond by harrying the attacker's movements. If the creature's attack hits, it deals an additional damage die and must make a save or fall {@condition prone|sns}. If it fails to hit, the creature must make the save with disadvantage.

If the attacking creature is two categories larger than your beast minion, you may direct your beast minion to get under the creature's feet and take additional bludgeoning damage equal to that creature's Strength modifier in order to force it to make the save as above.

spell.name: Coordinated Trip

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
The next time your beast minion uses the {@spell Knockdown|sns} basic maneuver against a creature within its reach, if you are also within reach of the creature, choose one of the following benefits:

items: The minion's attack that is triggering the maneuver has a {@dice 1d4} bonus.
The maneuver may be used against a creature one size category larger than it normally would work on.

spell.name: Fetch!

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point

Choose a creature that is up to one size category larger than your beast minion within 20 feet. When your beast minion next successfully uses the {@spell Grapple|sns} basic maneuver on that creature, it can also use its bonus action to move 10 feet towards you, dragging the creature along with it.

spell.name: Fortifying Reassurance

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

If you are within 20 feet when your beast minion is hit by an armour attack, you can use your reaction to call out and help it regain its fighting spirit. As long as it is able to hear you, your beast minion regains hit points equal to your level plus your proficiency bonus.

If your beast minion benefits from this feature and is {@condition charmed|sns}, {@condition poisoned|sns}, or {@condition restrained|sns}, it can use its action on its next turn to end those conditions.

spell.name: Get Back!

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

When a creature damages your beast minion, you order it to retreat. As long as it can hear you, the minion moves up to its Speed towards you in the most direct course it is able to, stopping at the end of its movement or when you are between it and the creature that damaged it (whichever comes first). It can also choose to move up to twice its Speed, taking a level of {@condition fatigue|sns} in the process. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks from creatures your beast minion can see.

spell.name: Goading Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

You command your beast minion to tactically lower its guard. While this stance is active, all melee weapon attacks against your beast minion are made with a {@dice d6} expertise die. On a hit, the attacking creature takes true damage equal to twice your proficiency bonus as your companion bites and claws at it.

spell.name: Howl of Challenge

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

The next time before the end of its next turn that your beast minion makes a melee weapon attack against a creature, it roars, howls, or makes some similar threatening noise. If the attack scores a major success, all hostile creatures within 30 feet of your beast minion have disadvantage on armour attacks against any creature that is not your beast minion until the start of your beast minion's next turn.

spell.name: Quick Switch

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

You command your beast minion to switch places with a creature adjacent to it. If the creature you command your beast minion to switch places with is unwilling, it makes a save. On a success, the switch doesn't happen.

spell.name: Strike from Below

entries.name: Points
entries: 3 points

You command your beast minion to leap at a flying creature and target its means of flight. Your beast minion may move up to 20 feet to get into position and gains a vertical jump height equal to half its Speed for the purposes of striking the target creature. The creature is forced to make a save. On a fail, its flight speed is reduced by half until healed and it immediately plummets to the ground (or 60 feet, whichever comes first) and takes falling damage as usual. On a success, it takes true damage equal to your proficiency bonus. Creatures more than 1 size category larger than your beast minion make this save with advantage.

Regardless of the result, after performing the maneuver, your beast minion lands in an unoccupied space of your choice that is adjacent to the one directly below the target, taking fall damage as normal. If there re no unoccupied adjacent spaces, your beast minion falls either into the space directly below the target creature (which may, in turn, fall on your companion), or onto the creature in the adjacent occupied space of your choice. Both the creature that falls into an occupied space and its occupant take double the normal amount of fall damage before the falling creature is shunted into the closest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Vigilant Stance

entries.name: Points
entries: 1 point

You command your beast minion to take a stance. While this stance is active, your beast minion reduces its attack damage rolls by half your proficiency bonus. However, it also adds half your proficiency bonus to its Armour.

spell.name: Warning Cry

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points
When a creature makes a weapon armour attack against your beast minion, your warning causes your companion to shift position, reducing the attack's success tier by 1.

Your beast minion cannot benefit from this maneuver and {@spell Vigilant Stance|sns} at the same time. Instead, this maneuver overrides the stance against the triggering attack, after which the stance's effect returns as normal.

spell.name: Wild Strikes

entries.name: Points
entries: 2 points

You command your beast minion to attack wildly on its turn. The next time your beast minion takes the Attack action before the end of its next turn, its attack is made at disadvantage, but its damage is multiplied by your proficiency bonus. For example, if it's damage is {@damage 1d6 + 5} and your proficiency bonus is +2, its damage becomes {@dice 2d6 + 10}. This attack counts as being benefit by the Empowered Attack feature.

entries.name: Crack Shot
entries: At tier 1, your training with ranged weapons grants the following benefits:

items: You do not have disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls due to being adjacent to a hostile creature or attacking at long range.
Your ranged weapon attack rolls ignore half cover and three-quarters covers.

entries.name: Sharpshooting Traditions
entries: Also at tier 1, you gain proficiency in one of the following combat traditions of your choice: {@filter Biting Zephyr|spells|Subschool=biting zephyr|}, {@filter Razor's Edge|spells|Subschool=razor's edge|}, {@filter Unending Wheel|spells|Subschool=unending wheel|}.

entries.name: Sharpshooter Major Effect #1
entries: For 1 round, attacks against the target have +2 critical hit range. If the target dies from this attack, your attacks have +2 critical hit range for the rest of the combat, or until you land a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Focus Shot
entries: At tier 3, you've become precise enough that when given enough time to focus you can not only strike your target, but hit specific parts of your target to great effect. Once per turn, whenever you take the Attack action and make a ranged attack, you may forgo one instance of your Empowered Attack feature to make the attack a Focus Shot. When you make a Focus Shot choose one of the following options. You gain an expertise die on the attack, and on a hit it does your chosen effect in addition to the attack's damage.

Creatures wounded by any of these effects can end the effect upon passing a passive save. Alternatively, the wounded creature (or a creature adjacent to it) can use an action to make a Medicine check against your standard DC, ending the effect on a success. Receiving any healing also ends the effect. You cannot choose effects that specifically target features a creature does not have.

items: Aim for the Eyes: You aim for the creature's weak and delicate eyes. If the Focus Shot scores a major success, the target is {@condition blinded|sns} until it recovers.
Bring it Down: You aim for weak points on the creature's legs. If the Focus Shot scores a major success, its Speed is reduced by half until it recovers.
Center of Mass: You aim for the heart or its horrid equivalent. Your Focus Shot's critical success range increases by 1.

Vein Slice: You aim for a vital vein or artery to bleed your target out. If the Focus Shot scores a major success, the target takes {@dice 1d6} ongoing damage of your weapon's base type until it recovers.

Wing Clip: You aim for your target's wings. If the Focus Shot scores a major success, the target's flying speed is reduced by half until it recovers. Creatures who are currently flying when this effect begins immediately plummet up to 60 feet down and take falling damage as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Sharpshooter Major Effect #2
entries: For 1 round, if you make a ranged weapon attack as part of a maneuver you perform (e.g. Missile Volley, Horizon Shot), or use a bonus action to perform a maneuver that impacts your next ranged weapon attack (e.g. Doubleshot, Blindshot), it has no Exertion cost.

subclassFeature.name: Hawkeye
entries: At tier 2, you have become incredibly observant and alert. You gain an expertise die on Investigation and Perception checks, and on initiative rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Sniper
entries: Also from tier 2, your threshold for landing a major success with ranged weapon attacks is reduced by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Reflexive Shot
entries: At tier 4, your accurate reflexes allow you to threaten shots at a moment's notice. You may make opportunity attacks using ranged weapons, acting as if your reach were 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Critical Shot
entries: At tier 5, you can hit miniscule targets at ludicrous ranges with seemingly impossible accuracy. Whenever you take the Attack action, you may forgo all instances of your Empowered Attack feature to turn your attack into a Critical Shot, making the attack with advantage. If your Critical Shot hits it becomes a critical success.

subclassFeature.name: The Genie
entries: You have made a pact with one of the rarest kinds of genie, a noble genie. Such entities rule vast fiefs on the Elemental Planes and have great influence over lesser genies and elemental creatures. Noble genies are varied in their motivations, but most are arrogant and wield power that rivals that of lesser deities. They delight in turning the table on mortals, who often bind genies into servitude, and readily enter into pacts that expand their reach.
You choose your patron's kind or determine it randomly, using the Genie Kind table.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: {@i 1st-level Genie feature}

The Genie lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The Genie Expanded Spells table shows the genie spells that are added to the warlock spell list for you, along with the spells associated in the table with your patron's kind: dao, djinni, efreeti, or marid.

subclassFeature.name: Genie's Vessel
entries: At tier 1, your patron gifts you a magical vessel that grants you a measure of the genie's power. The vessel is a Tiny object, and you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells. You decide what the object is, or you can determine what it is randomly by rolling on the Genie's Vessel table.
While you are touching the vessel, you can use it in the following ways:

entries.name: Bottled Respite
entries: As an action, you can magically vanish and enter your vessel, which remains in the space you left. The interior of the vessel is an extradimensional space in the shape of a 20-foot-radius cylinder, 20 feet high, and resembles your vessel. The interior is appointed with cushions and low tables and is a comfortable temperature. While inside, you can hear the area around your vessel as if you were in its space. You can remain inside the vessel up to a number of hours equal to twice your proficiency bonus. You exit the vessel early if you use a bonus action to leave, if you die, or if the vessel is destroyed. When you exit the vessel, you appear in an unoccupied space closest to it. Any objects left in the vessel remain there until carried out, and if the vessel is destroyed, every object stored there harmlessly appears in the unoccupied spaces closest to the vessel's former space. Once you enter the vessel, you can't enter again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Genie's Wrath
entries: Once during each of your turns when you hit with an armour attack, you can deal extra damage to the target equal to your proficiency bonus. The type of this damage is determined by your patron: bludgeoning (dao), thunder (djinni), fire (efreeti), or cold (marid).
The vessel's armour equals your spellcasting ability modifier. Its hit points equal double your warlock level, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage.

If the vessel is destroyed or you lose it, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and the previous vessel is destroyed if it still exists. The vessel vanishes in a flare of elemental power when you die.

subclassFeature.name: Genie Major Effect #1
entries: For 1 round, the target of this attack takes additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus, of a type determined by your patron’s kind, whenever it is hit by an attack. If the target dies from this attack, creatures of your choice that you can see immediately take this damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Gift
entries: From tier 2, you begin to take on characteristics of your patron's kind. You now have 50% resistance to a damage type determined by your patron's kind: bludgeoning (dao), thunder (djinni), fire (efreeti), or cold (marid).

In addition, as a bonus action, you can give yourself a flying speed of 30 feet that lasts for 10 minutes, during which you can hover. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Assisted Arcana
entries: You learn each of the spells specific to your patron’s kind available on your expanded spell list. Additionally, when learning warlock spells, you may learn any spell that can deal damage matching your patron’s kind. Whenever you cast either such spells, their spell point cost is reduced by 50%.

subclassFeature.name: Genie Major Effect #2
entries: For 1 round, if you cast a spell that would have its spell point cost reduced by your Assisted Arcana feature, its spell point cost is 0 instead.

subclassFeature.name: Sanctuary Vessel
entries: From tier 4, when you enter your Genie's Vessel via the Bottled Respite feature, you can now choose up to five willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet of you, and the chosen creatures are drawn into the vessel with you.
As a bonus action, you can eject any number of creatures from the vessel, and everyone is ejected if you leave or die or if the vessel is destroyed.

In addition, anyone (including you) who remains within the vessel for at least 10 minutes gains the benefit of finishing a short rest, and anyone can add your level to the number of hit points they regain if they spend any Hit Dice as part of a short rest there.

subclassFeature.name: Limited Wish
entries: From tier 5, you can entreat your patron to grant you a small wish. As an action, you can speak your desire to your Genie's Vessel, requesting the effect of one spell that is 6th level or lower and has a casting time of 1 action. The spell can be from any class's spell list, and you don't need to meet the requirements of that spell, including components; the spell simply takes effect as part of this action.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish {@dice 1d4} long rests.

subclassFeature.name: Sun Priest
entries: At each indicated level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

entries.name: Favoured Illumination
entries: Starting at tier 1 when you choose this subclass, you learn the {@spell dancing lights|sns}, {@spell light|sns}, or {@spell produce flame|sns} cantrip. This does not count against your number of known cantrips.

entries.name: Flash Fight
entries: Also at tier 1, you learn that light is everything on the battlefield. You can use an action to touch a hostile creature within your reach, gently illuminating it with your divine will and granting advantage on armour attacks made against it before the start of your next turn.

Alternatively, you can use an action to touch an ally within reach, surrounding them with a coruscating shimmer of bright light. Until the start of your next turn, creatures have disadvantage on armour attacks against the touched ally.
Once you have used this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Sun Priest Major Effect #1
entries: The target makes a saving throw, becoming blinded for 1 round on a failed save. On a successful save, or if they were already blinded, their attacks have -1AB for 1 round. If the target dies from this attack, your next blinding effect during the combat has advantaged offence.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Radiant Burst
entries: Starting at tier 2, you can use an action to clutch your holy symbol and emit a bright blast. In addition to dispelling any magical darkness within 30 feet, make a fortitude attack against all enemy creatures within 30 feet, with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target has disadvantage with armour attacks for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition blinded|sns} by the light for 1 minute, or until it succeeds on a passive save.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition debilitated|sns}.
Alternatively, you can choose to make the light more harmful. Instead of any of the above outcomes of the fortitude attack, you can have it deal radiant damage equal to {@dice 2d12} + your level.

subclassFeature.name: Honed Searing
entries: Also from tier 2, no more than once per turn when you roll 1 on a damage die for fire or radiant damage, you may treat that roll as if it was the maximum value on that die.

subclassFeature.name: Fierce Flash
entries: Beginning at tier 3, you can use Flash Fight on creatures within 30 feet of you in addition to creatures you can touch.

subclassFeature.name: Sun Priest Major Effect #2
entries: Any number of creatures of your choice that you can see and are in bright light gain +3 to saving throws for 1 round.

subclassFeature.name: Harness the Flame
entries: Starting at tier 4, when you make a damaging attack with a cleric cantrip or a weapon, add fire or radiant damage equal to your Wisdom modifier. You must choose the damage type at the beginning of each long rest, and may not change it until you have completed another long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Summon the Stars
entries: At tier 5, you are able to manipulate the burning brilliance of the stars themselves. As an action, choose an object or creature within 60 feet. For 1 minute the target emits bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The target emits a 30-foot persistent zone around it that forces creatures to make a save or become {@condition blinded|sns} for 1 minute, or until they pass a passive save.

The first time this feature is used per long rest, the persistent zone also deals {@dice 8d6} radiant DoT damage. Magical auras within the bright light become visible for 1 hour, shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius for 1 hour. An {@condition invisible} creature that takes radiant damage from the light is also revealed and it sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius for 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Sired
entries: Sired savants have been infected, or blessed, with vampirism by a more senior vampire. This process is known as being sired by that vampire.

subclassFeature.name: Vampiric Transformation
entries: At tier 1 when you first take this subclass, you gain a bite natural weapon, which you can use an action. The weapon cannot be used in any other way, including as part of the Attack action, as a reaction, or when triggered by a maneuver. The bite weapon deals {@dice 1d6} + Strength piercing damage, and you recover hit points equal to the damage it deals on a hit.
Additionally, you gain 30 feet of darkvision.

subclassFeature.name: Sired Major Effect #1
entries: For 1 round, you ignore the effects of sunlight on you and gain +3 armour against attackers who do not have darkvision.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: From tier 2, your bite natural weapon has advantage on attack rolls against targets with fewer hit points than their maximum.
Additionally, your bite natural weapon recovers additional hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Supernatural Senses
entries: At tier 3, you gain 60 feet of blindsight.

subclassFeature.name: Sired Major Effect #2
entries: For 1 round, you gain a +2 bonus to armour attack rolls against targets with fewer hit points than their maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Emerging Immortality
entries: At tier 4, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have 50% resistance to necrotic damage.
Whenever you would become {@condition charmed|sns} or {@condition frightened|sns}, make a save, ignoring the condition on a success.
Whenever you would drop to 0 hit points, make a disadvantaged save, remaining at 1 hit point instead on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Senses
entries: Also at tier 4, you gain 30 feet of true sight.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Form
entries: From tier 5, as a bonus action, you can cast {@spell Gaseous Form|sns} on yourself at will, as if it were cast with a 5th level spell slot.
Additionally, you recover hit points equal to your Strength modifier whenever you start your turn while conscious and not in sunlight.

default: (a) {@item chain mail|phb} or (b) {@item leather armor|phb}, {@item longbow|phb}, and {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows}
(a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) two {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
(a) a {@item mace|phb} or (b) a {@item warhammer|phb} (if proficient)
(a) {@item scale mail|phb}, (b) {@item leather armor|phb}, or (c) {@item chain mail|phb} (if proficient)
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item priest's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
A {@item shield|phb} and a {@item holy symbol|phb}

items: A blinded creature can't sense with eyesight and automatically fails any ability check that requires eyesight.
Armour attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
A charmed creature is {@condition debilitated|sns} when attempting to attack the charmer.
The charmer has advantage on any ability check to interact socially with the creature.

condition.name: Confused
entries: On its turn, a confused creature rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does.

items: On a 1-4, a confused creature is {@condition debilitated|sns} until the end of its turn.
On a 5-6, a confused creature is {@condition dazed|sns} until the end of its turn.
On a 7+, a confused creature makes a melee weapon attack against a randomly determined creature at the start of its turn as a free action.
A dazed creature has disadvantage with attacks.
All attacks against a dazed creature have advantage.

condition.name: Deafened
entries: A deafened creature can't sense with hearing and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.

condition.name: Debilitated
entries: A debilitated creature suffers the following effects:

items: Disadvantage with attacks.
Damaging attacks are downgraded one success tier.
Does not grant disadvantage on armour attack rolls to adjacent ranged attackers.

condition.name: Dominated
entries: A dominated creature is {@condition charmed|sns}. Additionally, a dominated creature gains a free action at the start of each of its turns that can be taken to both move up to its speed and make either a single weapon attack or cast a cantrip. This free action is completely controlled by the dominator.

condition.name: Doomed
entries: A doomed creature dies at a time determined by the DM, or within 13 ({@dice 2d12}) hours.
A doomed creature continues to be doomed even after it dies. Magic equivalent to a 7th-level or higher spell can remove the doomed condition (such as {@spell regenerate|sns} or {@spell wish|sns}.

rows: Disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity checks.
Disadvantage on armour attack rolls based on Strength or Dexterity, and incoming fortitude and reflex attacks have advantage.

items: A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and armour attack rolls.
While moving towards the source of its fear, the creature is {@condition sluggish|sns}.
A grappled creature who is adjacent to the grappler has 0 speed. If it is not adjacent to the grappler, it is {@condition sluggish|sns}.
The condition ends if the grappler is {@condition incapacitated|sns}.
The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the {@spell thunderwave|sns} spell.

condition.name: Incapacitated
entries: An incapacitated creature can't take actions or reactions.

condition.name: Poisoned
entries: A poisoned creature has disadvantage on armour attack rolls and ability checks.

items: A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
The creature has disadvantage on armour attack rolls.
An armour attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is adjacent to the creature. Otherwise, it has disadvantage.

condition.name: Rattled
entries: A rattled creature cannot take reactions.

items: A restrained creature who is adjacent to the restrainer has 0 speed. If it is not adjacent to the restrainer, it is {@condition sluggish|sns}.
Armour and reflex attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's armour attack rolls have disadvantage.
A slowed creature's speed is halved.
Armour and reflex attacks against the creature have advantage.
The creature cannot take reactions.
On its turn, the creature can take either an action or a bonus action, not both.

condition.name: Sluggish
entries: For every foot of movement a sluggish creature takes, they must spend 2 feet of speed.

condition.name: Staggered
entries: A staggered creature suffers the following effects:

items: Incoming attack rolls have advantage.
Incoming damaging attacks are upgraded one success tier.

rows: Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks.
Concentration is lost upon being hit.
Can only take a bonus or standard action each turn (not both).
Disadvantage on armour attack rolls based on Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, and incoming reflex and will attacks have advantage.
Suffer the effects of a random short-term mental stress effect.
Suffer the effects of a random long-term mental stress effect.

condition.name: Taunted
entries: A taunted creature must target at least the taunter with all attacks.

items: An unconscious creature is {@condition incapacitated|sns}, can't move or speak, and cannot sense its surroundings.
The creature falls {@condition prone|sns}.
If the creature's fortitude and reflex are higher than 0, they are 0.
Armour attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
Damaging attacks against the creature from adjacent creatures are upgraded one success tier.
If this condition is lost during combat and the creature had at least one turn while unconscious, it immediately takes a turn. This does not change initiative order.

condition.name: Fixated
entries: A fixated creature has disadvantage on Investigation and Perception checks to perceive or examine creatures or objects other than the source of its fixation.
While moving away from the source of its fixation, the creature is {@condition sluggish|sns}.

optionalfeature.name: Amphibious Combatant
entries: You gain a swimming speed equal to your Speed, and may spend 1 exertion to reroll a failed Strength or Dexterity check related to aquatic activity (such as Athletics checks to swim or Acrobatics checks to keep balance on a ship's deck). You may choose whether to use the new roll or the original. In addition, you add your proficiency bonus to the number of minutes you can hold your breath before suffocating, and can spend 1 exertion to hold your breath for additional minutes equal to your proficiency bonus. This does not affect your journey activities.

optionalfeature.name: Burst of Strength
entries: You have moments of incredible strength. You may spend 1 exertion to add your proficiency bonus to a Strength check, even if you already add your proficiency bonus to the check.

optionalfeature.name: Campaigner
entries: You have the ability to go for the long haul, carrying heavy equipment across long distances. You add your Strength modifier an additional time to your Brawn checks. You may also reduce the duration of journeys by 1 day, to a minimum of 1. This must be decided at the start of the journey and the decision cannot be changed throughout it.

optionalfeature.name: Clearsight Sentinel
entries: You gain 60 feet of darkvision. In addition, you do not suffer disadvantage on Perception checks in dim light.

optionalfeature.name: Extreme Leap
entries: When you take the Dash action and make a long jump after moving no less than 20 feet, your jump distance is doubled for the turn. You may spend 1 exertion to triple your jump distance for the turn instead, and may move the full distance of your jump even if it exceeds your Speed.

optionalfeature.name: Mountaineer
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your Speed. In addition, moving through non-magical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement.

optionalfeature.name: Nightwatch
entries: You are used to sleeping light and making the most of your rest. When taking a long rest, add your proficiency bonus to the number of hours you can spend in light activity. In addition, one hour of that time can be spent in strenuous activity near the rest site (such as patrolling, fighting, or other adventuring activities) without interrupting your rest. This allows you to perform an additional disadvantaged journey activity for the day if you wish.

optionalfeature.name: Stable Footing
entries: A steady stance and careful footwork is instinctive to you. You have advantage on any check or save to avoid falling {@condition prone|sns} or handle difficult ground (such as against a {@spell grease|sns} spell or slippery ice), and any non-armour attacks against you attempting to do similar things to you have disadvantage. You are never {@condition prone|sns} after taking fall damage, and when calculating fall damage you treat the fall distance as if it were shorter by a number of feet equal to your proficiency bonus x 10.

optionalfeature.name: Weather Beaten
entries: Exposed to all kinds of weather over your life, you are inured to all but the most deadly effects. Attacks against you from cold and hot weather, as well as any adverse effects from wind or precipitation, have disadvantage. This also allows you to ignore the effects of these types of weather during journeys, if you wish.

optionalfeature.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: When you use your Eldritch Blast, you deal extra damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Shadows
entries: You are under the constant effects of the {@spell mage armour|sns} spell. This effect does not emit a magical aura.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Influence
entries: You gain proficiency in Deception and Persuasion. If you are already proficient in either of these skills, you instead gain an expertise die.

optionalfeature.name: Chains of Carceri
entries: You can cast {@spell hold monster|sns} on a celestial, fiend, or elemental without spending spell points or material components. You must finish a long rest before you can use this invocation on the same creature again.

optionalfeature.name: Cosmic Armory
entries: Your patron bestows you with a loot specialisation of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Courts of the Outer Realms
entries: Choose one creature type from the following: aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead. You are familiar with the intricacies of society and politics among those creatures, and you have advantage on checks made to interact with them or recall lore about them.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with your choice of either Arcana, History, or Religion. If you are already proficient in the chosen skill, you instead gain an expertise die.

optionalfeature.name: Deep Patronage
entries: Choose an additional Expanded Spell List. You learn all the spells on that list and they do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Dreadful Word
entries: You learn the {@spell confusion|sns} spell, and the spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Eigth Arcanum
entries: You learn an {@filter 8th-level warlock spell|spells|level=8|class=Warlock} that you can cast once between long rests.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Bind
entries: When you score a major success against a creature with your Eldritch Whip, it is {@condition staggered|sns} for 1 minute, or until it passes a passive save.

Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. You also regain the use of this feature after you've spent 5 spell points to cast a spell or use other warlock features

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Elementalism
entries: When you use your Eldritch Blast, you can spend 1 spell point to choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder damage. Until you complete a short or long rest, your Eldritch Blast deals your choice of force damage or the chosen damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Grasp
entries: When you score a major success against a Large-sized or smaller creature with your Eldritch Blast, you may grapple it. The grapple automatically ends if the creature leaves your Eldritch Blast range or if you attempt to grapple another creature.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Prism
entries: You can use an action to unleash your Eldritch Blast against creatures within a 20-foot cube originating at a point within 60 feet. Make a spell will attack against each creature in the area that deals force damage equal to a number of {@dice d12}s equal to your proficiency bonus.

Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. You also regain the use of this feature after you've spent 5 spell points to cast a spell or use other warlock features.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Riposte

prerequisite.other: Eldritch Disturbance or Eldritch Ray feature

entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet hits you, you can use your reaction and spend spell points to use your Eldritch Disturbance or Eldritch Ray against it. Instead of the normal damage, you deal {@dice 1d10} force damage for every 1 spell point spent activating this feature (up to a maximum equal to your proficiency bonus).

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Severance
entries: You can use an action to unleash your Eldritch Blast against creatures within a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Make a spell reflex attack against each creature in the area that deals force damage equal to a number of {@dice d12}s equal to your proficiency bonus.

Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. You also regain the use of this feature after you've spent 5 spell points to cast a spell or use other warlock features

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Spear
entries: The range of your Eldritch Ray increases to 300 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Squall
entries: You can use an action to unleash your Eldritch Blast against all creatures within a 30-foot cone. Make a spell reflex attack against each creature in the area that deals force damage equal to a number of {@dice 1d12}s equal to your proficiency bonus.

Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. You also regain the use of this feature after you've spent 5 spell points to cast a spell or use other warlock features

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Tentacle
entries: When you hit a creature with your Eldritch Blast, you can push the creature up to 10 feet straight toward you.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Warrior
entries: You gain proficiency with medium armour and martial weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Entity of Myth
entries: You gain 50% resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from weapons not made from cold iron.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Runekeeper
entries: You can read all writing.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Vigor
entries: You learn the {@spell false life|sns} spell, and the spell doesn't count against your number of spells known. When you cast it on yourself as a 1st-level spell, you can do so without spending spell points or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Frog Fangs
entries: Your familiar can take the Attack action. Attacks made by your familiar count as your attacks and deal additional force damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Gaze of Two Minds
entries: You can use your action to touch a willing humanoid and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. On subsequent turns you can use a bonus action to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you are {@condition blinded|sns} and {@condition deafened|sns} to your own surroundings.

optionalfeature.name: Lifedrinker
entries: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes extra necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum 1).

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Many Faces
entries: You can cast {@spell disguise self|sns} without spending spell points.

optionalfeature.name: Minions of the Multiverse
entries: When you choose this invocation, choose one spell with the minion tag of your choice from any spell list, up to a spell level that you are capable of casting (maximum of 5th-level). You can cast this spell once by spending an appropriate number of spell points (see Table: Spell Points). You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mire the Mind
entries: You can cast {@spell slow|sns} once by spending 5 spell points. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Misty Visions
entries: You can cast {@spell silent image|sns} without spending spell points or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Noxious Invigoration
entries: Whenever you gain temporary hit points, increase the amount you gain by your level.

optionalfeature.name: Ominous Tormentor
entries: You gain proficiency in Insight and Intimidation. If you are already proficient in either of these skills, you instead gain an expertise die.

optionalfeature.name: Overclocked Concentration
entries: You can maintain concentration on two spells simultaneously. Their cumulative spell-level can be no higher than 5th-level. When you lose concentration both spells end.

optionalfeature.name: Pactkeeper's Reward
entries: You gain an additional Pact Boon of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Penultimate Arcanum
entries: You learn a 9th-level warlock spell that you can cast once between long rests.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Witchcraft
entries: Your warlock cantrips deal extra damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Reanimator
entries: You can cast {@spell animate dead|sns} once by spending 5 spell points; you can instead cast it as a 4th-level spell by spending 6 spell points, or as a 5th-level spell by spending 7 spell points. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When you hit a creature with your Eldritch Blast, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line.

optionalfeature.name: Sculptor of Flesh
entries: You can cast {@spell polymorph|sns} once by spending 6 spell points. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Seething Aura
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, psychic, radiant. Whenever you spend spell points, you can choose to unleash energy that deals an equal amount of damage of the chosen type to hostile creatures within 15 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Seventh Arcanum
entries: You learn a 7th-level warlock spell that you can cast once between long rests.

optionalfeature.name: Sixth Arcanum
entries: You learn a 6th-level warlock spell that you can cast once between long rests.

optionalfeature.name: Sign of Ill Omen
entries: You learn the {@spell bestow curse|sns} spell, and the spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Spellbinding Contract
entries: You can cast {@spell geas|sns} once by spending 7 spell points. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
If the command of the geas is the stipulation of an agreement to which the target consents, the target automatically fails its save against this spell.

optionalfeature.name: Thief of Five Fates
entries: You learn the {@spell bane|sns} spell, and the spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Tines of Wyrd
entries: Whenever a non-armour attack hits you, you can spend 5 spell points to reroll it and take the second result.

optionalfeature.name: Thirsting Blade
entries: When you use the Attack action, your pact weapon's base damage is doubled. For example, a weapon with a damage of {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier deals {@dice 2d6} + double your Strength modifier instead.

optionalfeature.name: Versatile Blast
entries: You learn an additional Eldritch Blast feature of your choice.
You can take this invocation a second and third time, each time learning a new Eldritch Blast feature.

optionalfeature.name: Voice of the Chain Master
entries: So long as you are on the same plane of existence, you can communicate telepathically with your familiar, perceive through your familiar's senses, and also speak through your familiar in your own voice (even if your familiar is normally incapable of speech).

optionalfeature.name: Whispers of the Grave
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with dead|sns} without spending spell points.

optionalfeature.name: Witch Sight
entries: You can see the true form of any shapechanger or creature concealed by illusion or transmutation magic while the creature is within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Whirling Void
entries: You learn the {@spell black tentacles|sns} spell, and the spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendant Step
entries: You can cast {@spell levitate|sns} on yourself without spending spell points or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Speech
entries: You are under the constant effects of the {@spell speak with animals|sns} spell. This effect does not emit a magical aura.

optionalfeature.name: Book of Ancient Secrets
entries: The complex sigils and symbols of ritual magic appear in your Book of Shadows. Choose three 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag. The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. You can't cast the spells except as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means.

optionalfeature.name: Devil's Sight
entries: You can see normally in all types of darkness (including magical) to a distance of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic|sns} without spending spell points.

optionalfeature.name: Inscrutability
entries: You are under the constant effects of the {@spell nondetection|sns} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Myriad Forms
entries: You can cast {@spell alter self|sns} without spending spell points.

optionalfeature.name: Mirror, Mirror
entries: Using a reflective object, such as an ordinary mirror or the smooth surface of water, you can commune with your patron or their emissary. You may do so during a short or long rest, receiving or conveying information related to your master's bidding. This entity may also use such surfaces to bridge communication with you on its own terms.

You can also use this feature to cast {@spell augury|sns} without spending spell points. Casting the spell in this way does not require material components, although you do need a reflective surface by which your patron might appear to you. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: One with Shadows
entries: You can use an action to become {@condition invisible} while you are in an area of dim light or darkness. Your invisibility lasts until you move, take an action, or use your reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Leap
entries: You are under the constant effects of the {@spell jump|sns} spell. This effect does not emit a magical aura.

optionalfeature.name: Portents and Portals
entries: You automatically know when you are within 1 mile of a portal or gateway to another plane, even if it is inactive or malfunctioning (but not destroyed).
You have advantage on checks made to locate this portal, and gain an expertise die on any checks you make to stabilize, activate, or open it.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowveil
entries: You can cast {@spell invisibility|sns} without spending spell points.

optionalfeature.name: Visions of Distant Realms
entries: You can cast {@spell arcane eye|sns} once without spending spell points. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
At 15th level, you can instead cast {@spell arcane eye|sns} at will.

optionalfeature.name: Whiff of the Beyond
entries: You automatically know when an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead creature has been in a space within 30 feet of you within the past 24 hours, though not which type of creature triggered this knowledge.
Additionally, you gain an expertise die on Perception checks, and you have advantage on checks made to track these creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Ancestral Guidance
entries: In addition to the spells you normally prepare, you always have {@spell speak with dead|sns} prepared, and you can use this feature to cast it once between long rests without spending a spell slot. When you do so, you do not have to target a corpse; you can also target a grave marker, memorial, statue, painting, or other depiction of the deceased creature you wish to talk to. If the chosen creature is not dead, or if such a creature never existed in the first place, the spell fails.

optionalfeature.name: Compassionate Nurse
entries: Your insight and sympathy more than make up for your lack of formal medical training. You gain an expertise die on Medicine checks. In addition, you may always choose to use Wisdom when making Wisdom checks.

optionalfeature.name: Faithful Historian
entries: You have a deep relationship with religious history and art. You gain an expertise die on History checks. In addition, you may always choose to use Wisdom when making History checks.

optionalfeature.name: Gentle Healer
entries: During a short rest, you can aid your allies in their recovery. A creature you choose may roll expended Hit Dice twice, taking the higher result. You may not expend your own Hit Dice while using this feature, since you use all of your energies to heal your companions.

optionalfeature.name: Graceful Fall
entries: Falling from a height greater than 30 feet causes your greater entity to intervene. You are protected as if by the {@spell feather fall|sns} spell. This sign does not use your reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Monastic Austerity
entries: Your greater entity acts as a buffer to shield you from hardship or your religious self-discipline sustains you even during harsh times, preventing the first level of {@condition fatigue|sns} you would take each day.

optionalfeature.name: Numinous Awareness
entries: When you see a creature that appears to be a beast, you automatically recognise whether it is a celestial, fiend, or fey. You have advantage on Arcana and Medicine checks made to interact with magical wounds and maladies caused by celestials, fiends, and fey.

optionalfeature.name: Premonition
entries: You have the ability to interpret messages sent to you in dreams or visions by your greater entity. After each long rest you know either:

items: a piece of information that will help you in your endeavours before the end of your next long rest,

or, how one action will play out before the end of your next long rest. Roll a {@dice d20}. Before the end of your next long rest, you may choose to replace any attack roll or ability check made by a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you with the result of this {@dice d20} roll.

entries: The DM lets you know which benefit is available whenever you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Preservation
entries: Your connection to a greater entity allows you to sense poison or disease in food, drink, or other consumables. You must have had direct contact with them or their container in order to sense this corruption. This turns all of your substantial failures in the Harvest journey activity into failures.

optionalfeature.name: Righteous Path
entries: Divine intuition guides you through the tangled paths of constructed or inhabited areas without confusion. Once per long rest you may choose to walk the Righteous Path for 1 hour. While walking the Righteous Path, you are aware when enemies are within 60 feet of you, and you know if backtracking or alternate routes could avoid them. You can also use an action to sense if there are traps within 30 feet, but not the location or nature of the traps.

optionalfeature.name: Soothing Words
entries: Your divinely-inspired counsel and wise advice can calm troubled minds. You may reduce one ally's {@condition strife|sns} by one level. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Supernal Intuition
entries: Choose a creature type from fiend, fey, celestial, elemental, or undead. You know when a creature of this type is within 60 feet of you, although you do not know its location. The {@spell nondetection|sns} spell protects against this feature. You may select this sign multiple times, choosing a different creature type each time.

optionalfeature.name: Theologian
entries: Years of devoted learning have given you a deep understanding regarding the evolution of religion, theology, and the figures involved. You gain an expertise die on Religion checks. In addition, you may always choose to use Wisdom when making Religion checks.

optionalfeature.name: Voice of Doom
entries: Your personal knowledge of divine wrath and the end times make your proclamations utterly chilling. You gain an expertise die on Intimidation checks. In addition, you may always choose to use Wisdom when making Intimidation checks.

optionalfeature.name: Apothecary Basics
entries: Whenever you take a short or long rest, you can use your medical knowledge to treat one creature. That creature can heal as if it had one extra {@dice 1d4} Hit Die during this rest, or it can ignore one level of {@condition fatigue|sns} for the next four hours.

optionalfeature.name: Deductive Tracker
entries: After observing a creature, you make a deduction that gives you an edge when pursuing it. After you spend at least 1 minute observing a creature, you gain an expertise die on checks made to track that specific creature.

optionalfeature.name: Hostilia Naturae
entries: Following the path trod by Drakran naturalist Karl Evol, author of A Theory of Noetic Field Adaptation Toward Terrifyingness Among Malice Ecologies, you have studied the many perils of wild flora and fauna. You gain an expertise die on checks to avoid, locate, or understand the abilities of aberrations, beasts, and monstrosities. This doesn't affect your journey activities.

optionalfeature.name: Impromptu Persona
entries: You do not need preparation to come up with a convincing fake persona, background, and excuse to cover anything suspicious you are doing. You can gain advantage on Deception checks to pretend to be someone else. However, the ruse won't hold up to prolonged scrutiny. If you spend more than a few minutes in someone's presence, you must make a new Dexeption check with disadvantage to maintain the ruse.

optionalfeature.name: Just What Have We Gotten Ourselves Into?
entries: Whenever you start a combat surprised, you gain an expertise die on your initiative check. When you trigger a trap, you gain an expertise die to your defences for the first attack the trap makes against you. After you use this scheme, you cannot use it again until you complete a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Kleptology
entries: When a creature makes a melee armour attack against you or otherwise touches you, you can make a Sleight of Hand check against them as a reaction.

Additionally, when you spend at least a minute interacting with someone while within arm's reach, you gain an expertise die on Sleight of Hand checks that involve them until the interaction ends. This counts for the Rob journey activity.

optionalfeature.name: Local Informants
entries: You quickly can locate people willing to share information. If you spend an hour reaching out to local residents or simply perusing a recent periodical or newspaper, for the next day you gain an expertise die on History and Investigation checks related to the area. This does not aid any journey activities.

optionalfeature.name: Meeting of Minds
entries: You gain an expertise die on Charisma checks when trying to interact with someone who has proficiency in either Arcana, History, Nature, or Religion, so long as you also have proficiency in that skill. This does not aid any journey activities.

optionalfeature.name: Motto of the Tropezaros
entries: You make sure you're always prepared. Once per short rest you can produce a non-magical item that you could have purchased or prepared at some point, small enough to fit in whatever storage you have available. This could range from a forged passport in your pocket to a glider stowed in the hold of a ship you're traveling on. Pay the appropriate price for it. Limits of causality apply.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Education
entries: Once per hour, when you succeed on an Acrobatics or Athletics check to climb, swim, or jump you can offer advice and encouragement to your allies. For the next minute, each ally who attempts a check to traverse the same area gains an expertise die on the check. This counts for the Chronicle and Seek Shelter journey activities, but no others.

optionalfeature.name: Read You Like A Spellbook
entries: You can spend an action to make an Arcana check against the standard DC of a creature you can sense. If you succeed, you deduce from the creature's demeanor, fashion, and accoutrements what cantrips they know and the last non-cantrip spell they cast, if any.

optionalfeature.name: Reserved Seating
entries: You have forethought of when and where you might need to be places. If you knew you would be in a given area, once per day you can call upon this forethought to have a vehicle or mount waiting for you and your companions, or to have a reservation available at a venue. You pay any appropriate costs. For exceptional requests, you may need to make a Persuasion check or owe someone a favour.

optionalfeature.name: Run Silent Run Deep
entries: Once per hour, when you succeed on a Stelth check you can discreetly direct your allies. For the next minute, each ally who attempts a check to traverse the same area gains an expertise die. This counts for the Scout journey activity.
When moving through an area you're familiar with or have had time to study maps of, you gain an expertise die on Stealth checks. This does not assist with the Scout journey activity.

optionalfeature.name: Student of Technology
entries: You gain an expertise die on Engineering checks to build, repair, or understand a technological device. This does not assist with the Experiment journey activity.

ac.special: half the level of the spell (rounded up)

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. {@damage 1d8 + 4} + the spell's level piercing damage. This damage is multiplied by half this spell's level. For example, at spell level 4, the damage is {@dice 2d8} + 8 + 8. Each of these multipliers counts as an instance of the Empowered Attack feature.

hp.special: 22 (Air only) or 33 (Land and Water only) + 6 for each spell level above 2nd

items: The target's armour is reduced by 1 for 1 round.

trait.name: Flyby (Air Only)
entries: The beast doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Pack Tactics (Land and Water Only)
entries: The beast has advantage on an armour attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beast's allies is adjacent to the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated|sns}.

trait.name: Water Breathing (Water Only)
entries: The beast can breathe only underwater.

ac.special: 1 + half the level of the spell (rounded up)

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage (or fire damage for a Fire elemental) plus extra damage equal to spell slot level.

items: The target's armour is reduced by 1 for 1 round.

trait.name: Amorphous Form (Air, Fire, and Water Only)
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The minor elemental explodes when it dies. It makes a reflex attack against each adjacent creature that deals 7 ({@dice 3d4}) bludgeoning damage (or fire damage for a Fire elemental).

trait.name: Insubstantial (Air and Fire Only)
entries: The minor elemental cannot be {@condition grappled|sns}, knocked {@condition prone|sns}, or {@condition restrained|sns}.

ac.special: 2 + half the level of the spell

action.name: Blinking Bite (Blink Dog Only)
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. 6 {@damage 1d6 + 3} piercing damage plus extra damage equal to spell slot level. Before or after the attack, the blink dog can teleport up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Ram (Satyr Only)
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. 8 {@damage 2d4 + 3} bludgeoning damage plus extra damage equal to spell slot level.

action.name: Shortbow (Sprite Only)
entries: {@atk rw} range 40/160 ft., one target. 5 piercing damage plus extra damage equal to spell slot level. If this attack scores a major success against a creature, the target is {@condition poisoned|sns} for 1 minute. On a critical success, the {@condition poisoned|sns} target falls {@condition unconscious|sns} for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

items: The target's armour is reduced by 1 for 1 round.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell (Blink Dog Only)
entries: The blink dog has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance (Satyr Only)
entries: Spell attacks against the satyr have disadvantage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. 26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage (or fire damage for a Fire elemental) plus extra damage equal to spell slot level.

items: The target's armour is reduced by 1 for 1 round.

trait.name: Amorphous Form (Air, Fire, and Water Only)
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Insubstantial (Air and Fire Only)
entries: The elemental cannot be {@condition grappled|sns}, knocked {@condition prone|sns}, or {@condition restrained|sns}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Baleful Curse (Hag Only)
entries: The hag selects one creature it can see. It makes a will attack against the creature with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target has disadvantage on ability checks for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is cursed for 1 minute or until it passes a passive save. While cursed, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and armour attack rolls. A {@spell remove curse|sns} spell ends the effect.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.
Once the hag has targeted a creature with Baleful Curse, it can't do so again for 1 minute.

action.name: Bloodletting Sickle (Redcap Only)
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or construct and the attack scores a major success, the target takes 5 ({@dice 2d4}) ongoing slashing damage due to a bleeding wound.

Each time the redcap hits the wounded target with this attack, the ongoing damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 ({@dice 2d4}). Any creature can take an action to staunch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Medicine check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Terrifying Howl (Hound Only)
entries: The hound makes a will attack against one creature that can hear it that deals {@dice 2d10} psychic damage. On a hit, the target is {@condition frightened|sns} until the end of the hound's next turn. If the attack fails to hit, the target can't be affected by Terrifying Howl again for 1 minute.

items: The target's armour is reduced by 1 for 1 round.

resist.note: from attacks not made with silvered weapons

action.name: Smite
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. 48 ({@damage 8d8 + 12}) radiant damage.

action.name: Lay on Hands (1/Day)
entries: A creature the celestial touches regains 19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) hit points. Alternatively, it can end one disease or neutralise on poison affecting the creature.

tags: angel of battle, angel of protection, or angel of vengeance

items: The target's armour is reduced by 1 for 1 round.

trait.name: Inescapable Strike (Angel of Vengeance Only)
entries: Before making an attack, the celestial can teleport 30 feet as part of the same action.

trait.name: Protection Strike (Angel of Protection Only)
entries: When the celestial attacks a creature, until the start of the celestial's next turn that creature has disadvantage on armour attack rolls against creatures other than the celestial.

trait.name: Radiant Strike (Angel of Battle Only)
entries: The celestial's smite can be used as a ranged weapon attack (range 150/600 ft.) in addition to as a melee weapon attack.

action.name: Thrash
entries: {@atk mw} reach 0 ft., all creatures in the swarm's space. 24 ({@damage 5d6 + 7}) slashing damage and the target is {@condiion grappled|sns}. Slashing damage dealt by this attack ignores resistances and immunities.

items: The target's armour is reduced by 1 for 1 round.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Non-armour attacks from spells and other magical effects have disadvantage against the swarm.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The swarm regains 11 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Large plant. The swarm can't regain hit points from spells or potions, and it cannot gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Titanic
entries: The swarm fills a 100-foot radius circle and ignores difficult terrain.

subclass.name: Sun Priest
subclassFeatures: Channel Divinity: Summon the Stars|Cleric|sns|Sun Priest|sns|9

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 1st level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 5th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 7th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 9th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 11th level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 13th level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 15th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 17th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 19th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 1st level you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Battle Ready
entries: You may activate up to 2 combat stances you know without expending any exertion points using the same bonus action. Once you activate a set of combat stances in this way you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Defence
entries: While you are wearing body armour, you gain a +1 bonus to your armour.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed trait for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: While mounted, you gain an expertise die on armour attack rolls against creatures that are Medium-sized or smaller and not mounted.

entries.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see makes an armour attack against a target other than you that is adjacent to you, if you are wielding a shield you can use your reaction to hinder the attack, forcing the creature to roll with disadvantage.

entries.name: Technical Fighting
entries: Whenever you use a combat maneuver any attacks it triggers have a +1 bonus to their attack rolls and deal 2 additional damage.

entries.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: Whenever you would make an attack using a weapon with the Thrown trait you may draw the weapon as part of the attack. In addition, your ranged weapon attacks with Thrown weapons deal an additional 2 damage.

entries.name: Tireless Fighting
entries: Whenever you expend hit dice to recover exertion points, you recover 3 exertion points per hit die expended (instead of 1d4 exertion points as normal).

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: You add your choice of either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage of weapons with the Offhand trait.

entries.name: Unarmed Fighting
entries: Your damage with brawling weapons is increased by 2. If you start your turn grappling a creature, you may deal bludgeoning DoT damage equal to your Strength modifier to any creature you are grappling.

classFeature.name: Combat Maneuvers
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to use {@filter combat maneuvers|spells|Subschool=Maneuver}. You gain proficiency in two combat traditions of your choice. You learn three maneuvers of your choice from traditions you are proficient with.

You gain an exertion pool equal to twice your proficiency bonus, regaining any spent exertion at the end of a short or long rest. You use your maneuvers by spending points from your exertion pool. The Maneuvers Known column of the Fighter table shows when you learn more maneuvers from a tradition you are proficient with, while the Maneuver Degree column shows the highest degree you can select maneuvers from at a given level.
Additionally, whenever you complete a long rest, you can choose one of the maneuvers you know and replace it with another maneuver of the same degree from a tradition you are proficient with.

classFeature.name: Soldiering Knacks
entries: Over the course of your training and adventures you have picked up a variety of skills and tricks to help you make your way. At 1st level you gain a {@filter soldiering knack|optionalfeatures|feature type=sk} of your choice. The Knacks Known column of the Fighter table shows when you learn more fighter soldering knacks.

classFeature.name: Steely Mien
entries: At 2nd level your combat experience becomes obvious on some subtle level, influencing how people perceive you, or perhaps how you see them. Choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Closed Helm
entries: You have great control over your emotions; your face is an unmoving mask, revealing nothing of what you're thinking. Creatures have disadvantage on Insight checks made against you. This grants you advantage with the Gossip journey activity when using Deception, but disadvantage with the Pray journey activity when using Persuasion. In addition, you subtract {@dice 1d4} from the attack rolls of attacks that can {@condition charmed|sns|charm} or {@condition frightened|sns|frighten} you.

entries.name: Heroic Flair
entries: Your victories have emboldened you and you radiate with heroic confidence. You have advantage on Persuasion checks made to influence friendly creatures with a CR lower than your level. This does not affect the Pray journey activity.

entries.name: Watchful Eye
entries: You are enternally alert and wary, ready for trouble. You have advantage on Insight checks made to determine hostile intent or predict violence (which does not affect the Gossip journey activity), and gain an expertise die in Perception.

classFeature.name: Maneuver Specialisation (1)
entries: As you experience combat and perfect your techniques they get easier for you to perform and more difficult for your foes to overcome. At 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level you may choose to master a combat maneuver you know. You cannot master the same maneuver more than once in this way.
The exertion point cost of mastered maneuvers is reduced by 1 (minimum 1).
You gain a +1 bonus to the attack rolls of mastered maneuvers.
Any attack you make as part of a mastered maneuver (including triggering attacks) deals 2 additional damage.

classFeature.name: Maneuver Specialisation (2)
entries: At 7th level you may choose to master another combat maneuver you know, as per your Maneuver Specialisation feature.

classFeature.name: Maneuver Specialisation (3)
entries: At 11th level you may choose to master another combat maneuver you know, as per your Maneuver Specialisation feature.

classFeature.name: Maneuver Specialisation (4)
entries: At 15th level you may choose to master another combat maneuver you know, as per your Maneuver Specialisation feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Additionally, you gain a feat.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Reserves (1)
entries: At 4th level your stamina increases, allowing you to engage foes longer without tiring. Your exertion pool increases by 1. At 8th, 12th, and 16th level your exertion pool increases by an additional point.

classFeature.name: Reserves (2)
entries: At 8th level your exertion pool further increases by 1.

classFeature.name: Reserves (3)
entries: At 12th level your exertion pool further increases by 1.

classFeature.name: Reserves (4)
entries: At 16th level your exertion pool further increases by 1.

classFeature.name: Empowered Attack (1)
entries: From 5th level, when you use the Attack action, your main hand weapon's base damage is doubled. For example, a weapon with a damage of {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier deals {@dice 2d6} + double your Strength modifier instead.

classFeature.name: Empowered Attack (2)
entries: From 11th level, when you use the Attack action, your main hand weapon's base damage is tripled. For example, a weapon with a damage of {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier deals {@dice 3d6} + triple your Strength modifier instead.

classFeature.name: Martial Lore
entries: At 6th level, your knowledge of martial lore deepens. Choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Military Traditions
entries: You've familiarised yourself with wars long past and military protocols of the present. You gain an expertise die on Intelligence checks made to recall lore or gather information regarding warfare or military action. In addition, you gain an expertise die on Charisma checks made to influence soldiers, guards, or other organised martial forces. This does not affect any journey activities.

entries.name: Size Up
entries: Your combat experience against a wide variety of foes has given you a good eye for evaluating threats. You can use a bonus action to determine the CR of a creature you can see within 200 feet, and that creature's standard DC.

entries.name: Weapon Lore
entries: You gain an expertise die on Intelligence checks made to recall lore or gather information about weapons, armour, and other martial equipment. This does not affect any journey activities.
