In addition, you can use an action to investigate the magical properties of such an item by handling it, such as swinging a sword or hefting a shield. You learn its properties, how to use them, whether it requires attunement, and how many charges it has. You also learn if the item has any sentience or bears a curse, though you only learn if it is sentient or cursed (not the nature of that sentience or curse).

classFeature.name: Indomitable (1)
entries: At 9th level, you can draw upon your indomitable will to overcome pain, resist overwhelming forces, or retaliate when most warriors would be shirking back. You can use this feature and your reaction to perform any of the following:

items: Force a non-armour attack against you to be rerolled. If you do so, you must use the new roll.
Reduce the damage you would take from a single instance by {@dice 2d8} + your level.
Make a single weapon attack against a creature that has just completed an attack against you.

entries: You gain an additional use of this feature at 13th level and a third use starting at 17th level. You regain all spent uses of this feature whenever you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Indomitable (2)
entries: At 13th level, you gain an additional use of your Indomitable feature.

classFeature.name: Indomitable (3)
entries: At 17th level, you gain an additional use of your Indomitable feature.

classFeature.name: Reputation
entries: At 10th level, your reputation has begun to precede you. Choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Inspiring
entries: You're a reputed leader, a person to be trusted whose words are to be heeded. You gain an expertise die on Persuasion checks. In addition, you may spend 1 exertion point as a bonus action to inspire a creature that can hear you. The creature makes an Insight check opposed by your Persuasion check, becoming inspired by you on a failure. Indifferent creatures you inspire this way become friendly towards you and your allies, and friendly creatures you inspire in this way will consider you an ally and may provide you with local information that would otherwise remain secret. Creatures will remain inspired by you indefinitely unless you do something that would make them hostile or lose confidence in you, such as lying, stealing, or causing them or their allies harm, or being proven cowardly or untrustworthy in any way.

entries.name: Intimidating
entries: You're reputed to be a terror to your foes and a fearsome ally. You gain an expertise die on Intimidation checks. In addition, you can use a bonus action and spend 1 expertion point to intimidate one creature you can see. Make a will attack against the creature with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition sluggish|sns} when moving towards you for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is {@condition frightened|sns} for 1 minute, or until it succeeds on a passive save.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also {@condition debilitated|sns}.

entries.name: Legendary
entries: Your deeds have become epic stories, growing bigger and more outlandish with each retelling. You gain an expertise die on Deception checks. In addition, you can spend 1 exertion point to weave your real legendary deeds into a Persuasion check as boasting, or include fabricated legendary deeds into a Deception check. When you do so, you have advantage on the check. This affects your journey activity checks.

classFeature.name: War's Toll
entries: At 14th level, your experiences have left their impressions on you. All the lives ended - both friends and foes - inevitably weighs down on a person, and each must find their own way to cope and pay the toll of war. Choose one of the following.

entries.name: Battle Scarred
entries: You've embraced every victory and loss, and you wear each battle scar like a badge of honour. Whenever you are reduced to 0 hit points you gain a new permanent scar or mark, and you gain Inspiration. Once you gain Inspiration in this way you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Carouser
entries: You cope through drink and revelry, and have mastered both. You can gain the benefits of a long rest by spending 4 hours drinking, carousing, and taking the occasional blackout nap. You can carouse in this way so long as you consume at least 4 pints worth of ale (or equivalent drink), and you are alert and aware of your surroundings while doing so. If you carouse with another creature in this way, you can attempt to learn secrets from it by drinking it under the table. Each hour you spend carousing with a willing creature, make an opposed {@dice d20} roll, adding your fortitudes. On a success, that creature answers a question truthfully (even questions it would not normally answer).
In addition, you can enjoy alcohol as normal but can't gain the {@condition poisoned|sns} condition from it.
This feature has no effect on creatures that are immune to the {@condition poisoned|sns} condition.

entries.name: One Eye Open
entries: Your life has been so regularly in danger that you've learned to literally sleep with one eye open. You are alert and aware of your surroundings while sleeping during long rests. You can also never be surprised and you gain an expertise die on initiative rolls.

classFeature.name: Martial Legacy
entries: At 18th level, your mastered maneuvers have become as natural as breathing, and you have the opportunity to pass your techniques down to the next generation. By spending 8 hours sparring, you can teach another willing creature a maneuver you have mastered using Maneuver Specialisation. A creature must be proficient in at least one combat tradition to learn a maneuver this way, it can only learn maneuvers of a degree from which it already knows at least one maneuver, and this counts against its number of maneuvers known.

classFeature.name: Warmaster
entries: At 20th level, you have become an undisputed master of battle. You gain the following features.

entries.name: Master of Combat
entries: You master every maneuver you know and any future maneuvers you learn as per Maneuver Specialisation. Additionally, choose one manveuver of 3rd degree or less that you know. You are able to use the chosen maneuver without expending any exertion points.

entries.name: Finishing Blow
entries: You can make spectacular, devastating attacks which inspire awe in those nearby. When you fail to hit with a weapon attack while taking the Attack action, you can choose to score a standard success instead. Alternatively, you can choose to change a standard or major success with a weapon attack into a critical success, or when you score a critical success you can choose to double your critical damage bonus.
If the Finishing Blow's original outcome was a major success, all hostile creatures who see the Finishing Blow become {@condition frightened|sns} for 1 minute.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 1st level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 5th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 7th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 9th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 11th level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 13th level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 15th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 17th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 19th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Pact Magic
entries: With care, practice, and dedication you have learned how to best siphon and channel the otherworldly powers you've gained from your patron.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the warlock spell list. You learn additional warlock cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Warlock table.

entries.name: Spell Points
entries: The Warlock table shows how many spell points you have. To cast one of your warlock spells of 1st-level or higher, you must spend a number of spell points dependent on the spell's level, shown on the table below. You can also cast a spell you know at a higher spell level by spending the appropriate number of spell points. The maximum spell level you can cast is shown in the Spell Level column of the Warlock table. You regain all expended spell points when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the warlock spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Warlock table shows when you learn more warlock spells of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 6th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, whenever you complete a long rest, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: The manner in which you pursue ever greater power from your patron is defined by the nature of that pursuit: through wit, devotion, or fervor. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma to be your spellcasting ability. Once you make this choice, you cannot change it. You use the chosen ability whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item arcane focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

classFeature.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: At 1st level you learn to use your patron's power as a weapon, blasting enemies with an eldritch force that defies even the laws of magic. Choose one of the following features.

entries.name: Eldritch Disturbance
entries: You can use an action to strike a creature within 60 feet with a reality-distorting curse, blending pain both mental and physical. Make a ranged spell will attack against the creature that deals {@dice 1d12} force damage.

entries.name: Eldritch Ray
entries: You can use an action to create a deadly beam that strikes a creature within 120 feet. Make a ranged spell armour attack against the creature that deals {@dice 1d10} force damage.

entries.name: Eldritch Scythe
entries: Once per turn when you would make a melee weapon attack as part of the Attack action or an opportunity attack, you can instead make a melee spell armour attack, lashing out with an ephemeral and unearthly blade. It deals {@dice 1d8} force damage. In addition, on a hit, you can choose a creature that you can see and that is within your reach. It takes half as much damage as force DoT damage.

entries.name: Eldritch Whip
entries: You can use an action to thrash a creature with a scintillating tendril of arcane force. Make a melee spell armour attack against a creature within 15 feet that deals {@dice 1d6} force damage.

At the end of your turn you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to half the damage you dealt with Eldritch Whip this turn (minimum 1), which last until the end of your next turn. When you damage a creature with your Eldritch Whip and you already have temporary hit points, you can end the temporary hit points early to gain a bonus to the Eldritch Whip's damage equal to half the number of temporary hit points you ended early.

classFeature.name: Expanded Spell List (First)
entries: At 1st level, if your first subclass does not provide you with an expanded spell list, you choose an expanded spell list from below that your patron grants you access to. Choose one patron expanded spell list. These spells count as warlock spells for you.

entries.caption: Darkness Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|sns}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|sns}

entries.caption: Fire Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|sns}, {@spell Fog Cloud|sns} (appears as smoke)

entries.caption: Genius Loci Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Meld Into Stone|sns}, {@spell Speak with Dead|sns}

classFeature.name: Expanded Spell List (Second)
entries: At 11th level, if your second subclass does not provide you with an expanded spell list, you choose an expanded spell list from below that your patron grants you access to. Choose one patron expanded spell list. These spells count as warlock spells for you.
You cannot choose the same expanded spell list that you may have chosen for your first expanded spell list.

entries.caption: Darkness Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|sns}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|sns}

entries.caption: Fire Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|sns}, {@spell Fog Cloud|sns} (appears as smoke)

entries.caption: Genius Loci Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Meld Into Stone|sns}, {@spell Speak with Dead|sns}

classFeature.name: Eldritch Invocations
entries: The gifts of your patron are manyfold — not only can you channel their magic to work spells, but you can also siphon away talents, tricks, and reality-defying essence to perform other impressive magical feats.

At 2nd level, you gain an eldritch invocation of your choice. Your invocation options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=EI} page. When you gain certain warlock levels, you gain additional invocations of your choice, as shown in the Invocations Known column of the Warlock table. Additionally, when you complete a long rest, you can choose one of the invocations you know and replace it with another invocation that you could learn at your level. If you should gain a bonus invocation, they do not count against your Invocations known.
When you are able to learn a new invocation in this way, you may instead choose to learn a {@filter secret of arcana|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=SA}.

classFeature.name: Secrets of Arcana
entries: Also at 2nd level, you realize that there is power to be taken that your patron may never have meant for you to have. You gain a secret of arcana of your choice. Your secret options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=SA} page. The Secrets Known column of the Warlock table shows when you learn more secrets of arcana.

classFeature.name: Pact Boon
entries: At 3rd level, the entity to which you are beholden provides a more durable and lasting blessing. Choose one of the following features.

entries.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: You can use your action to conjure in your empty hand an armament bestowed with power: a pact weapon. Choose any simple or martial weapon when you conjure your pact weapon. You are proficient with it while you wield your pact weapon, and you can use your spellcasting ability as its governing ability. This weapon ignores resistance and immunity to its base damage type. Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

By performing a 1 hour ritual while holding a weapon, you can transform it into your pact weapon. Any affixes on this weapon that empower the weapon are also applied to your Eldritch Blast (ranged weapons apply these effects to Eldritch Ray, and melee weapons to Eldritch Scythe; it has no effect on Eldritch Disturbance or Eldritch Whip). You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can't affect a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1 hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon is collected by your patron if the bond breaks while it is in the extradimensional space.

entries.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: You learn the {@spell find familiar|sns} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known. When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite}. You can also opt for the spirit you call forth to be an aberration, elemental, or undead.

When you take the Attack action, you can forgo making an attack to allow your familiar to make one attack of its own with its reaction. Additionally, when you use Eldritch Scythe, you can choose to deliver the attack through your familiar as though you had cast a spell with a range of touch.

entries.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Aware of your drive for knowledge, you awaken to find a grimoire left in your pack by your patron: a Book of Shadows. Choose three cantrips. While the book is in your possession, you know these cantrips and they are treated as warlock spells. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1 hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony destroys the previous book. The book is collected by your patron when you die.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Additionally, you gain a feat.

classFeature.name: Invocation of the Courts (1)
entries: Also at 4th level, you gain a bonus invocation — one to help you traffic in courts both otherworldly and mortal. Choose one invocation from the following list: Beguiling Influence, Courts of the Outer Realms, Eyes of the Runekeeper, Gaze of Two Minds, Mask of Many Faces, Ominous Tormentor, Psionic Secrecy, Spellbinding Contract, Voice of the Chain Master, Whispers of the Grave.

You gain another bonus invocation in this way at 10th level and again at 16th level. Whenever you complete a long rest, you can choose one of the bonus invocations you know and replace it with another bonus invocation from this list that you could learn at that level.

classFeature.name: Empowered Blast
entries: Beginning at 5th level, your Eldritch Blast becomes more vicious.
Your Eldritch Blast gains an additional die of damage at 5th level, and again at 11th level and 17th level (to a maximum of 4 damage dice).
This feature otherwise counts as Empowered Attack (for the purpose of qualifying for feats, spell effects, and the like).

classFeature.name: Eldritch Evolution (1)
entries: At 6th level, you gain a bonus invocation — one which represents your growth in the lethal lore behind Eldritch Blast. Choose one invocation from the following list: Agonizing Blast, Eldritch Bind, Eldritch Elementalism, Eldritch Grasp, Eldritch Prism, Eldritch Riposte, Eldritch Severance, Eldritch Spear, Eldritch Squall, Eldritch Tentacle, Repelling Blast, Versatile Blast.

You gain another bonus invocation in this way at 14th level and again at 18th level. Whenever you complete a long rest, you can choose one of the bonus invocations you know and replace it with another bonus invocation from this list that you could learn at that level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Invocation of the Courts (2)
entries: At 10th level, you gain another bonus invocation from your Invocation of the Courts feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Eldritch Evolution (2)
entries: At 14th level, you gain another bonus invocation from your Eldritch Evolution feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Invocation of the Courts (3)
entries: At 16th level, you gain another bonus invocation from your Invocation of the Courts feature.

classFeature.name: Eldritch Evolution (3)
entries: At 18th level, you gain another bonus invocation from your Eldritch Evolution feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Dread Thaumaturge
entries: At 20th level, you have learned all you can from your patron. You gain the following abilities.

entries.name: Aura of Anathema
entries: Hostile creatures within 120 feet gain vulnerability to necrotic damage. A creature with resistance to necrotic damage instead loses its resistance, and a creature immune to necrotic damage instead replaces that immunity with 50% resistance.
Whenever you finish a long rest, you can choose a different damage type for your aura.

entries.name: Highest Arcanum
entries: You learn an ultimate exploit in the laws of magic. Choose one of the following:

items: You can cast {@spell plane shift|sns} without material components once between short rests.
You are under the constant effects of the {@spell foresight|sns} spell. This effect cannot be detected or dispelled by any means short of a {@spell wish|sns} spell.
Once per long rest, you can spend 1 minute in arcane contemplation to regain your spent spell points.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 1st level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your first subclass.

entries.name: Subclass Spells
entries: With your subclass you gain access to a list of subclass spells at the levels noted in your subclass description. Once you gain a subclass spell it is always prepared and doesn't count against the spells you can prepare each day.
If you gain a subclass spell that is not on the cleric spell list, it is considered cleric spell for you.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 5th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 7th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 9th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 11th level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 13th level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 15th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 17th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 19th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Defensive Blessing
entries: Starting at 1st level, the high powers which guide you bestow a modicum of protection for your journey. Choose one of the following options.

entries.name: Armour of Conviction
entries: While you are not wearing any body armour or wielding a shield, your armour is equal to half your Wisdom modifier.
Also, in addition to the spells you normally prepare, you always have {@spell shield of faith|sns} prepared.

entries.name: Sacred Archery
entries: You gain proficiency with light armour, medium armour, and ranged martial weapons.

entries.name: Spirit Soldier
entries: You gain proficiency with light armour, medium armour, and shields.

classFeature.name: Sacred Call
entries: Also at 1st level, your clerical vocation anoints you with certain graces for spreading your message to the people. Choose one of the following.

entries.name: Clerical Charisma
entries: Crowds find your public presence irresistable. You gain proficiency in the Performance skill. Whenever you use Performance to deliver a sermon or to sing holy songs in a town or city, even on a failed check other than a natural 1, you still attract a crowd of people no smaller than your standard DC.

entries.name: Ordination
entries: Your mission in the world is supported by the spiritual community or religious hierarchy who called you to religious service. As a formal leader within your religious order, you are expected to perform the ceremonies of your faith, including weddings and funerals. In exchange, members of your faith provide you and your companions with food, lodging, and a modest lifestyle. This also improves their default attitude towards you to friendly.

Additionally, if your congregation or order is able, they send you letters with regular updates about their well-being. They are willing to help connect you with other chapters of your faith through letters of introduction.

entries.name: Zeal of the Convert
entries: You enthusiastically see the hand of a greater entity everywhere. You gain advantage on Persuasion checks when you invoke the name of your deity or movement during a conversation with a pious person. If the listener is negatively disposed to your greater entity or movement, you have disadvantage instead. This balances out to not affect your journey activity checks.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a conduit for divine power, you can cast cleric spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|PHB|11} for a selection of {@filter cleric spells|spells|class=cleric}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the cleric spell list. You learn additional cleric cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Cleric table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Cleric table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter cleric spells|spells|class=cleric} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of cleric spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the cleric spell list. When you do so, choose a number of cleric spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your cleric level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level cleric, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds|sns}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of cleric spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells. The power of your spells comes from your devotion to your deity. You use your Wisdom whenever a cleric spell refers to your spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item holy symbol|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your cleric spells.

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity (1/rest)
entries: At 2nd level, you are able to channel the energy of your greater entity directly, and use it for a variety of magical effects. You start with one of these effects, Turn Undead, and can gain additional effects from your Cleric Subclasses. Some subclasses provide additional uses of Channel Divinity as your cleric level increases, detailed under the heading of your chosen archetypes.
You may choose which Channel Divinity effect to create each time you use this feature. You must then finish a short or long rest before you're able to Channel Divinity again.
From 6th level you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests, and beginning at 18th level you can use it three times between rests. Finishing a short or long rest regains your expended uses.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead
entries: As an action, you present the holy symbol of your greater entity and speak a divine word, rebuking the undead. Make a will attack against each undead creature within 30 feet of you that can sense you, with the following outcomes:. If the creature fails it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage from any source.

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition sluggish|sns} when moving towards you for 1 round.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target is turned for 1 minute, or until it takes damage from any source. If this effect ends from damage and the target spent at least one of its own turns turned, it immediately takes a turn. This does not affect initiative order.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the target is also vulnerable to all damage while turned.

A turned creature must use its turns trying to move as far away from you as possible. It cannot willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you by moving towards you. It also cannot take reactions. On its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape any effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity (2/rest)
entries: From 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests.

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity (3/rest)
entries: From 18th level, you can use your Channel Divinity thrice between rests.

classFeature.name: Principles of Devotion
entries: At 2nd level, after much contemplation and communication with your greater entity, you pledge to uphold certain standards of behaviour beyond what is necessary for adventure. In return, your greater entity grants you one of the following related boons. When you fail to uphold this pledge, you lose any benefits from it until 24 hours after you finish a long rest and rededicate yourself.

entries.name: Chaste
entries: In exchange for forgoing pleasures of the heart and flesh, you are hardened to the persuasions of others. Subtract your Wisdom modifier from any attack rolls made against you that can {@condition charmed|sns|charm}. You also gain an expertise die in your choice of Insight, Persuasion, or Religion checks.

entries.name: Destitute
entries: In exchange for forgoing material luxury, vendors who are not explicitly opposed to your greater entity are compelled to give you heavy discounts of up to 20%, and inkeeps offer free lodging.

entries.name: Devotional Integrity
entries: You adhere to a strict code of morality and ethics. When an action you take is honest and non-violent, until the end of your turn you are immune to the {@condition rattled|sns} condition and you do not suffer disadvantage or penalties on Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma checks made as part of that action.

entries.name: Image of the Divine
entries: You exhibit a uniform, makeup, tattoo, or body modification indicating your higher entity or religious order. Creatures have advantage when discerning your religious identity. Attacks that can {@condition frightened|sns|frighten} and Intimidation checks made against you have disadvantage. You also gain an expertise die in your choice of Insight, Intimidation, or Persuasion checks.

entries.name: Merciful
entries: In exchange for forgoing bloodshed - torture, attacking {@condition unconscious|sns} creatures, and intentionally dealing lethal wounds to creatures you reduce to 0 hit points - you are yourself granted mercy. While you have at least two failed death saves, you have advantage on death saves.

entries.name: Rule of Ritual
entries: You make formal religious observances and perform ritual timekeeping. You can spend 1 hour during a long rest to make these observances, and if you do you only need 4 hours of sleep instead of the normal 6. You learn the {@spell guidance|sns} cantrip if you do not already know it, and when you grant expertise dice with a levelled spell, the expertise die you grant increases by one step.

entries.name: Secrecy
entries: Your mission from your deity requires you to work undercover, concealing your true self with a secret identity. In exchange for forgoing the pleasure of true connection and friendship, you gain an expertise die on Deception checks.

entries.name: Severity
entries: In exchange for forgoing weakness such as helping or protecting others (except when it serves you), you add your Wisdom modifier to Perception checks made to find valuable objects, and on opposed checks made against the Persuasion check of another creature. This benefits your Insight journey activity checks, but no others.

entries.name: Silence
entries: In exchange for speaking only to cast spells, you are able to compel other creatures to action with only a glance. Your Persuasion bonus is not factored into your party's Group Persuasion bonus, but the Group Persuasion bonus is increased by your Wisdom modifier.

classFeature.name: Signs of Faith
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a {@filter sign of faith|optionalfeatures|feature type=sf} of your choice. The Signs Known column of the Cleric table shows when you gain new signs.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Additionally, you gain a feat.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Sacred Office
entries: Also at 4th level, your mission has taken root and is known through much of the land, conveying rumours both good and ill about your deeds. Choose one of the following.

entries.name: Auspicious Collaborator
entries: The higher powers you are attuned to have witnessed your deeds and bestowed upon you a quality of worthiness. Your requests for aid are perceived as opportunities for partnership rather than impositions.

People of all backgrounds are more drawn to help you than they would ordinarily be. You gain an expertise die in Persuasion, and an additional expertise die on Persuasion checks related to seeking aid. The Pray journey activity counts as seeking aid.

entries.name: Divine Authority
entries: Your connection to religious hierarchy opens many doors. Sermons you give and courtesy calls you make to different religious groups put you in contact with a local representative of your faith, who is happy to strongly recommend you to another local leader. You gain an expertise die in your choice of Insight or Persuasion. In addition, you gain an expertise die on Insight and Persuasion checks made against local leaders to whom you are recommended that would otherwise be indifferent towards you.

entries.name: Engaging Proclaimer
entries: Your recitations of divine stories, songs, or chants quickly build and hold an audience's attention, whether you are speaking to a packed tavern or a smaller gathering. You gain an expertise die on Performance checks to gather and hold the attention of 2 or more people. This counts for Busk and Entertain journey activity checks. In addition, you gain an expertise die in your choice of Perfomance or Religion checks.

entries.name: Reputation
entries: Your reputation for talented ministry and good work precedes you. Common folk frequently recognise you on sight, and those who do often have a friendly disposition towards you. They often ask you for counsel, favours, and blessings. The disposition of people they introduce you to are one stage better than normal (the indifferent become friendly, the hostile become indifferent).

entries.name: Symbol of Might
entries: The strength of the powers you serve is obvious to anybody you interact with, and you are able to use it to garner a certain level of fear and compliance. You gain an expertise die in Intimidation, and you gain an additional expertise die on Intimidation checks made to convince others to comply with your demands. This counts for Rob journey activity checks. The people you intimidate are no longer friendly towards you, if they were previously.

classFeature.name: Empowered Turning (1)
entries: At 5th level your greater entity grants you improved ways to turn undead or other abhorrent beings. You gain this feature again at 8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th level. Each time you gain Empowered Turning, choose one of the following:

entries.name: Command Undead
entries: If you choose, creatures you turn instead regard you as their master for the duration. While they are under this effect, you may use your action to issue simple commands (no more than a sentence or two) which they are compelled to obey. They will not take any action that is obviously harmful to them, and so will not leap from a great height, jump onto a sword, or purposefully self-inflict any damage. They follow the command until you issue a new one. During combat, this simply counts as the target being {@condition dominated|sns}.

entries.name: Destroy Undead
entries: Creatures turned by you of CR 1/2 or less are immediately destroyed, transformed into dust by a blinding flash of light. You can select this option multilpe times. Each time you choose it, you are able to destroy more powerful creatures, progressing to CR 1, CR 2, CR 3, and then CR 4 each subsequent time you select this option.

entries.name: Turn Ideology
entries: Choose one of the following: Chaotic, Evil, Good, or Lawful. When you use Turn Undead, you can also choose to affect creatures with the chosen alignment trait. You can select this option multiple times.

entries.name: Turn Supernatural
entries: Choose a creature type from celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend. When you use Turn Undead, you can also choose to affect creatures of that type. You can select this option multiple times.

classFeature.name: Empowered Turning (2)
entries: At 8th level, you gain another choice from your Empowered Turning options.

classFeature.name: Empowered Turning (3)
entries: At 11th level, you gain another choice from your Empowered Turning options.

classFeature.name: Empowered Turning (4)
entries: At 14th level, you gain another choice from your Empowered Turning options.

classFeature.name: Empowered Turning (5)
entries: At 17th level, you gain another choice from your Empowered Turning options.

classFeature.name: Sacred Presence
entries: At 9th level, you bring the true presence of your ideals wherever you go. Choose one of the following.

entries.name: Cosmic Idealist
entries: Your moral compass aligns with the transcendent forces of the multiverse. Choose Chaotic, Evil, Good, Lawful, or one of the following: Chaotic and Evil, Chaotic and Good, Lawful and Evil, or Lawful and Good. You gain the chosen alignment trait or alignment traits, though you do not need to act upon them. You can identify creatures that have the same alignment traits as you, and you have advantage when making Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma checks against them.
Additionally, you do not suffer negative effects from being on a plane with which you share an alignment trait.

entries.name: Eyes of the Heart
entries: You have a way of really seeing folk's inner character. When you succeed on a contested Insight check, if the opposing creature's Charisma score is equal to or less than your standard DC, for the next 24 hours you do not need to make any further checks to recognise whenever that creature is lying, telling the truth, or excluding information.

entries.name: Spiritual Salve
entries: Your spiritual mindset has given you unique insights that can help you and your companions endure hardships. Your constant encouragements and proverbs allow allies within 30 feet of you to reroll a fortitude attack against them. If they do so, they must use the new roll. Once a creature has used your Spiritual Salve to make a reroll, it cannot do so again until it has finished a long rest.

classFeature.name: Providence
entries: At 10th level, the potency of your faith increases. Choose one of the following.

entries.name: Divine Intervention
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can use an action to call on your deity to intervene on your behalf when your need is great. Describe the assistance you seek and roll percentile dice. If you roll a number equal to or lower than your level, your deity intervenes. The DM chooses the nature of the intervention; the effect of any spell would be appopriate. If your deity intervenes, you can't use this feature again for 7 days. Otherwise, you can use it again after you finish a long rest.
After each failed divine intervention roll, add 1 to the number required to succeed until it is a success, at which point it resets to your cleric level or below.
At 20th level, your call for intervention succeeds automatically, no roll required.

entries.name: Imminent Turning
entries: A powerful connection to the life force of your greater entity extends the range of your Turn Undead. You may now Turn Undead from up to 60 feet away.

entries.name: Master Ritualist
entries: Careful study of your holy texts has made you intimiately familiar with all of your ritual spells. You may cast any ritual spell in the cleric spell list as a ritual, whether or not you have it prepared.

entries.name: Prayer of Protection
entries: After each long rest choose one damage type from the following list: cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, psychic, radiant, or thunder. You gain 50% resistance to this damage type until the end of your next long rest.

classFeature.name: Avatar of Faith
entries: At 20th level, your secret inner divinity is finally revealed. You can use your Channel Divinity to become a conduit of the divine, flooding the world around you with the unfettered power of the Moral Planes. Once you have used either of these options, you cannot use that option again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Channel Negative Energy
entries: You can use an action to evoke baleful energy from the Lower Planes to harm creatures. You choose the creatures. Make a will attack against each creature that deals {@dice 5d12} force damage and {@dice 5d12} necrotic damage.

When you use this feature, you also choose one of the following conditions: {@condition blinded|sns}, {@condition confused|sns}, {@condition deafened|sns}, {@condition frightened|sns}, {@condition poisoned|sns}, {@condition rattled|sns}, or {@condition slowed|sns}. A creature hit by the attack also gains the chosen condition until it passes a passive save.
In addition, you can choose any number of creatures that have the Evil alignment trait. Each regains {@dice 5d10} hit points.

entries.name: Channel Positive Energy
entries: You can use an action to evoke energy from the Upper Planes to heal creatures you are able to see. You choose the creatures and divide 225 hit points of healing among them.

A creature that regains hit points from this feature is also healed of one level of {@condition fatigue|sns} and one level of {@condition strife|sns}, and if it is {@condition blinded|sns}, {@condition charmed|sns}, {@condition confused|sns}, {@condition deafened|sns}, {@condition doomed|sns}, {@condition frightened|sns}, {@condition staggered|sns}, {@condition poisoned|sns}, {@condition rattled|sns}, {@condition slowed|sns}, or {@condition debilitated|sns} those conditions end on it. This feature cannot be used on undead or constructs.

classFeature.name: Adroit Defence
entries: From 1st level, you constantly analyse combat situations to improve your defensive posture, proactively interfering to guide attacks away from yourself. While you are wearing unarmoured body armour, your armour is increased by half your Intelligence modifier. You cannot use a shield and still gain this benefit.
The savant is not proficient in armour by default, but might gain those proficiencies through other means. When you are wearing armoured body armour, your armour is increased by 1.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 1st level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 5th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 7th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 9th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your first subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 11th level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 13th level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 15th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 17th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 19th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your second subclass.

classFeature.name: Clever Schemes
entries: At 1st level, you learn one {@filter clever scheme|optionalfeatures|feature type=cs} of your choice. The Schemes Known column of the Savant table shows when you learn more clever schemes.

classFeature.name: Savant Tricks
entries: At 1st level, you have developed a small number of clever gambits, deft maneuvers, and canny guards which help you prevail in battle by using your wits. The number of tricks you know is listed on the Savant table, and you can choose from the list below and from the list of tricks your subclass may make available.

To use a trick, you must first prepare it by spending a bonus action. You cannot prepare a trick outside of an encounter, but once a trick is prepared, it remains prepared until you use it, until the encounter ends, or until you spend a bonus action to replace it with a different trick. You can only have on trick prepared at a time.
Different tricks can be used at different times. Some require your action, bonus action, or reaction. Others might be used when making attacks.
Whenever you finish a long rest, you can choose to replace any number of tricks you know with different tricks.

entries.name: Types of Tricks
entries: Some tricks are called Aegises, which let you use your reaction to defend against some sort of attack. Other tricks are called Flourishes, which you can use when you make attacks.

If a trick offers a save, after you use it against a particular creature, that creature has advantage on saves against other uses of that same trick until the end of combat. If the trick doesn't permit a save, after you use it against a particular creature, you cannot use the same trick against that creature for the rest of the combat.

items.name: Attention Diverting Aegis
entries: When a creature within 30 feet that can sense you makes an armour attack that isn't targeting you, you can use this trick to try to distract the attacker. If it fails a save, until your next turn it has disadvantage on all armour attack rolls it makes that aren't against you.

items.name: Canny Dodge Aegis
entries: When an armour or reflex attack would hit you, you can use your reaction to reduce the attack's success tier by 1.

items.name: Committee Defence Aegis
entries: When a creature makes an armour attack against you, if it is not the first creature to attack you since the start of your last turn, you find an avenue of opportunity amid the massed assault. You can use this trick to impose disadvantage on that creature's attack. Then, you gain advantage on the next attack roll you make before the end of your next turn that targets a creature that attacked you this round.

items.name: Improvised Bastion Aegis
entries: When a creature would damage you, you can use this trick to devise a momentary defence (using a chair as a shield, predicting a safe spot in an explosion, diluting a spray of acid with a solvent, etc.). You gain 50% resistance to one type of damage you would take, which protects you only against the triggering damage.

items.name: Mindful Reason Aegis
entries: When you would be hit by a reflex or will attack, you can use this trick to reduce the attack's success tier by 1.

items.name: Serpentine Rush Aegis
entries: When you are targeted by a ranged armour attack, you can use this trick to move your speed. Until the end of your next turn, ranged weapon attacks against you have disadvantage. Additionally, your movement might get you to a locaiton where cover makes you hard or impossible to hit. Reduce your speed on your next turn by the distance that you move when using this trick.

items.name: Tangled Dance Aegis
entries: When you would be hit with an armour attack and a creature other than the attacker is adjacent to you, you can use this trick to try to dodge so the attack hits that creature. If the attacker fails a save, change the attack's target to another creature within 5 feet, and the attacker uses the same result of its attack roll.

items.name: Undermining Taunt Aegis
entries: When a creature fails to hit with an attack, you can use this trick to capitalise on their failure, warning the creature why another possible course of action will also turn out badly. If that creature can understand you, choose an action, such as Attack or Cast a Spell. The trget must make a save. If it fails, until the end of its next turn it is {@condition debilitated|sns} while attempting to take that action.

items.name: Antagonising Flourish
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can try to draw its ire. If it fails a save, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Disarming Flourish
entries: WHen you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to disarm it. If it fails a save, its grip is loosened, and the creature cannot make use of the item until it spends a bonus action on its turn to regain a solid hold. If the creature has disadvantage on the save and fails both rolls, it drops the item.

items.name: Experimental Flourish
entries: Whenever you fail to hit with an armour attack, you improvise a follow-up that doesn't directly attack a foe, such as slicing a rope to pin an enemy with a chandelier or smashing a pipe to spray blinding steam on an enemy. Circumstances will dictate what the effect is, but some examples include shoving or imposing the {@condition blinded|sns}, {@condition deafened|sns}, {@condition grappled|sns}, or {@condition prone|sns} condition, and may also deal environmental damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. Any conditions imposed should seldom last more than one round. Creatures affected can make a save to anticipate your trick and avoid the effect.

items.name: Guiding Flourish
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can try to trick it into moving. If it fails a save, it shifts up to 10 feet in a direction of your choice. If this movement would cause it to take damage (such as by falling or entering fire), the creature has advantage on this save.

items.name: Menacing Flourish
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend a bonus action to activate this trick and deliver a terrifying threat. The target makes a save. If it fails, for the next minute it is {@condition frightened|sns} of you.

items.name: Surgical Flourish
entries: When you have advantage on a melee weapon attack and both die results are high enough to hit, choose one of the creature's limbs or eyes to disable. If the creature succeeds a save, you disable that body part only until the end of your next turn. If it fails the save, the body part is disabled until it can take a short rest.

A creature is {@condition debilitated|sns} when attempting to use a disabled limb to attack, and gains no armour benefit from a shield held by a disabled limb. A creature with a disabled leg has its speed reduced by half, it falls {@condition prone|sns} after using the Dash action, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity checks to balance. A creature with a disabled eye has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and on ranged weapon attack rolls.

items.name: Assess Vulnerability
entries: When you make an armour attack against a creature, you can use your Intelligence modifier in place of another ability score modifier for the attack's damage. This applies to all armour attacks you make against it before the start of your next turn, but not to armour attacks you make against other creatures.

items.name: Choreographed Disappearance
entries: On your turn, you say something to turn a foe's attention away from you or an ally. You or an ally of your choice who can understand you can move up to their speed. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks from one creature of your choice that can understand you. If they end up having obscurement or cover relative to the distracted foe, they can immediately Hide as a free action.

items.name: Defending Advice
entries: Spend a bonus action to advise an ally who can understand you. Choose a non-armour defence. One time before the end of this encounter, that ally can reduce the success tier of an attack of that defence type by 1.

items.name: Direct Ally
entries: You identify an opening an ally can take advantage of. You can spend an action and choose an ally that can understand you, then choose a target. If that ally hits that target with an armour attack before the start of your next turn, their attack deals an extra {@dice 1d8} damage. Thr bonus dice increase to {@dice 2d8} at 5th level, {@dice 3d8} at 11th level, and {@dice 4d8} at 17th level. After you use this trick, you can choose the same ally again, but cannot choose the same target for the rest of the encounter.

items.name: Frightful Suppression
entries: When you make an armour attack that causes loud noises - a firearm or trap, or also any power that deals thunder damage - you can use this trick to force the attack's target (or creatures in the attack's area) to make a save to gauge when it is safe to move, and thus avoid being pinned down. A creature that fails is {@condition sluggish|sns} and can't move while adjacent to you until the start of your next turn unless it spends an action to break out of the suppression.

items.name: Rallying Word
entries: You know just what to say to inspire an ally's flagging stamina. You can spend a bonus action to let an ally within 30 feet who can understand you spend a Hit Die. If it does, it rolls that Hit Die plus {@dice 1d8} and heals hit points equal to the total. The bonus dice increase to {@dice 2d8} at 5th level, {@dice 3d8} at 11th level, and {@dice 4d8} at 17th level. After you use this ability, the same ally cannot benefit from it again until you complete a short rest.

items.name: Sweeping Stride
entries: When you move at least 10 feet and enter a space adjacent to a creature no more than one size larger than you, you can try to trip it. If the creature fails a save, it falls {@condition prone|sns}. If it succeeds, instead your movement ends in the space you entered to use this trick.

items.name: Timely Tool
entries: Spend a bonus action to use an item that normally can be used as an action. This cannot cause damage or make an attack. Examples include administering an antitoxin, potion, or other easy-to-swallow item to a willing creature within reach; lighting a torch; tossing out caltrops, or barring a door.

items.name: Unbalancing Intervention
entries: When a creature within your reach makes a Strength or Dexterity ability check or receives a fortitude or reflex attack, you can use your reaction to perform a series of pulls, shoves, and strikes that put a creature off-balance. The creature has disadvantage on its ability check or the attack roll has advantage.

classFeature.name: Combat Poise
entries: At 2nd level, you choose one of the following poises.

entries.name: A Step Ahead
entries: You have a deft ability to predict your opponents' responses and interfere with them. Whenever a creature within your reach that you are aware of attempts to take a reaction, you can use your reaction to try to disrupt them. That creature must make a save, wasting their reaction on a failure.

entries.name: Combat Maneuvers
entries: You gain the ability to use combat maneuvers. You gain an exertion point pool equal to your proficiency bonus.
Choose two martial traditions. Whenever you gain a savant trick, you can instead choose a maneuver from any of your chosen martial traditions.

You can initially learn maneuvers of the 1st degree. At 7th level you gain access to 2nd degree maneuvers, then at 13th level you can access 3rd degree maneuvers, and finally at 19th level you can access 4th degree maneuvers.

classFeature.name: Analysed Need
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you complete a short or long rest you can choose a skill. Until you complete another rest, whenever you make an ability check using that skill, you use Intelligence instead of the ability score it normally uses.

classFeature.name: Skill Focus
entries: At 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, 15th, and 19th, choose a skill you are proficient with. You gain an expertise die on checks with that skill.

classFeature.name: Skill Focus
entries: At 7th level, choose a skill you are proficient with. You gain an expertise die on checks with that skill.

classFeature.name: Skill Focus
entries: At 11th level, choose a skill you are proficient with. You gain an expertise die on checks with that skill.

classFeature.name: Skill Focus
entries: At 15th level, choose a skill you are proficient with. You gain an expertise die on checks with that skill.

classFeature.name: Skill Focus
entries: At 19th level, choose a skill you are proficient with. You gain an expertise die on checks with that skill.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Additionally, you gain a feat.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you may gain a feat instead of any increases to your ability scores.

classFeature.name: Signature Move
entries: At 6th level, choose one savant trick you know. You are considered to always have that trick prepared, and it does not count against the limit of tricks you can have prepared. When you use that trick, it does not stop being prepared. Whenever you complete a long rest, you can change your signature move.

classFeature.name: Developed Poise
entries: At 5th level, you refine your combat poise. Choose one of the following, or one of the combat poise options available at 2nd level.

entries.name: Empowered Attack
entries: When you use the Attack action, your main hand weapon's base damage is doubled. For example, a weapon with a damage of {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier deals {@dice 2d6} + double your Strength modifier instead.

entries.name: Rational Maneuvers
entries: Non-armour attack rolls made through your maneuvers gain a +1 bonus.

classFeature.name: Intelligent Caution
entries: At 7th level, whenever you complete a long rest, you may choose one non-armour defence to gain a +1 bonus to until you use this feature again.

classFeature.name: Quick Wits
entries: Also at 7th level, on your turn you can prepare a trick without spending a bonus action. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. Thereafter, preparing tricks requires the usual bonus action until you complete a short rest.

classFeature.name: Focused Defence
entries: At 9th level, you can use the confusion of a large battle to protect you. If there are at least two enemies within 30 feet, you can use a bonus action to choose one of them. Until the end of your next turn, that creature has disadvantage on armour attack rolls against you.

classFeature.name: More Tricks
entries: At 10th level, you can have two tricks prepared at once, in addition to your signature move. You still require a bonus action to prepare a trick.

classFeature.name: Exceptional Poise
entries: At 14th level, your combat poise can achieve remarkable things. Choose one of the following, or one of the combat poise options available at 2nd or 5th level.

entries.name: Confounding Defence
entries: The first time each round that you use an aegis, you can immediately prepare another aegis trick.

entries.name: The Opportune Moment
entries: On your turn, you can take one additional action. The additional action that you take cannot make any attacks. You cannot use this ability on the first round of combat. After you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Clockwork Mind
entries: At 15th level, your mental capabilities transcend the normal limitations mortal minds face. You gain an expertise die on all Intelligence checks and a +1 bonus to will.

classFeature.name: Nothing That Can't Be Solved
entries: At 18th level, you can overcome obstacles with ease. When a creature that can understand you starts its turn you can grant it the ability to ignore all sources of disadvantage until the start of its next turn. After you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ultimate Schema
entries: At 20th level, you're clever enough to accomplish anything. Whenever you complete a long rest, choose an effect that could be accomplished by a spell of level 8 or lower. You can have that effect occur immediately, or keep it in reserve for the day, and cause it to occur at any point by spending an action. This can be because your acquired a magic item or spellcaster willing to perform the magic, or have a device or hirelings capable of matching the effect.
